hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a perfect location, close to Penn Station, MSG, subway lines, and the Fashion Institute of Technology (my daughter is a student). It’s also in the flower district, so it’s like walking through a garden heading to or from the hotel. The front desk has been super friendly & helpful. The room is very clean and modern. I love that the floors in the rooms are all hard surface (no carpet). It’s a little small, but then again it’s NYC, so that’s a given. Given that the rate includes a full breakfast, this is a great value.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here January into February for business. I had the most amazing stay. Rooms were very clean and well maintained. All staff were very accommodating and pleasant, always smiling. Daily breakfast was lovely....I really enjoyed the 'do it yourself waffles' and fresh fruit...thank you Tina and the kitchen staff. Others who contributed to my wonderful stay were Wendy(at check in), Kellen (my go to guy), Brittany(during the reservation process), Chong(very helpful 'jack of all trades), Victor('my personal security guy') and Calvin who assisted me with my bags at check out. At the end of my stay, I felt like I had stayed with family and friends. Keep up the great customer service team Fairfield and I do hope to visit again in the future.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a last minute trip to the city booked and needed a place to stay. We were also traveling with a little baby, and after a very early morning flight he was very tired and we were desperate for a hotel we could check into early. After calling Fairfield Inn and speaking with Kellen Sears he assured us we could come right in and check in. It was such a relief. When we got there he took care of us right away and even offered us to have breakfast, which we were so grateful for because after 5 hours of traveling we were hungry! We had a wonderful room that was very clean and had everything we needed. After a nice warm breakfast my husband and my little baby and I all had a wonderful much needed nap before we started our day! Kellen was always so friendly and helpful and really exemplifies what an A+ customer service person should be! The rest of the staff including Janessa and a few others we came in contact with were so friendly and accommodating. It was really a breath of fresh air. The hotel it in a wonderful area in the city with tons of stuff near by and we enjoyed our walks around the area! We truly truly appreciate all the help and accommodations and friendly service and will 100% be back during our next visit to New York!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As others have stated, the location has two major subway lines within one block in either direction, making this a very convenient place to stay. The room was furnished in typical Fairfield Inn style (though this is a standard sized hotel room, not a suite.) The room was exceptionally clean. A small annoyance was the bathroom door was too big and you had to navigate your way around it and the toilet. The breakfast was typically good, and the breakfast area can get very crowded. Checking in was amazingly fast, and they did everything right for my Platinum level from gift/points to room upgrade (this was a nice surprise for a Marriott property lately).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As others have remarked, a very convenient location, close to subways, Penn Station, and Times Square. This is one of 4 or 5 mid-range chain hotels on the same block that are all relatively new. We got a really good rate over Super Bowl weekend, and I just got gold Bonvoy status so we were upgraded to a somewhat bigger room. Overall, this was the best value stay I've had in Manhattan in at least 20 years.Everything in the room worked, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the breakfast is the standard Fairfield Inn breakfast, which I think is the best free breakfast in this class. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Pros:– Easy location– Solid breakfast– Recent faceliftCons:– Not built for humans in the modern era– One power outlet in the room, but at floor level; another one behind the bed, less accessible. Alarm clock on the nightstand, not plugged in, no outlet behind it– DARK: single room light near the bedroom, nothing in the other half of the room. Can't see a thing.– Huge TV right in your face from the bed, cords hanging about– Toilet roll ridiculously low to the floor– I could go on, but you get the point...

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a friends weekend...just two of us. The hotel is a great location. Just south of Penn Station in a floral district. There are a few other hotels on this block so the street was fairly quiet after dark. There’s a subway stop at the end of the block along with a drug store for last minute essentials. Check in was very quick and all the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly. Also have us a free bottle of water upon checkin. The room is modern, clean and small. It’s Manhattan so you have to expect it. They made great use of all the space but we just ran out of room to put our stuff so we just made the best of it. Bed was super comfy. Plenty of channel on the TV and the shower had great water pressure. My only complaint? Not enough power outlets. We had phones, apple watches and a CPAP machine to plug in at night and there was only one outlet near the beds. We made due but in this day and age, outlets near the bed are a must. They offered a free breakfast each more which we had on two of the three mornings we were there. Nothing to brag about...plenty of offerings for everyone. They had Starbucks coffee which was nice. Overall, a nice visit. I would definitely recommend this hotel and come back next time I’m staying in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel is clean, room is comfortable and price is affordable. Walking distance to good Italian restaurant across the street (make a reservation) and GiGi’s cafe around the corner. If you want Starbucks it,too, is just around the corner. Highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Location is perfect. The hotel is in walking distance to the Times Square, to Macy’s and to the Empire State Building. There are 2 subway stations at the 2 corners of the 28th street (both are only some steps from the hotel). In addition Pen station is only 5 blocks from here. We went to see Nets in Barclays center in Brooklyn. Getting there took half an hour with subway R. We went to see Giants the other day in MetLife stadium. It took only 50 minutes to get there by train from Pen station. However we went to have a morning running session in the Central Park and Central Park is 30 blocks away which is a lot. It would have been better to take one of the subway to get to the Central Park first. The complimentary breakfast is delicious and there are a nice variety of cold and hot dishes but during the rush hours (after 8 am) it is almost impossible to have a chair and there is a long row for the food. It happened that scrambled egg and bacon have ran out and their replacement took more than 10 minutes. On the other hand before 7.30 am everything is just perfect for a relaxed and nice breakfast. Our room was small but clean. However I have been a Goldelite member of Marriott Bonvoy for already 3 years and I am eligible for an upgrade we have received a room below standard. The sink was seriously leaking and it took 2 days for the hotel to make it fixed though we reported it upon arrival. Our first 2 days were really uncomfortable because we could not use the sink. Receptionist told us that there was no other room available. The staff was nice but really overburdened. At the reception there was usually only one guy who was also the concierge also.I think we may go back again because the pros are still overtaken the cons.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As many other reviews have said, the location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic for exploring the whole city - for convenience it can’t be beaten in midtown. Yes the room are , in typical NY fashion, on the small side but even as a family with young children we didn’t spend much time in the room.What I most want to mention though is just how awesome this hotel is for families. The staff behind the reception, the breakfast room staff and even the doormen are so incredibly friendly and welcoming to children. We traveled in October with our 5 year old, 3 year old and young baby. They gave the children cookies on arrival to welcome them to the hotel and city. They had movie afternoons where they’d put out snacks and the children felt like they were in a movie theatre. The staff would chat and play with the children and just made you feel welcome. They even made little bags of snacks and wrote us a letter thanking us for staying when we left - so thoughtful.My husband and I have been to nyc several time before having children but this was their first visit and I wouldn’t hesitate to book the Fairfield again. Thank you so much guys, we really hope we can come back to New York and stay with you again really soon!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Our stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan Chelsea was outstanding. The entire staff made us feel welcome, comfortable and relaxed from the moment we entered the lobby until we left at the end of our stay. My husband and I have stayed at other NYC hotels and have never experienced this type of genuine kindness. The rooms were very clean and the beds and linens were top notch. The breakfast offered fresh and tasty food items as well as plenty of coffee and tea choices. The ability to leave our bags pre & post checkin/out was a plus as we had early and late day flights.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Wanted to say the staff were excellent, room was great. The location was central top all my meetings and the rooms were not busy. Glad I got to stay here and thank you very much to Melody who was such a big help!!!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights and were very pleased. The rate was reasonable compared to other places we looked at. The lobby is very small but the staff is helpful and friendly. Giselle at the desk is terrific, with a smile that will brighten your day. Our room was clean and comfortable, with an excellent queen mattress. There is a nice little patio area on the roof. The free breakfast was very good, with plenty of choices. Location is terrific, with the subway nearby, and an easy walk to lots of restaurants, bars and sights.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is the first time staying at this hotel. We arrived to check in around 2pm and we were told it would be 5-10 minutes before the room was ready. Then after that it would be another 5-10 minutes before the room was ready. We hadn't had lunch yet and we were getting quite hungry. We offer to leave and come back later, but we were told, no really it will be another 5-10 minutes. Time after time there were fake promises for the room to be ready. It took us an HOUR before the room was ready. Needless to say we didn't eat lunch til 3:30pm. The room seemed nice until I took a shower. When I turned on the water my feet made the floor of the bath tub black. It happened every time we took a shower. Being that we were wearing shoes & socks it wasn't city dirt. Please mop the floor of your rooms because they were gross. Breakfast is included, but the best thing about the breakfast was the coffee. The eggs, sausage, waffles, etc didn't look eatable. We thought since we are in NYC the bagels has to be good. Think again. We have no idea where they buy their bagels, but they are NOT anything near a NYC bagel. We couldn't even eat the bagel. We come to NYC a few times a year and we know we will not stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Excellent hotel and location. Close to subway. All employees were very nice. Breakfast is ok but since it is included it saved me money so all is good. bed was so comfortable, and black out curtains made for a perfect stay. Have another reservation already made for December.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Have just spent five nights at the Fairfield in Chelsea and it was very comfortable. The first night was a little disorganised as they appeared fully booked and we were appointed a disability room that was quite tight for space and had only been set out for one occupant. The problem was sorted thanks to the excellent staff Wendi and Gissell who were both apologetic and could not do enough to make our stay memorable. Once moved we had a large room, with reasonable size shower room. The room appeared to have been refurbished and had wooden floors and modern fitments. There did seem to be an issue with housekeeping as towels were not left and the soap, cream shampoo had to be requested on a number of occasions.Breakfast was part of the package and was plentiful, with quality products that should suffice most residents. There was an excellent supply of fruit and breads.The hotel is in an excellent location within the “flower” district and within easy walking distance of Penn Station and other key areas of NYC.My only other concern is there are no in room safes, with small portable safes available at the front desk. So iPads etc had to be hidden in cases with passports and valuables carried around, which is not ideal! There should be security in the rooms. Thankfully, we did not loose anything during our stay.Overall, it was a comfortable stay, however, due to the safe issue I would reconsider future stays.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: What a great affordable hotel in midtown Manhattan. The staff was fantastic, always helpful, cheerful and super friendly. The King room was spacious and comfortable. Everything about the room was clean. Breakfast was as expected. Great location with lots of attractions within walking distance. Streets out front filled with flower and plants from the shops. Rooftop deck was enjoyable.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A friend and I were in New York for work. Normally, I prefer staying at full-service hotel, but we elected to stay at Fairfield in Chelsea. It proved to be better than anything I could have expected. Just a few weeks prior we had stayed at two AC hotels, one in Atlanta and another in Denver, and the service we received here was far better. In truth, the services matched what we received while staying at the Ritz in Atlanta the prior month. Samantha, at the front truly made it a special stay for us. She got to know us, inquired about how our days went, and our meetings. She even was generous to send up some treats to help us celebrate the success we had on the trip. There was genuine care and comfort for us at every moment. The personal services were excellent, and we enjoyed a wonderful, warm, and relaxed environment.Thank you again to Samantha at front. We hope to be back soon, and will be staying with you again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Awaiting for room to be ready was here two hours ago and the room is not ready and no explanation is given, there is only one receptionist she thinks it's funny, at the age of 48 this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Don't book here.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great and welcoming staff. Really appreciated the warm welcome.Comfy but tiny room for families (if you have more than two members I would recommend two rooms). The AC is noisy. I believe because the space, the room does not have a mini-fridge. (The coffee maker is in the closet because it doesn't even fit on the table space). Great location. Very close, walking, to subway and Penn Station. Staff was excellent. Breakfast was great. Located in the flower district, it was so nice to walk out of the hotel each morning to all the gorgeous flowers lined up on the sidewalk.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Warm, welcoming, and excellent Customer Service from Brittany, Wendi, Joe, and especially Samantha! They are the BEST! They really made our Girls' Weekend so much more memorable. The location is great with easy access to the subway or bus, and short walking distance to the Hudson Line, and shopping.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very nice hotel. Centrally located. Pretty much can walk to everything. Subway station down the block. We walked to the High line, Hudson yards in the morning before it got to hot. I would stay there again. The hotel is located in the wholesale fower district. They bring out the flowers every morning and put them away at night.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Even simply calling to ask for directions to the hotel prior to my arrival to NY for the first time, I could see they provided great service, patiently telling me how to from the airport from JFK. Once there, they gave me advice on places to grab food and how to get around. Wendy was exceptional and even helped me plan out the best route to get back to JFK for my departure without risking missing my flight. In fact, I am here now with time to spare but was still able to get a lot done before arriving. She also helped me find some materials for business documents to send off. Great experience and all of the staff were friendly and helpful from the receptionists to the maintenance crew. Breakfast was solid and the coffee was nice and strong.If I had to note anything not so great, it would be that my bathroom door was so awkward that you could barely get in to use the restroom. There wasn’t an ironing board in my room, but I called downstairs and received one within 3 minutes, so I can’t quite complain about that. Thank you Fairfield Inn staff for having helped make my first NY experience a good one!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It was an easy walk from Penn station and the many subway lines. It was easy to catch a across town bus on 34th. Nice full breakfast. The best part of our stay was the staff- they were friendly and helpful. No wifi in rooms

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 3 days. The location was great! Located near the subway and transit system and many shops and eateries. Our room was tiny with no view, but it was clean and modern. Free breakfast every morning was nice. All of the employees were Super nice! They all went out of their way to greet us every time they saw us and helped us with directions and such. Special shout out to Gisselle!! You are awesome!! I would definitely recommend this hotel. Its not fancy or anything but it's clean and staff is great!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for two weeks. It was so nice I had to fly my family over to spend the weekend. We ended up taking an extra room cos even more family cam through.. The hotel is neat and always willing to ensure your needs/requirements are met.The people and their kind nature stood out; Happy always smiling and always checking to know if/how they could assist... saw this across the board; from the kitchen staffs to cleaners, security, front desk etc.. I have to shout out Gissell and Samantha! Amazing personalities and would definitely come back when ever I and in town..

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really love this hotel. I live in the D.C. area, but have family in Gramercy and co-workers in Meatpacking. This is a very convenient location for meeting with both. The hotel is not trendy, but for Manhattan gives you a lot of space and a clean/quiet environment.Most importantly, the people working at the hotel are universally awesome! I was there this past weekend, and really enjoyed interacting with Gissell, Samantha, and Genesis. All were super friendly and helpful, and very accommodating to me when I had to modify my reservation last minute due to a family emergency.Thanks for a great experience. This was my third stay in the hotel, and I'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We chose this location for its convenience to the nearby Peloton studio, but it’s a real gem in the city. It’s a great location, the staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and spacious for the city, and the breakfast was very nice for Marriott standards. We will book here when we visit again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 1 night to catch a connecting flightOnly 10min walk from Penn Station Room was small but clean only 10min walk from Time Square Greeted by nice lady when booking in & helped organise a car to Airport following day

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here at Fairfield Inn & Suites. Every employee in the different departments were friendly and accomodating to our needs. No matter what time day or night the front desk always had a smile on their faice. We especially enjoyed Tina Melendez delicious breakfast each morning...the friendly and helpful service was great. We also enjoyed the rooftop! We definitely would stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Pros:- Great location - we had some activities uptown and some downtown, so perfectly situated in the middle!- convenient subway access - clean rooms - two baskets in shower which is a very big deal when mother/daughter sharing a room - friendly staff- Paul Mitchell toiletries replenished every day- free bottled water (HUGE asset in the summer months!)- free breakfast - nothing fancy but always great to not have to pay for one meal Cons:- very small room - nowhere to put suitcases - we had a double so two beds which was great except for very little space. Peeked into a king room being cleaned and they had a nice dresser so I guess it really depends on the type of room- tiny bathroom - very little counter space- view of a brick wall but since we were only in the room to sleep and shower we kept the curtains closed anyway - breakfast ended at 9am during the week but we slept in so only able to use it once Ultimately a great stay, especially for the price.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Friendly and obliging staff. Good location with easy access to the Subway which allowed us to get around the city easily. The staff were happy to offer directions and advice on restaurants, pubs etc. Umbrellas were provided on request due to rainy conditions. TVs were of a high quality with access to the internet allowing us to watch Netflix, YouTube etc. where required. The Rooms were a decent size for two people especially for NYC and the beds were comfortable. Giselle and Kellan were especially helpful at reception. Breakfast was in a small area at the back of the Hotel which gets busy at peak times but the selection was suitable for our needs as we were up early and on the go all day. The Hotel is small and doesn't provide lunch, dinner or a bar. There are a number of nice choices for dinner and drinks within a block or two and the Hotel has a discount offer with a local pub The Triple CrownThe only minor complaint was the lack of shampoo which we had to get from reception ourselves.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The place is OK. Small room but clean, well situated. However, they want you to believe that you will be able to see the Empire State building from their rooftop (the first photo is from the hotel website). The second photo is the actual view from their rooftop

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a last-minute business trip for a meeting in the Gramercy area. As with all Fairfields in Midtown area, it has very compact rooms and of course nothing too fancy, but very clean (either freshly renovated or recently built) and quiet. Close to Penn Station, convenient to Flatiron area.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: What a great find! We stayed here during a recent stay in NYC. The entire property is kept immaculately clean from the lobby to the guest rooms. Housekeeping staff even stopped by the room after we checked in to make sure everything was to our liking and to see if we needed anything.The hotel is itself is located right smack dab in the middle of the commercial flower shops. It was so nice walking through blocks of fresh plants and flowers right in the middle of the city to get to the hotel. It definitely was the best smelling location of our trip!The free breakfast was typical hotel breakfast food, but with a good variety to suit just about any tastes. And the staff was constantly attending to the breakfast bar either refilling or cleaning things. Nothing ever ran low, and everything was just pristine the entire time we were there, and it was fairly busy. And the Starbucks coffee hit the spot.The rooms themselves were very small, but no smaller than many New York City hotel rooms. I do wish there were better lighting options in the rooms, and more electrical outlets in the rooms. But otherwise, the room was very clean and the beds and pillows were super comfy. Since we really were only in the room long enough to sleep and shower, it was adequate enough to serve our needs.What I really appreciated the most was the staff. They were outstanding! They were so friendly and so welcoming. They really went out of their way to make sure everyone had a wonderful stay. And a big shout to Kellen for all of his help. You're awesome Kellen!This is definitely a place that we would stay again. I really wish the prices were lower, but they were standard for NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We just spent 8 nights in this top-value hotel, centrally located in Chelsea/midtown. The light-filled room was surprisingly spacious (my husband sometimes stays in 4/5-star for business, and said this room was very big for Manhattan) with a huge window and well-appointed bathroom. It also has a large closet and plenty of storage - so you can unpack and make yourself at home! I don’t think I’ve ever stayed in a quieter hotel room. Once the door shut it felt like there were no other guests. I think there’s 4 rooms per floor, which may help. Best sleeps ever! The buffet breakfast (hot and continental) was fantastic; we never needed to go out for breakfast and saved our $$$ for more exciting things. Healthy options included oatmeal (porridge), granola, fruit, yogurt etc. The service was excellent and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They even gave all the men a fathers’ day gift pack on Sunday. It’s lovely walking out into the flower district every morning, too. Location-wise, you’re never far from anything - either by Uber/taxi or subway or even foot. There’s a No. 1 train at the end of the street (cnr 28th and 7th), or a subway station with more options a 5-10 min walk the other direction along 28th. Between the hotel and that station there’s also good coffee at Australian-owned cafe Bourke St Bakery.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Not cheap but nothing is in NYC. It has a decent fitness center and a very good breakfast. They need to work on the area where people get coffee since it is limited to one person completing the process at a time. It's a small point but if fixed will help the overall stay. They have a nice rooftop where you could enjoy take out. They should add some noise cancelling around the energy system that currently makes a lot of noise. Room and bathrooms had newer fixtures and the bed was comfortable.
user_name:
worldtravelerT1820IO
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was nice and clean and the rooms were in great condition. It is very quiet for its location. The staff is absolutely amazing. Friendly and willing to help wherever they can. During my trip, even before we could check in to our room Janessa went above and beyond to help me secure a place to take a phone interview. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: For my second trip to NY, knew I wanted/needed a location situated close to Penn Station; checked other Marriott properties (prices) decided to try the Fairfield Inn & Suites Manhattan/Chelsea based on price (reasonable for NY $) which was at least $200 less per night than a higher tier Marriott property and the nightly rate also included breakfast (bonus).>Check-in was quick & efficient.>Room is basic but looked very clean and provided all the necessary amenities. Ladies the blow dryer in the room was decent, no need to bring your own.The view from the room was very "New York" looking at another building, that backed onto a "pole dancing studio" where you could see shadows ... was tempted to take a class! >Breakfast is continental, yogurt, cereal, scrambled & hard boiled eggs, make your own waffles, bacon & sausage, toast, bagels, coffee, tea.Tea & coffee available throughout the day, a small convenience shop for other items you might want to enjoy in your room (eg wine, snacks, etc)There's also a rooftop area that provides a partial view of the city, the air mechanical equipment noise make the space a little less than inviting, but I'm sure with the right group of people the din of the noise would be background only.Staff were friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I am a guest of the Fairfield Inn & Suites at the West 28th Street/Chelsea location in NYC. My husband booked a room for me for the night of Wed 5/22 and I extended for tonight, Thurs 5/23 as well.i wanted to share very positive feedback and give praise to one of your team members, Gissell.I was checking out of my room this afternoon & right before I left my room, I found out that my Delta flight home was going to be very delayed and as I spoke to Delta, there was a high likelihood that it would get cancelled or "timed out" (crew can't work any further) given delays due to rainstorms, so backed up air traffic.I was in the lobby and happened to explain my dilemma to Gissell who was managing the front desk. I wondered out loud, "do I go to the airport and take a chance that my flight would actually leave tonight? Or do I stay another night here in NYC and take the bus home tomorrow?" Gissell kindly let me know that she had one room left available for tonight if I chose to stay and not try to go to the airport. The room available would be my room that I had last night!Finally, after consulting with my husband, talking to him from the hotel lobby, I decided to stay one more night - he booked the room with points and I went back to the front desk to get my keys ... to my same room as last night!I was so appreciative that my room was available and Gissell showed empathy for the trouble I had to go through in deciding to try to fly home or not. (A lot of time waiting on hold to talk to Delta)!Gissell welcomed me back and expressed empathy for my trouble and clearly stated she was happy that I was going to stay another night. Very kind and professional which was what I needed after sitting and deciding what to do.But there is more ...I went up to my room and soon after i entered the room, there was a knock at the door - a young man brought a small basket with goodies - KIND bars, water, some chips, a few candies. SO UNEXPECTED and very appreciated!The basket had a handwritten lovely note from Gissell stating she was sorry that I had to go through so much trouble today and hoped that this basket of goodies would lighten my day a bit. I was so touched.Gissell went WAY ABOVE AND BEYOND in terms of making me feel welcome and I have to say, I have rarely ever experienced such 10-star service in all the years I have traveled for work and for fun.My husband and I are loyal Marriott & Marriott brand consumers and when I called to tell him about this basket of treats, he was amazed.We have lived in Asia and Europe, have stayed in VERY expensive hotels and spa hotels and we can't recall when such a generous gesture was made. This makes me feel highly appreciated as a guest and makes me highly likely to return to this Fairfield hotel when I travel to NYC for work or for fun. This was an amazing gesture and I am thankful for Gissell's professionalism and warm smile and generosity.i will be back to this location soon and I hope to see her again.Thank you for having team members like Gissell in the Marriott family. It's worth our membership!And ... as a side note, this hotel has free breakfast (& thankfully endless Starbuck's coffee) and a breakfast area where you can sit and read and relax.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is my third time staying here 4-5 nights which is a lot in the travel world and every time I stay here I get a low floor and the smallest room they have. I will say, the people that work here are TOP notch. The breakfast is good...the rooms, where I literally dread going back to are just not amazing, which is why I am upgrading my review from poor to average. I will NOT ever stay here again though. I preface all this by saying I am Titanium Elite, just over 100 nights per year and they treat me like an average Joe...I wanted a bigger room(which they have) and can never accommodate me. I want to like this place. Truly...the folks that work here care and listen, but every time I have been here, the one elevator is out and I end up having to take the stairs 5-10 flights. i do not need this!!! Bye Fairfield Inn Chelsea!!!
user_name:
Jeff W
Cabo San Lucas, Mexico

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I didn’t get pictures of the room but it’s in an excellent location. Near the subway, and main attractions. Walking distance to Times Square. The staff was friendly and hospitable. Their showers are amazing and felt like a massage! I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here to celebrate a birthday with family. We found the rooms to be small, and lighting inadequate. Also, the street was crowded with construction and plants (it is in the garden district) that made maneuvering with a car difficult. Very limited space in bathroom (my cosmetics kept sliding into the toilet!) Oddly, there was no hairdryer in the room b/c it would set off the smoke alarm. Otherwise, the location was great. The breakfast room was very pleasant and the staff, both at the desk, valet, and in dining area excellent.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had an early check-in and the front desk agent upgraded our room into a larger room which was awesome! The location of the hotel is good, its near the subway and also a lot of food establishments. The free breakfast was also good with a lot of food choices. The only problem we encountered was we requested for bottled water but they were all out. We also tried calling for some towels because we only had one in our room on our first day but they were also out, but they gave us fresh towels the next day. On our last day, I was trying to get a hold of a front desk associate for 3 times but the wait was so long. But the agents were all friendly. Just hope that they fix their system. but everything else was okay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a quick but welcoming stay at this hotel. The employees were all so nice. I went with 3 other friends who have never been to NYC before and Janessa at the front desk made a cute little welcome bag with cookies and water bottles in it to make sure they felt welcome, she was so sweet! The rooms are a little small, but they were very clean. If i ever find myself in NYC again i will definitely book here again! #PromoteJanessa

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here recently and loved the convenient location to restaurants and subway. Such a quiet pretty street in the flower district. Room was small, bathroom even smaller. No view to speak of. But clean and the staff at the front desk was super helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel gets three stars for its location. It's a terrific location.The breakfast buffet and staff was nice. The rest of the hotel is a mess. The front desk was rude when we tried to check in one hour early. They acted like we were trying to steal their puppies. The room was strange. It had vinyl plank flooring, which was so cold. The room was so tiny we could hardly move around the two double beds. Our luggage was stacked on the desk. There was a single (24-inch maybe) "storage" unit. The hallways are very industrial. The carpet tiles were recently on sale in a local store called HOBO for .10 each. I recognized them immediately as we almost bought some for our basement. Overall it was a big disappointment.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First time in this hotel but many times before in NYC. This hotel is good if you are looking for staying closed to Times Square and your budget is limited. Breakfast is included and it is ok. Cleaning should be better and rooms should be renovated. The location is very nice during the day but not the same at night.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a cruise. We arrived at the hotel very early in the morning, way too early to check in. The staff greeted us very warmly and offered to hold our luggage until we could check in. They even offered us breakfast, which came with Starbucks coffee! They did everything they could to make us comfortable and happy until our room was ready. They even had coupons for a couple nearby restaurants. The room was well appointed and had everything we needed for a good night sleep. Our stay was short but it was perfect.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room and location are okay, but my stay in February was cold! I had the heat on 75 degrees and the room was still cold. The windows are garbage for heat and sound. The floor was so cold all night it was uncomfortable with no shoes. There was no heat in the bathroom. Long night there.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A very well priced hotel close to Penn station/Times Square with the Marriot standards. Great staff at front desk who appeared to take personal interest in each resident. I struggled with code for WiFi and personal intervention by Roxanne sorted it out instantly. My bedroom was very modern and spotless. I was pleasantly surprised by breakfast, it was more like a Full rather than continental. Having the business center and th fitness center is what attracted me to this hotel initially. Look forward to a return.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I travel weekly for work, primarily to New York. I had not stayed at this hotel previously, and I truly wish I had not on this occasion either. The check-in process was awful, the phones were not working at the hotel, despite having the highest level status that Marriott offers, I was not given the room type I booked and none of my travel requests were accommodated, even those supposedly guaranteed by my Ambassador level status. If you are looking for a cheaper hotel with bad service, then this is your spot, otherwise avoid at all costs.
user_name:
smorris777
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is my favorite hotel in New York. It is very clean, in a great location, and has awesome front desk staff. Near many sights like theater, shopping, and madison square garden. The managers do a great job running this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First of all, this is New York, where small hotel rooms are pretty standard. This Fairfield Inn is no different. I've stayed here several times, each time alone and only for a night or two. For those purposes, this place is perfect. It might get cramped with more than one person for more than a night or two. I would never stay here with my family of four, as I fear we'd get a little cramped.I'm generally partial to Marriott (not because they're superior in any way, but that was a loyalty program I chose some time ago and have always stuck with it) and there are a number of Marriott properties to choose from around Manhattan, with several around the Herald Square area. This place is comparable to many of the others and generally go with the lowest price property.This place is nothing special, but of course, if you're staying here, you're not paying for anything special. The place has always been clean and the staff incredibly friendly.If you're looking for a reasonably priced room for yourself for a few nights, you probably can't go wrong with this Fairfield Inn.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The floor in Room 905 hadn't been cleaned/swept in who knows how long! The floors are just filthy! The TV Channel Guide doesn't reflect the actual television stations that this hotel gets. I did speak to the front desk, but that person is useless to do anything. This is my one and only stay at this NYC dump! Marriott should be ashamed to have this property as one of theirs.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Next time you are in the Big Apple please check this place out. The location is ideal —way more than other locations in the city. But the most notable is the front desk staff and their customer service. One other note is the included breakfast that is far above others who offer this benefit.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel was good and the service was great... but the room I got stinks of crappy cooking. The smell is so awful and it’s everywhere. My clothes smell and it will be one hell of a dry cleaning bill for my coat.No amount of perfume is overcoming this.As I’m commuting home I’m regretting the decision to stay there. YUCK!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Out of all the reasonably-priced hotels in the city this is by far the best in terms of location, cleanliness and service. Our stay a few days ago was our second one.Thanks to my husband's loyalty status with Marriott we were able to secure a room on a high floor during both of our stays. The room size is typical for NYC. What I love about it is that it's newly renovated, it's carpet-free, it has floor-to-ceiling windows, and the shower has glass partitions instead of a tub with shower curtains.The front desk staff is what sets it apart from all the other NYC hotels we've stayed in. They're very warm and very pleasant despite the always-busy small lobby filled with guests who are always in need of something. Shoutout to Roxanne who thoughtfully prepared a welcome basket for us and to Giselle who gave us a great dining alternative!The breakfast is standard American breakfast offered by hotels in the same price point and it's free.The hotel is located on the same street as wholesale florists. There's a subway station at the end of the block (Times Square is two stops away), Herald Square and Penn station are a short walk away, and there's a Walgreens nearby for essentials. There's a ramen place, a Korean BBQ place, an Italian restaurant, even a McDonald's just a stone's throw away.Please note that there are several buildings under construction on their block so some portions of the street only have one lane open, this made it difficult to maneuver our SUV into their valet spot. Plus the florists can make a mess on the sidewalk when they're cleaning. Other than that this is really the perfect choice for us in Manhattan and will be our regular base when traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I chose to stay here based on the good reviews, I like the location close to subway, nice room design and furnitures, but several problems just discovered when checked into the room.First, the Executive room size stated on Marriott App is 276 sqft, but it’s actually 243 sqft, Hotel staff came and agreed the stated room size is incorrect. Usually I won’t bother with the room size unless I feel it’s really too small, especially when the front desk told me they gave me a larger room. I really don’t know how it feels to be in their standard room which stated only 180 sqft.Second, I couldn’t find the mini fridge anywhere in the room, so I called the front desk, the staff told me they will only deliver it upon request. Never heard of any hotel handle the hotel mini-fridge this way. Third, when I found no trash can under the desk, I was wondering if that is also delivered upon request? Called again, no, it’s just that the housekeeper forgot to put one under the desk. Of course, toothbrush is also provided upon request, but the front desk staff didn’t mention anything when checked in, you’ll just have to find all those missing things one by one yourself.During the two hours waiting time for the room ready for check in, I found there’s only one front desk staff taking care of everything, when the hotel customers left luggages at the counter for storage, she had to carry all those luggages to the storage room, while she’s doing that job, nobody is presented at the counter, people had to wait until she finished the luggage job which should be done by the concierge or bell boy. It just occurred to me the Fairfield by Marriott seems like running by a family, such a limited working personnel at this hotel.Lastly, when inquiring all those housekeeping related questions, like coffee maker didn’t work, missing trash can, toothbrush, etc. etc. there’s no direct line, had to go through the front desk, so when front desk staff is busy, you have to wait until they’re done with their work at the front desk. It’s indeed very inconvenient especially when you need something right away. The guy who delivered the coffee maker, trash can and toothbrush to my room for several times, I could feel he became impatient at the end, but all those things I asked for should have been provided in the room without even asking, furthermore, I was kind enough not to ask for the mini-fridge to be delivered to my room when I actually needed one.Anyway, Interesting experience at this hotel, but that’s it, bye bye!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here for one night while visiting the city at the holidays. The soft seating in the lobby area was stained, and the restrooms near the breakfast area lacked toilet paper and were not recently cleaned. There was a single person on staff who seemed quite frayed and stressed and rushed but still pleasant. The worst part however was the scratching and scurrying noises we could hear at night coming from between the walls in a corner of our room on the 6th floor. We didn’t sleep very well and didn’t want to eat from the breakfast the next morning. Laundry carts lined the entry outside when trying to exit. Good location but won’t go back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Overall experience was great! Location, staff, cleanliness was all amazing! Even tho the computer system was down, the staff was so helpful and made sure to help us open our rooms-even at 4am!!! Crazy! But shoutout to Michelle at the front desk for being the sweetest! She knew I was in NY to find my wedding dress and even sent me a lil gift bag and it was so thoughtful. Will definitely be staying here again in the future. Thank you!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Whenever I visit Manhattan, I like to stay within easy walking distance of both Penn Station and Chelsea, where I have family that I visit. This Fairfield Inn not only fits the bill on those counts, but it has the added bonus of being smack in the middle of the colorful, bustling Flower District. The hotel itself is a typical tall, skinny Manhattan hotel crammed into a small footprint, so there are only a handful of rooms per floor. I was on a pretty low floor (the ninth), but noise from outside wasn't too intrusive at all. The staff here is extremely nice and helpful and my room was very clean and comfortable. I skipped the free breakfast on both mornings of my stay, as there are so many great places for breakfast and superior cappuccino nearby. But I really appreciated the hotel's living room in the back of the lobby, where there is seating and free coffee/tea/water provided all day long. One day, we bought great ethnic carry-out food from down the street, and were able to relax and enjoy it in the living room. All in all, I couldn't have asked for a more pleasant, comfortable base in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here on our first trip to Manhattan and it was the perfect central location between Central Park and the WTC Memorial. Plus W 28th is New York’s flower district which adds a neat vibe to the streetscape. Our plan was to enjoy the neighborhoods on foot, see the key sights, try local restaurants and retreat to a quiet hotel at the end of the day. This Fairfield was ideal for that. They have breakfast onsite if you want it, a rooftop deck to relax in the evenings and a very friendly staff. High recommend for an affordable yet ideally located option.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a good hotel. It was just perfect for my solo 3-day trip to NY. Just 1 block away from subway lines R-W and 1-3. Staff was very helpful and friendly (thank you Michelle for your support especially with the Amazon packages!). Rooms are kind of small, but pretty standard to NY. Free breakfast was a plus!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First – front desk staff was perfect from moment I checked in, as I came and went on my errands, helping me store baggage for a late flight after check-out, and with every other interaction. There were at least three separate people that were all simply perfect.Breakfast – THANK YOU for using paper products instead of single-use plastic for MOST of your breakfast ware. Find a degradable fork, spoon and knife and you’ll be nearly 100% green. This is so much better than many Marriott properties have done in the past. Service and food was very good, too.Room – great bed, very clean, good use of space, and with minor exceptions very quiet, which is hard to find in the City.If you're an Elite Member, their evening cocktail event means a glass of wine, and in my case, some great chocolate.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My preferred location in Manhattan is the Chelsea neighborhood. The West Side has multiple train lines and Chelsea is convenient to so many areas throughout Manhattan. This property is just a few blocks from Penn Station, as well. In the last few years, a large number of "limited service" hotels have sprung up particularly in this neighborhood. These hotels are typically very tall and skinny with just a few rooms per floor. As the name suggests, these hotels offer limited service...there is no concierge or turndown service, for example. The rooms are small but functional and perfectly adequate. What sets this property apart from the many others in the area is the staff. What a great group running this property...so helpful to make everything work. The rooms are fine...great water pressure, comfortable bed, decent TV and channels, solid heat and A/C, etc. But, it is the helpful people that really makes this my "go to" property in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Staff all very friendly. Room is clean with nice wooden floors. Bed is comfy. Street noise might not be that bad usually but there is currently construction for a new hotel across the way which left a very loud motor thing running all night and the sound went off at 9am. Bring earplugs in case. Included breakfast should have something for everyone. Prices can be very reasonable for NYC given the quality of the rooms. Location is convenient to get around.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea for three nights right before Thanksgiving. The stay did not go as expected. 1.I arrived too early on the first night and there was no room available for early check-in because, according to the front desk, half of the hotel rooms were under renovation. She told me that she'd let me know when the room became available. The notification came at around 7pm. This could have been an issue with the Marriott App? However, while I do understand that this is based on availability,I had requested the early check-in prior to the stay, so I would have appreciated if I was told that this was not likely to happen beforehand. 2.The next day, I found a centipede (a baby centipede, according to the personnel who came to take care of it) in the shower. To be fair, he offered to switch the room for me, but he confirmed that it's not harmful, so I decided not to switch and he made sure that I get the room cleaning later that afternoon. 3.I was going to make coffee in the room only to find that one of the coffee packages has already passed the expiration date...4.On the third day, I asked for a late checkout (guaranteed benefit for Platinum) so that I could take a shower after a workout before I leave but received a notice the day before that the water will be shut off from 11am to 4pm... Had I known this before the stay, I would have stayed at a different hotel and my reservation had been eligible for the chance / cancellation without fee until 4pm the day before. Anyways, I ended up checking out early and took a shower at the gym (not hotel). 5.Also, all throughout the stay, the street noise was considerable so I recommend that you stay on higher floors. There are some good things about the hotel as well. The location was the reason that I chose this hotel in the first place. The people at the front desk are generally friendly. They have free breakfast. The room was clean and didn't have carpeted floor. The room was relatively large; It was at the end of the hallway right next to the closet - maybe it has to do with it? Downside was that there was noise coming from that closet from early in the morning. The check-out process was quick and easy (even though they didn't ask how the stay was). However, given my experience, I don't think I'll stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: There are not a lot of hotels in this area. This is reasonable. Clean. Free breakfast is better than most places. There is an icon parking garage nearby. No need to valet. But remember, this is s very hi traffic area. Plan accordingly. No restaurant but plenty of places nearby.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel is conveniently located. The block is rather crowded but passable. Typical rooms are on the cozy side. On upper floors, rather quiet as long as windows are closed. If the nightly rate works, give the hotel a shot

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in such a great location! Near Zara, Gap, HM, Athleta, lots of other great stores. Breakfast was really good- vegetarian sausage anyone? haven't seen that at a buffet before. Right in the middle of the florist district so make sure you hit the stores for beautiful roses, peonies, etc. Room was very clean, beds super comfy, slider overlooking the street. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Don't judge this hotel by it's exterior or the lobby. Both are a bit grubby and unimpressive. The room we had, though, was very recently renovated and nicely done. Very clean, and by NYC standards, a decent size. Don't think you will get to check-in a second before 3:00. You have to wait and then all guests are allowed into their rooms at the same time. Very odd and inconvenient since your room is clearly ready. I would stay there again simply because of location and room cleanliness and comfort.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for a work trip and it is such a great location! Front desk staff are so friendly and they really take care of their guests. I got some amazing recommendations for places to eat, had a wonderful stay, and loved the ice water on supply. Breakfast food is great as well!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice room, not so big, very clean. The bathroom is confortable, with poor light in the room and in the bathroom, it was really difficult for makeup. The hairdryer is great, I have long hair. Nice bed an pillows. Excelente breakfast, from 6 to 9 am. The staff is very kind. You never wait for the elevator I was in the 8 flour. WiFi work well. I will stay again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Typical NYC Fairfield/Courtyard/Four Points that you would see in the city. Smallish rooms BUT I find that this one in Chelsea has some of the biggest rooms of the Fairfields in NYC. Clean lobby. Very close to Penn Station. On a street with a ton of florists so very pretty outside in the morning, though the street does narrow at the end making it harder for Uber/Taxi drop offs/pick ups. Pricing is NY expensive:) but normally a better price than some of the other SPG/Marriott properties in the area. Staff always goes above and beyond. Super Clean. Quiet. and Free Breakfast!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Typical NYC Fairfield, in that the rooms are smallish, lobby/dining area small, but this is to be expected. Property seems new, rooms and lobby spotless, linens great. Location is super as it's near public transportation and 6th Ave. if you need a cab. Short walk to Penn Station so making the trip from the airport is a breeze. Variety of restaurants nearby, this is a good Fairfield. Small dining room makes breakfast busy, but mgmt. is aware of this an warns you when it's best to come. Great Fairfield all the way around, very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The Fairfield Inn & Suites in Chelsea has an excellent and accommodating staff with a terrific location to nearby Penn Station, Times Square, and Rockefeller Center! In the heart of the city's "Plant District", we enjoyed strolls through sidewalks lined with beautiful plants and flowers!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This location is easily accessible to everything and the subway lines are close by. It’s right in the middle of the flower district and easy walking distance to many places. Valet parking is right in front of the hotel since delivery trucks and work scaffolding line the street. Kudos to Michele and Ashley st the front desk who were helpful to all guests! For me they assisted with my bags and storage of my presentation supplies. Breakfast is standard for the Fairfield Brand. Clean quick and enough to get you started. Loved the room...new and modern it was small like most NYC rooms and with 2 dbl beds if would be tight for a family of 4. Walk mounted TV, no carpeting (love this), desk, two beds, desk and a closet. Full length mirror was great too. Lighting in the bathroom was not great and you have to really lean over the sink to put your make up on. For the date including breakfast this is a great business or couples stay. Friendly, caring staff, clean modern rooms! Loved it!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This property is conveniently located near multiple subway lines with easy access to anywhere in the city. We first arrived at the hotel early in the morning by taking a short walk from Penn Station. The lady at the front desk was pleasant and offered to hold our luggage for us until check in. We went back to the hotel later in the day to check in and found the process to be quick and efficient. Our room was nice and newly renovated. I love hotel rooms that don’t have carpet, and each day the housekeeper did an outstanding job making the room spotless and tidy. We found the mattress and pillows to be perfectly comfortable. The breakfast is your typical Fairfield fare. The variety was good enough, but I doubt it could hurt to have plain unsweetened yogurt as an option. The eggs in these settings can be hit or miss, but we found them to be delicious each morning. We enjoyed the coffee, too. The breakfast room is small, but that's to be expected. We didn’t find overcrowding in the breakfast area to be an issue during our stay.The hotel also has a rooftop patio. Unfortunately, there are huge ventilation fans running up there that are so loud you can’t have a conversation. The rooftop patio is basically only good for going up to check the weather and maybe taking a few photos.The biggest complaint of our stay at this hotel involved the restrooms in the lobby. When first arriving, after having flown across the country all night on a red eye, I had hoped to freshen up and wash my face before going about the day. I was unpleasantly surprised to find the restroom in the lobby didn’t have any soap. Instead there was a mark on the wall where the soap dispenser looked to have been torn off. This restroom was also next to the breakfast area, so it was disconcerting that people probably used this restroom before handling food. The toilet looked as though it hadn’t been cleaned in a week. There turned out to be another restroom around the corner, and as I waited for what seemed like an eternity for it to become vacant, one of the breakfast attendants told me to go back and use the same restroom I had just been in. When I told him it didn’t have any soap, he looked at me like “so what” and went about his business. When that second restroom finally became vacant, I was relieved to see there was soap in there. But as luck would have it there weren’t any more paper towels. I’ve generally found Marriott lobby restrooms to be in great condition, but the ones at this property majorly missed the mark.All in all I’d still recommend this hotel. The price was decent by New York standards, and a clean comfortable room more than made up for any of the drawbacks mentioned.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Handsome Companion and I had occasion to drive into NYC early one morning last week, with a reservation to stay at the Fairfield Inn that night. We parked the car. I walked H.C. to his breakfast meeting spot on the far west side and continued my walk cross-town, with my suitcase in tow so as to drop it at the hotel on my way to my office. I arrived at the hotel’s front desk and was greeted immediately by the clerk who took my bag to store it until the afternoon and invited me to have breakfast with them even though our check-in was not until that afternoon. My stomach had been growling the whole walk east, and the smell from the breakfast buffet just off the lobby was enticing. The prospect of some warm scrambled eggs and fresh fruit was too much for me to turn down. I grabbed a newspaper and settled in at a corner table, enjoying the warmth of the delicious eggs and the chill of the fruit. In ten minutes, I was good to go to my office.I find this hotel perfectly fine for a night or two. If you are a light sleeper, I strongly suggest requesting a room not facing 28th Street as the traffic noise continues well into the early hours of the morning. That noise is soon replaced by the noise of early-arriving trucks delivering the day’s flowers to the Flower District. Essentially, it is almost never quiet. The rooms are not big, but if you have places to go or things to do and want to use this as your base, the Fairfield Inn is more than adequate, clean, well-appointed, comes with a nice breakfast (or two!) and has terrific staff. It’s convenient to just about anything in NYC with the 1 Train less than a block away.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Probably the most worn down, tired Marriott property I’ve stayed at in Manhattan. Room was covered in body-sized carpet stains, broken plugs, unvacuumed corners, a vanity “light” that offered no light and a disheveled lamp with a broken outlet. Did I report it? No. Why? Because usually these problems aren’t symptomatic of a bad room but rather a bad property. And on a two-night stay you just tough it out and remember for next time. (The bed was clean and sleepable.) Also poorly designed- no way to use the bathroom sink unless you walk all the way in the room and close the door behind you. To make matters worse the fitness center was closed for a planned renovation, which was only told to me on check in. The hotel across the street was offering theirs as a replacement, but had the hotel told guests like me this ahead of time I would have made alternate plans as this is a deciding factor for me. The other Fairfield properties I’ve stayed at in NYC were much nicer. Don’t go here.
user_name:
gabetrav
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here for a girls' weekend it September. The hotel was conveniently located, only a short walk from Penn Station. We were close to the theater district, but not right in the middle of it where it was too crowded for us. There are many flower shops on the street that all have their plants for sale out on the sidewalk. This made the street look very nice and smell good. Our room was reasonably priced (for New York city), clean and comfortable. The front desk clerk, Ashley, was very friendly, helpful, attentive, and made us feel very welcome. I would definitely stay in this hotel again when I go back to New York.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Jose was very helpful and cheerful during the breakfast. Ashley in the front desk was very niceNice location easy to arrivemoijhytferdaetyb njigfhu juudfyu hhujgfr hgyhggg hgyhgghh gyybgftuhhftbb hgyhfghhb hguhvgfrggg gyyhvgyh hgyhgderguooojg ThanksGreatfulAndrea
user_name:
andreaoS3966SV
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed for 12 nights at this hotel and it really exceeded our expectations. The location is great, just a block from the subway station, and within walking distance to most attractions, while away from Times Square hustle. The block itself is nice during the day, teeming with flowers from the shops nearby. Rooms have been recently tastefully renovated. We stayed in room 302. The toilet is very modern, a little small perhaps, but not uncomfortable at all. The shower is very spacious with excellent water pressure. The room is nice, with a comfortable good-sized bed, high quality linen, a desk, a small closet, a big drawer chest and an ironing table available. There is also a coffee machine in the room, but the hotel offers 24-hour tea/coffee service at the lobby, so you don't actually need to use it. The only downside of the bedroom is probably the light, too dim in the bed area, something to improve. Breakfast is very good and varied. Make sure to follow the hotel advice regarding the busiest times to avoid waiting. And the personnel is definitely a highlight: kind, polite and efficient. We'd like to specially thank Ashley, Giselle, Roxanne and the rest of the staff for adding so much to such a pleasant experience!!
user_name:
Luciana C
San Carlos de Bariloche, Argentina

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This by far is the best place to stay in the city. Great location and staff is friendly and will assist you in any need you have. Breakfast is all that you could as for. A special thanks to the front desk staff especially Ashley and Michelle who made sure that we had a great time at the hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: They have updated, redecorated, revamped, cleaned up, changed for the better!!!Such a lovely second stay in the last 2 months! I perfect location, service, rooms and breakfast... lovely place to be. I recommend highly!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I went a little out of my way to stay here given the high ratings and good value, and I was not disappointed. Relative to other Manhattan hotels the front desk staff was very friendly, the room (though typical Manhattan size) was clean, and the free breakfast buffet was quick and convenient. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed 1 night there and then went to a different Inn due to prior reservations....SHOULD NOT HAVE! Should have stayed right there at the Fairfield Inn!!!!! The staff was VERY accommodating, room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the hotel is EASILY accessible! Would gladly stay there again! If there was any complaint, it's NOT with the Staff, it's with Marriott.......please get some regular size firmer pillows that DON'T envelope your head so that you feel like you just layed into a marshmallow! Almost every hotel has gone to those kinds of pillows and it is one of the worst things they've done! That being said, the Fairfield Inn and Suites is truly a wonderful Hotel to stay at! Thank you for a very enjoyable nights stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The customer service is top notch! My flight was canceled so I couldn't make it to my reservation and everyone was incredibly helpful and kind! They made a bad situation a little less stressful.I didn't end up staying here, but plan to book it for next time!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed at many Marriotts, and this one was definitely at the top! The service was amazing from start to finish. The staff was warm, welcoming, and remembered details about my husband and I. As it was our first wedding anniversary, they went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated. All requests were immediately fulfilled, and I never saw anybody on the staff without a smile. Special thanks to Ashley for being so incredibly thoughtful. Delightful stay! We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The staff at Fairfield Inn and Suites were some of the most accommodating and helpful people I've dealt with. There was some confusion about our booking and they quickly resolved our issue and upgraded our room. They had a fantastic continental breakfast that allowed us to start our long sight seeing days off right. The hotel is a great central location. Subway stations very conveniently located near the hotel. And only a 10-15 walk to the Empire State Building or Time Square. The staff was so helpful with information about the Subway and sights to see. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice area central for the subway, breakfast was nice,room was on the small side for 3 adult's overall enjoyed our stay and would use this hotel again, central for downtown,close to times square and the theatre's.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great value for our stay, good location near Broadway and the Flatiron Building. New hotel, good free breakfast. Rooms are modern but small. Was not noisy at night and the street is great - full of foliage and flower shops that spill out onto the sidewalks.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Fairfield Inn is tucked away in Chelsea.Rooms are quite small but still totally adequate in my opinion.The staff was very helpful and accommodating with requests and local information.If you are traveling by yourself, or don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, this is a great option.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I travel to NYC a few times a year for work. To be honest I am have never been a fan of "the city", based on some of my past experiences. This was my first time staying in the Chelsea area, and the first time at this hotel. I was super pleased with my experience at the Fairfield Inn Chelsea, the staff was very nice and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. I really enjoyed the neighborhood, very good places to eat, and very positive feel. I will stay at this hotel again when I'm back in NYC!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We loved this hotel. It's located on a part of 28th St that is full of flower and nursery shops. Every morning we awoke to the sidewalks coming alive like mini gardens. The area felt safe and friendly. The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We spent two nights at the hotel and we were very happy with how nice and helpful the staff was. We arrived before check in and they happily kept our bags for us so we could go out and explore. We used the valet service also and it was very convenient. We pulled up right in front of the hotel and unloaded and at check out our car was waiting for us. Our room was very small but that is to be expected in NYC. The breakfast was very good also and the breakfast staff was very friendly and kept everything neat and fresh. We would stay again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel is completely renovated. Breakfast has something for everyone. The staff goes above and beyond especially front desk clerk Roxanne. Will stay there again. Easy walking distance to major attractions in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel completed renovation, rooms are updated and clean. No more dirty carpet and stinky smell. Room are pretty big for NYC. Big TV and lots of outlets. Staffs are very professional, good communication between staffs.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I would give this more a 3 1/2. I didn’t hate it, it was clean and the staff was incredibly courteous. The room was average sized by NY standards. The room itself was very dimly lit, which was very irritating. The bathroom was the worst part. It had a shower with no edge, so the entire bathroom floor was wet. Also there was no type of shelf or countertop in the bathroom to set toiletries.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I am a marriott gold member and have been to many marriott properties. This hotel was also good but the shower was phenomenal. I wish I have a water pressure like this at home. Only little issue I had was the toilet. Toilet doesnt flush strong. It flushes but requires a second try. I guess we cant have both.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was out with my daughter for her summer intern in NYC for a week and Ashley & Michelle made our stay truly "home away from home" - they are very efficient, welcoming and always willing to go extra miles to help everybody! You two are awesome! I recommend this hotel strongly - because of its location and great staff/hospitality.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The WCWV team visited NYC and stayed at the Fairfield Inn - Manhattan / Chelsea. It was so close to every attraction. We walked down the Avenue of Americans to Broadway to Time Square to Central Park - a complete walking square! Amazing hotel and outstanding staff - the breakfast was wonderful! World Class Wedding Venues thanks you!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Staff is friendly but not well-informed, so misinformation is passed along to consumers. Internet is Unreliable. Plumbing is at times Unreliable. One pillow had a streak of bright colored lipstick, which made me wonder if they re-use some linen. Unless you get a super cheap rate, AVOID or you'll be disappointed.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Derrick and every member of the entire front staff absolutely made this trip a stress free adventure for me traveling with both my sons and my retired parents. My mom was completely stressed to be in NYC but really wanted to go to the 9/11 memorial and museum. Derrick put them on a low floor (Dad's walking with a cane) and made accommodations for the rest of us so we could be on the same floor. This hotel is small, and feels very safe for non NewYorkers. The 9/11 site is literally 3 blocks away, even Dad was ok to walk there - though the staff did offer a wheelchair for our use (which Dad declined due to stubborn pride). Our double deluxe room was quite large for the Manhattan location and very well appointed. We did not have any challenges waiting for the elevators. We will absolutely choose this hotel over several others I have stayed at in this area for work at WFC. The staff ABSOLUTELY made the difference. We had an amazing time and have the staff to thank for it!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Can't beat the location. Short walk to Penn Station/MSG and to 5th Ave and Broadway St. Staff is very attentive. This is not a large hotel, but is clean, neat and convenient to many restaurants and places to visit. Very friendly and helpful staff from the folks tending to breakfast to the front desk staff and the manager. I stay here monthly and often get an e-mail from them before my arrival welcoming me and one after I leave asking if everything was OK.
