Yes, it was expensive, but not as expensive as some other hotels 'closer to the the action'. Our room had two double beds and full bath. The room itself was tiny that's for sure. But it was clean so we couldn't complain.The hotel seems to be around the flower/florist district. Lots of these similar shops in the area. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and always with a smile. You are a short walk (100') from 6th Ave so it's relatively easy to catch a taxi. From this location, the taxi rides aren't too costly (depending of course on where you are going). Plus there are many areas that you can get to by simply walking from here too.On my next trip to NYC, would I stay here again? Possibly. I have no complaints really. If the price is right and it suits my location needs, yes, I'd stay again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I spent Thurs-Sunday night there while visiting my daughter who is in NYC for work for about a month. Room was very small (it is NYC) but it was quiet, clean and comfortable, wifi worked well, and shower had lots of hot water. Rooftop terrace is nice. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast room is small but I could always sit down (I get up early) and they never ran out of coffee. Pretty convenient location. It is a Fairfield Inn, not a Four Seasons. You probably can't do any better for $110/night within walking distance of midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We have booked this room in advance for New Year's Eve.Arriving at the hotel the gentleman who welcomed us was very nice giving us the hours of breakfast and the WiFi password.We have booked a room with a view,they gave us a room on the 7th floor,good location of the room,small for the criteria of the American size of rooms with a small bathroom.We spend 12 nights and from the 3rd night we saw that the cleaning service was awful.They didn't vacuum the room(not even at the main hallway of the elevators),the cleaning lady only changed us towels and never took care of cleaning the bathroom properly.The room was never dusted and I myself had to do the job,which is unacceptable(I was there for vacation),OMG. From the moment we saw this fact I immediately went down to the front desk to clarify the issue,they told me they will notify the cleaning service,but nothing was done,until our departure.Next day I went back again,zero response to our request.Shall I say more when you are paying an amount of money for a hotel???Every day we had the same problem and nobody took care of it.Ohh and sheets are change every three days.Breakfast area was small for the amount of guests they have but the service during breakfast was very good.The only plus is the location,where you can easily walk to Times Square in 5 minutes and 3 minutes from Macy's. Oh a little hint for those who will probably book in the next 6 months from now...a building is under construction just in front of the hotel so the lower level rooms(like 7th floor)will not have a view to the Empire State Building.Next time I will definitely book in another Marriott...

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My sister's families from Delaware and my mom came in from Asia; happy to book the hotel under friends' recommendation.They checked in Friday; were never informed that weekend construction will start (at 6AM!!!) until their arrival.Never again.
user_name:
pollyanywhere
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The Fairfield Inn is located in an up-and-coming area of NYC with lots of restaurants and is within a short walking distance from Penn Station. Rooms are nicely furnished and spacious, with decent bathrooms. I stayed at high floor rooms and there was little street noise. Still, spending $350/night at times at this location gives you pause and raises expectations.I normally ignore reviewers who report one-time mishaps. Crap happens. But having spent more than a day every week in a hotel this year, I finally 'won' this dubious raffle at this Fairfield Inn: I woke up in the morning with no water, never mind hot water, in my room.Luckily I did not have any customer meetings that day, but it is unimaginable to arrive unshaven and unwashed to a meeting? The disruption is dramatic.Nonetheless, the hotel staff knew of the issue and offered no remedy whatsoever. No 'go to hotel X to shower'. Barely an apology. My call to Marriott's customer service led to a 10,000 point credit. Underwhelming. The fact that there was no response or thought was striking and really disappointing.So yes, this is a single instance, just one time when this happened to me. Nonetheless, I am never coming back to this hotel. Lots of other Marriott hotels in NYC. I'd avoid this one.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. Excellent location and a nice room which had a good bed and nice bathroom.Not worth the price that we paid but thats new york at new years. Only negatives would be the breakfast area is too small and the wait for breakfast is too long. Overall i really enjoyed my stay though.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Overall we had a good stay! One star was removed as it cost us $1800 Aus for just 5 nights! The room is equivalent to a 2 star Australian hotel room that you can get for $80 a night back home so it was very shocking to see that price, knowing it is New York and is very expensive to stay here we expected the price we just expected a more modern room for the price. Otherwise the room was the size we expected for NYC, just couldn't believe the price, however we did stay for new year, hence the price increase. Breakfast is included, all the hot food was always cold and coffee and tea are meant to be provided all day however they are always empty. Everyday we came and stocked up the tea, creamers, and sugars and cups from the cabinets below as they were ALWAYS empty, and had to constantly ask for coffee and hot water to be refilled which took them 20 minutes so we never bothered to wait. They provide coffee in the room however only provide ONE coffee pod of regular coffee a day (we have 2 people in our room) we asked twice for more coffee to be brought up to our room because the machines downstairs were always empty and we were on the 15th floor and the elevator takes 20 years to come, however the coffee pods never showed so we never had access to the complimentary coffee at all times that we were meant to have. That was disappointing, we thought the service would be better than that and that if you ask for coffee pods they should be brought up, but nope! Otherwise we greatly enjoyed our stay in NYC for new year, however we stayed in 2 different New York hotels (both by Marriott) and the other one was way cheaper and wayyyy newer so definitely wouldn't return to this Chelsea location during our next stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Aesthetically there is nothing wrong with this hotel. It was clean, and (almost) everything functioned as it was supposed to.We checked in on New Year's day, 2017. The front desk clerk was not overly helpful and we did arrive about an hour before regular check in time of 4:00 (which seems like an excessively late check-in time). They held our bags, but, I would suggest watching them because our bags almost got carried out with other bags that they had just pulled out of storage. That there-in seems to be the biggest problem with this hotel. The staff does not have any way of doing anything in an organized manner.Supposedly there was 24 hour complementary coffee available, but, every time I went to get a regular coffee it was completely empty. Likewise, the breakfast buffet had no one to ask or assist and they were out of everything an hour before it was supposed to shut down (and again out of coffee #@%#^$). Luckily there was a Gregory's coffee close by that satisfied my morning caffeine craving :)When we finally got to our room it was freezing. I turned on the heat and the heater only blew cold air; I checked and made sure that the thermostat was set to heat and it was, but, it still just kept blowing cold air unless I turned it all the way up to 78 degrees and then it got so hot you couldn't stand it, but, anything less than 78 and there was no warm air. In general I can't say that I wasn't pleased with the stay. It offered the amenities that we wanted with no frills that we needed while in NYC. I just think the staff needs to organize, focus on giving guests a superb experience, and also respond with solutions and not just road-blocks to why something can't happen (like: I'm sorry our handyman has already left for the evening and leaving it at that -- ummm...how about offering a room change when the heat doesn't work in January?).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: we stayed here after a through hotel search and fiund out for best price for most appropriate location for shopping time square Broadway shows relatively more quite and several other factors.we were very pleased with our choice here where entire hotel people were extremely friendly and rooms were always very clean without an error. we stayed at elit level but found rooms to be on the a bit smaller but we knew that extra room would have cone at a significant extra costwe were happy with our stay so i recommend everyone

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First trip to New York, great place to stay, super courteous and nice. Only a short stay but would recommend to anyone. Great staff and close to the subway. Only a 20 minute walk to times square and just a block from pharmacy.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The staff was exceptional! The staff went beyond our expectations to make our stay in NYC enjoyable. Will gladly use this hotel again!Having a quality breakfast each morning was easy on the finances in the city!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had a great stay recently. The hotel is just outside of mid-town in Chelsea. There are several decent restaurants close by. The room is pretty modern, small, and clean. I was a little worried by construction site across the street but sleep quality was very good during my stay. Room charge was very reasonable for Manhattan and included complementary wi-fi. Staff were friendly upon check in and check out.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were in the city for a long weekend following a professional conference. The location on 28th street was perfect. It's tucked just far enough away from the more congested areas of mid-town that it was quiet, but close enough that we walked almost everywhere. A pretty easy walk up to 34th street to/from Penn Station. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The breakfast can get a little crowded if the hotel if full - especially between 8 and 9 a.m. There is a wonderful rooftop deck o the 27th floor that looks directly onto the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We arrived to the hotel and upon check-in we were told the room/floor we were promised over the phone that morning was no longer available. When my husband asked what happened, we were told that since we were using points and not cash for our entire stay - they put cash paying customers ahead of everyone else, regardless of how long you are staying. We asked to speak with a manager, and she finally came out 15-20 minutes later. My husband asked why a phone call hadn't been made when they realized they weren't putting us in our promised room, he was told it wasn't top priority for them to follow up with customers. It literally ruined our entire time here. When you check into a Marriott hotel (especially when you are an Elite customer) you expect to be treated with respect and courtesy - we received neither. The manager said "she would take of us", but we have yet to here from her. We have been here for 6 days and leave tomorrow. I would not recommend this hotel and we will be following up with corporate about this after we return home.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: What a great accommodations find in the heart of Chelsea that is rather reasonably priced, has an awesome welcoming and attentive front desk staff, and serves a bountiful breakfast with a rich assortment (I realize it is standard variety of food at places like Fairfield) in an inviting bright space. Look forward to returning and venturing upstairs to what looks to be a phenomenal rooftop.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really enjoyed our stay at this centrally located hotel. We didn't spend much time in our room but the hotel was very clean. Small room but standard for NYC. The breakfast was very good for inclusive breakfast standards. (Scrambled eggs and bacon, oatmeal , yogurt and fresh fruit).The location is in the floral district. So refreshing to walk out of the hotel and be surrounded by fresh flowers.The subway station is very close. The value is very good especially if you don't plan to stay in the room much. Will be staying here the next NYC visit!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Fantastic location - Close to Chelsea Markets, Flat Iron District, subway stops etc. The staff were very helpful, from the moment we checked in to the moment we left, they were quick to answer any questions and did so in a professional and friendly manner.The rooms are small - but you're not in NYC to stay your room! They are clean, beds are comfortable, and ours was fairly quiet. There was no real view from the room, however the rooftop offers an excellent view of the Empire State building, and a couple of blocks away is "230 fifth" - a rooftop bar with an amazing skyline view. It's heated and has 'igloos' on the top so it's accessible even in the winter months.We tried to do breakfast during our 4 day stay, but it was too busy, and not stocked well enough to account for the influx of people. We arrived most days between 730 and 8 - so perhaps this is a busier time period? you aren't short of choice in the area anyways, and most mornings we ended up at Tobys Estate near the flat iron building.I would definitely recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Excellent location for getting around. Double room was small, but very nice and clean. Breakfast was a nice start to the day, but get down early. Area is very quiet and close to subway, which is a big plus.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A nice Fairfield Inn, conveniently located on 28th between Sixth & Seventh Aves. No restaurant/Bar but a good breakfast area that is included. Several local restaurants are within walking distance. Mustang Harry's is at the end of the block on 7th. Clean, consistent housekeeping. Free Wi-Fi throughout the building. Nice breakfast offerings or hot & cold items.The staff is typical Marriott in addressing any concerns or problems. I needed a new TV installed and it was done before I returned for the day. Good cable selections.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really like this hotel. With a complimentary breakfast and comfortable bed, it was a great place to stay for a couple of getaway nights in NYC. Since it was within walking distance of Penn Station I didn't have to pay for a taxi. Front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming. Some caution: I walked right past this place on the other side of the street because it is next to a garden center and its shrubs obscured its sign and I didn't realize I had passed it until a block later. Most buildings on the street don't have street numbers on their front. Also, the earlier you can get to breakfast the better. It gets really, really crowded and the staff has some difficulty keeping up with the demand. Also, I was surprised when the housekeeping staff removed my personal water bottle from the desk in my room, something I was using during my travels. And the hvac in my room blows air right over the bed, which was uncomfortable until I fell asleep. But the view of the Empire State Building from my room at night was awesome. Overall, the place was very clean and updated and if you don't mind these inconveniences, it is going to be a great place to stay.
user_name:
DCSVPE
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location , friendly staff , decent breakfast . Rooms are small and bathroom is even tinier . The cleaning staff was mediocre .Must see - rooftop deck . Beautiful view of the Empire State Building and the old Met bldg

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The beds were perfect to get a much needed rest, the staff was amazingly helpful, this was close to everything we needed. The view was amazing, everything was just perfect, I couldn't find one thing wrong with this hotel except I had to wait an entire minute or two for the elevator, but that is the only "bad" thing I could come up with so that makes this an excellent hotel to stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I enjoyed every minute of my stay at this hotel. We asked for early check in and when we arrived, I was very happy that in fact the roon was ready, The room was clean and perfect for a NYC hotel.Our room (4th Floor) had a perfect view of the Empire State Building. Close to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, which was the reason we were in NYC. The staff was great and always willing to help,

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really enjoyed my (quick) stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites. It was a short walk from Penn Station and conveniently located in Chelsea. The staff was friendly and my room was immaculate upon check-in. I was able to get a good night's sleep and look forward to staying here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed here 14 times in last 3 years when we visit our son who lives in Chelsea. Rooms are always clean and they do a great job trying to accommodate early arrivals. Breakfast is good. It is within walking distance to many of the popular tourist sites and restaurants. We do not even consider staying anywhere else. City view rooms have an awesome view of the Empire State Building.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I've had all types of hotel stays in Manhattan from very good to very bad and you typically get what you pay for. This Fairfield location was outside the norm. The rooms were a good size for NY, and I was impressed that they were well appointed and looked like they were new. Breakfast was great and it was a bonus that my meetings were only a couple of blocks away. This hotel may become my go-to when in Chelsea. Clean, quiet, easy to get around, all winners in my book!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for a night while in the city and it was a wonderful experience! The staff was very friendly, especially the guard and woman at the front desk. They have complimentary breakfast where you can make your own waffles and it had the basics (eggs, bacon, bananas, yogurt, cereal, waffles) plus 24/7 Starbucks coffee and tea available. We had to print out tickets for a Knicks game and they have a free computer and printer as well! Plus, the location is just half a mile from Madison Square Garden, about 25 minute walk from Times Square and there are tons of great restaurants near by. When you go, make sure you grab some coffee and head up to the rooftop. They have a great patio with chairs and couches out there where you get a beautiful view of the skyline at night! We'll definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our second time to stay at the Fairfield on 28th. Since last year they have upgraded all the décor in the hotel and the rooms. The Pent House Roof was a welcomed surprise. Great view. The hotel is located in the flower district. Wholesale and retail florists everywhere. Great fragrances and what a wonderful site. Close to many nice restaurants on 6th Ave...and lots of good shopping within 2 blocks.The hotel rates are good and the staff is excellent as well a bilingual. We will continue to stay here on all our future visits.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This first visit was amazing. The room was comfortable and very clean. Hotel management went out of the way to make us feel cared for, especially the manager, Kevin, who gave his personal phone number and encouraged us to call if anything came up while we were out and about. He also gave great suggestions about the special features of the hotel (roof top lounge area with fantastic view of Empire State Building) and eagerly answered any questions we had even if they were out of the ordinary. This was a great location and an interesting close-to-everything spot. Outstanding service was its hallmark.
user_name:
bern919
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is located near the Empire State Bldg. and you can see it from the front of the hotel, especially at night when it is lit up. The hotel is new inside and very clean with a free breakfast that is quite good and has very good staff. The rooms are small as usual for NYC but it has all you need. Hotel has fitness center also. Subway on corner of 28th. It is in the flower district so flowers line the sidewalk in front of the hotel every day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in a very convenient location. It is walking distance from Penn Station ,Madison Square Garden, and Koreatown for great restaurants. It is on a lovely street in the Flower District,seasonal flowers and trees lining the sidewalks in front of shops. The rooms are fine,a standard free breakfast, and very friendly and helpful front desk staff and room cleaners. Perhaps the best feature is the Awsome rooftop patio with a view of the Empire State Building. We will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The staff was pro-active in providing help for car service, other transportation, directions, restaurants among other items and also followed up to see if you were satisfied. The front office manager, Kerwin Francis, and staff checked to make sure the other services provided were satisfactory, such as breakfast, clean rooms, 24/7 coffee.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is centrally located in mid town NYC and is only a 10 min walk from Penn Station which makes it easy to get to from the airports. Also being in midtown it's convenient to go uptown or downtown by walking or other public transportation. As a nice bonus there are a number of flower wholesalers which share the street so it always smells fragrant walking into and out of the hotel.The fantastic location is the first reason we booked here but the service of the staff really distinguished this hotel from others we have stayed at in NYC.When we arrived at the hotel and was warmly greeted by Kevin C, the Operations Supervisor, and Jillian L. this was the first sign that things were going to go well with the stay. Each subsequent member of staff warmly greeted us and welcomed us. Kevin clearly explained all the hotel amenities and quickly checked us in. There is free breakfast which is a definite plus in NYC, that's where I met Kerwin the front desk manager, and was really impressed with how attentive he was with the each guest. This was one of my best stays at a Marriott property due to all the staff from the front desk to the breakfast staff and housekeeping.The rooms are clean and modern with plenty of power points along with USB powerpoints which saves the hassle of carrying so many plugs. Bathrooms are clean and have plenty of water pressure. The beds are good quality with firm mattresses and good bedding. Very happy with the room and was comfortable during our stay.Highly recommend this hotel and will stay here in the future.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Whenever we need a hotel in New York, I call the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chelsea. I have sent many colleagues and groups here in the past few years. They never let us down. All the staff go above and beyond to make their customers comfortable. On our most recent visit, Keisara and Kevin, Front Desk, were fantastic - so kind and helpful.Thank you to all at Fairfield Inn & Suites.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here for three nights during a visit with our daughter. The location is close to Penn Station, an easy walk even pulling a suitcase. Also close to subway stations. It is in the Chelsea neighborhood, flower district. When you come out of the hotel gorgeous flowers lined the streets! We were in room #1701. Small but typical for NYC. The lighting wasn't great, especially in the bathroom. Difficult to put makeup on in that light. And very little space around the sink area to set anything down. The bed was very comfortable.Every staff member that we encountered was extremely friendly! Nice to see in a city that can be very unfriendly. I do wish they had told us that "PH" was not the penthouse floor. It was a rooftop patio! We would have enjoyed it during our visit if we had know before our last night there (found out from a young guy in the elevator).typical continental breakfast, just ok, but lots of choices. The only issue we had was being given a bath towel full of holes. I was surprised housekeeping even hung it because the holes were noticeable. I took it to the front desk upon checkout and they said they would give us some extra rewards points. I'm sure they will show up on our account soon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: when we got there the outside looked very good. when we got inside i started to fell less exited about the inside. when we got to our room the room was very cramped. there where two of the smallest beds i ever seen. there where a small tv and that was about it. also the smell of the room gave me a terrible cough. after that though, it got better. the smell cleared off and the bed felt better. after the night was over it was up from a 2 star to a 3.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have been traveling to NYC for work/leisure for the past 9 months. Initially I hopped around from a few different hotels before coming across this one. Since then I stayed exclusively at this hotel for roughly 6months straight. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. NYC can be an expensive city so having breakfast included is a great way to keep expenses down and something that should not be overlooked. Additionally the location is great. You can walk to MSG, Penn Station, Times square, Empire State building, etc. While all these locations and more are walkable you don't have to deal with the massive crowds/congestion of times square at this location. There are plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. Additionally the proximity to Penn Station makes taking the LIRR to JFK extremely easy and makes planning trips to the airport without the worry of traffic.The rooms themselves are not massive but they are clean and accommodating and I had no problems with my oversized luggage bags fitting. Additionally if you plan to visit NYC and desire to spend the majority of your time in any hotel room then you need to reevaluate why you are visiting NYC.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit NYC for a brief or extended stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Positives first. Great bed and shower. Important but that's it. We had room 201. Very cramped with lots of faulty equipment. We booked 4 nights but moved on after one. Breakfast room is nice but poor quality items. I can't stand plastic cutlery and cardboard plates. It's got to be cheaper washing proper plates. There is construction going on outside and the building noise is constant. Were happy to leave. The picture is the view from our window.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I like Marriott hotels and generally I write good reviews but I was disappointed in this one BUT it's not down to the staff who were polite, it was down to what is happening around the hotel,.Firstly , arriving at the hotel the pavement is blocked by what is becoming a giant garden centre, the shops spilling out onto the street and constant blocking of pedestrians and for me arriving with a suitcase it was ridiculous, not sure why it is allowed, the plants were really nice but not when they are blocking your path, the vendors are constantly sweeping up and carting great big bushes around. Now, if you have allergies or the bugs like you that's a second problem, so use insect repellant and have your allergy tables on hand, mainly pine , conifer if it bothers you. I had a great view of the Empire State Building, unfortunately between us was a building site, well a few in fact, opposite side of the road, and at the moment they are putting in the piles for the foundation. What that means is an excavator ramming in rods into the ground with a huge hammer, pretty much every 2 seconds and seemed to last all day (including Saturday) so dont ask for the view if you want to relax. The hotel is constantly getting cleaned which is good, if you don't want to climb over bags of rubbish ask for a room away from the lift, ( the lift also makes a noise like trainers on a squash court when it goes past you floor)Finally, papers plates and plastic spoons and forks,paper cups for coffee for breakfast, bizarre Not for me, sorry not a Marriott

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were attending an event at MSG & needed a place to stay just for the night. The price was decent & it was close enough to walk to & from. There were 4 of us that stayed in a room. 2 adults & 2 children. This had to be one of the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in while visiting NYC. There was barely enough room to set our bags on the floor without getting in the way. It was clean which is PRIORITY. The bathroom was tiny & the shower curtain wasn't long enough causing water to get all over the floor. There is a breakfast included & I was pleasantly surprised in the variety of food provided. Scarmbled eggs, potatoes, sausage, muffins, bread for toasting, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal and make your own waffles along with Starbucks coffe, tea, milk & juices. Not too many tables in the dining area but we arrived early enough to get seating. All in all, it was ok. We were in the hotel less than 24 hours. Probably wouldn't stay again only due to general location as we had to take the subway everywhere the next day. We would rather walk.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at the hotel last week, commencing Sept 1st, from the moment we arrived the staff were just incredibly friendly, I mean each & every staff member. They are a credit to the Marriott Group. The rooms are small, the breakfast choice is excellent. Free Starbucks tea & coffee all day with delicious cookies in the afternoon.From the moment we arrived Ashlei and all of the staff were just incredible, they could not do enough for us, they are undoubtedly the most pleasant & friendly people that I have ever met in any hotel worldwide.They never let us pass by the reception without wishing us a good day etc, the staff that looked after the dining room & the staff that do the house keeping are the best ever. We felt at home, the penthouse lounge / seating area offers great views of the city. The location is great & within walking distance to all areas also served by subway & train at either end of the street. Restaurants & bar choice are excellent in the area. A gym is also available free of charge. Maceys two blocks down the street. P Harte.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: After Spending hours trying to find a reasonably priced hotel in NY during fashion week I found this little Gem!! No resort fees, good location. Close to transportation. Check out was not until Noon. Breakfast was included. Nice bed Linens and comfortable bed. Rooms are clean and spacious. This will be my 'go to' hotel in NY city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Ashelel,The receptionist check us in with a snap. She was very friendly and helpful. She was just what I need.This was a escape from my children for just a day.The room was very nice.New York Style! I'm in love with this place. You guys rock!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My family visited the hotel on our recent stay to New York and could not be happier! The housekeeper manager Amrita Bangari and her fantastic staff did a outstanding job in making sure our family was taken of from the clean hotel to the courteous and helpful staff along with the fantastic breakfast in the morning. Whenever we travel to New York we will always stay at this beautiful hotel. God bless you all

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My family and I have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Location is great, Walking distance to time square, Subway is few minutes away from the hotel. I have a nice view of empire status building from my room.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Sometimes the staff makes up for any shortcomings of a hotel. We stayed on Saturday night. Check in was fast and easy and greeted with a smile. Valet parking was $55 for the night but literally had 2 days of parking (that's important in NYC) the front desk even held our bags after checkout so we could eat lunch then return to pick up the car. Location of the hotel is great we were able to get to meatpacking district and midtown within minutes and being in the middle of the flower district was nice scenery as well. There is free starbucks coffee in the lobby ,free breakfast from 7am-10am (I love that this was a late breakfast I always wake up to late at other places that offered), and free bottled water if you ask the front desk. The rooms are clean and air condition is quiet and works well. Bathrooms are nice, good water pressure in the shower, hair dryer available and Paul Mitchell amenities. The staff at the front desk, housekeeping and maintenance are all so nice. We asked for late check out and they said yes without hesitation. Ok, now the shortcomings...but nothing that was not handled appropriately and with a smile. The toilet would not flush on 3 occasions and maintenance had to be called (not our fault...just flushing mechanism did not work). The second time called was in the morning and took over an hour to get someone to fix it. We did have a bit of a wait (30min+) when we called valet for the car but the front desk did notify us of the wait time prior. The room smelled musty when we first went in for about 15 minutes until the AC cleared itself (front desk offered to give us a new room without question but we declined as the smell went away). Breakfast does get crowded even though there is a good amount of seating- we ate in the lobby on the couches...perhaps they need more outdoor seating. The hair dryer might have been overheated as it got very very hot without a lot of air probably would have burned my hair so it was not used. In the end the front desk (each person from night shift to morning) was extremely kind and accomodating. They acknowledged the problems with the toilet and took care of us appropriately. I would definitely book this hotel again due to hospitality, location and the extremely comfortable bed.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: From the moment I was welcomed to check out, service at the front desk was excellent. My room was clean, cool and comfortable. The only thing that was less than ideal was the breakfast. It was crowded, chaotic and not particularly clean and not enough places to sit. But the food -- once you got to it -- made for an easy start to the day.I look forward to returning.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Good option with affordable price in the heart of NYC, just few blocks away from Empire State Building. The hotel seems to be a little bit olde and the room is not so good but it's perfect if you will not spend so much time in the hotel.There was some construction close to the hotel so the noise started everyday at 7am.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was deciding between staying at this hotel or another one at the Times Square.Many reviewers say that it is noisy at the Times Square, so I chose the Fairfield Inn, a few streets away. That turned out to be a wise decision. It is within walking distance to many attractions, and yet far from the noise and lights at the TS.This is a hotel in a small building. I almost drove past it without realising it as the sign was small.Counter staff was always friendly and smiling. I am especially appreciative that they kept my GPS unit when I left it at the couch in the morning without realising it. I would have been very lost without it on checking out.Breakfast was adequate, the eating area was interesting. The ceiling was glass and that allowed plenty of sunlight through.Room was small, the 2 double beds in the room were almost touching the opposite wall. I suppose real estate space is expensive in NYC.Bathroom was adequate and updated. Most importantly, it was clean and well stocked. Water pressure was good, WC pressure was awesome!Guests can access the highest floor to have a glimpse of the night lights around the hotel.Check out was a breeze.Only grouse with this place? They limit free WIFI to only 3 devices. That's really cruel in this day and age.Oh, one other thing. There is no onsite parking. Parking is a short distance away. Remember to get the ticket validated by the counter staff for a discount.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights during a business trip. Pros:Hotel is conveniently located, especially for tourists. Rooms are decent enough. Cons:I find it expensive for the value of services. Base prices are expensive and on top of that those essential tax components. Hotel service staff are pretty average and indifferent. My room was extremely dark with only one light in the room near the main door. Breakfast is quite minimal (standard items in US hotels) and boring. Overall I'm not very impressed, but I believe this is what you get in NYC and US in general.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Chose this hotel to try staying in the flower district. Great prices so I splurged for a City View (should be a great view of the Empire State Bldg) on a high floor. I am a Marriott Silver Rewards member which normally means something, but not to this hotel. Was placed on 8th floor (of something like 20 floors, so not so high). We arrived midafternoon, so we went up to our room to rest before going to an evening broadway show. After resting 10 minutes, the construction noise started, and simply did not stop. Looking outside, I could see the building that was being replaced, as they were scraping out the remaining foundation. We left for our dinner and show, and contemplated our choices. When we returned, it was pleasantly quiet. The next morning, the noise started at 7 AM. We couldn't sleep, so we went down for the free breakfast. The place was packed - the 2 empty tables were desperately in need of cleaning, and half the food items were out. The 1 lady working the area could hardly keep up with the demand. I had 2 hard boiled eggs with a yogurt, a far cry from the promised scrambled eggs, made to order waffles, fresh fruit, etc. So Not like the other Fairfields we've stayed at.It was Friday, so we were hoping no construction on Sat morning. We were wrong... I went down to talk to the manager, who hadn't shown up for his shift yet. The lady at the desk promised to move us to a much higher floor, facing the back (so no construction noise), and refund us the upgrade price. She said a room would be ready in a few hours, and they would move us. We arrived back at the appointed time to find a) she was gone b) there was a new room, 4 floors up but still facing construction c) they would not refund anything. No other options... so we took the higher floor and asked for earplugs.When booking Marriotts, I've ofter seen hotels note there is construction going on, so customers can make an informed choice. This was not the case.... would like to stay here again, but will call the hotel directly and ask!Not great customer service, and given the missing manager who only pays to have 1 overworked staffperson in the breakfast area, I am hoping someone else is in that role next time I plan my stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: room not ready until after 7PM, kept stringing me along for 3 hours...entered room at 7:30 bed not made, towels on floor !!!! Complained to management upon return home. Voice mails, emails all unanswered. Had to elevate to corporate. Hotels response to corporate was (politely) inaccurate, VERY inaccurate.Corporate needs to review this franchisee with greater scrutiny.Poorly managed, little integrity.Park bench possibly better

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We arrived to this hotel exhausted and hungry after a 6 1/2 hour drive from pittsburgh. Upon checkin we were rudely informed that there were no doubles and gave us a tiny King bed room. (All rooms, hallways, entrance and elevators are very small in this hotel) This was unacceptable for our family of 4 especially since our reservation was for 4 people. The front desk manager was rude, very dismissive and completely unhelpful. He refused to provide a refund, was very publicly nasty and inappropriate to both myself and my husband (Who is a Platinum Elite Marriott member!) However, he was more than gracious to a large wedding party who checked in after we did which we noticed while waiting over an hour for our car in the lobby. Maybe they needed our double room? In the past, staff has offered to open up other rooms or find something at another property or even help get our bags. None of this was offered and we had to make our own arrangements to the very accommodating Residence Inn Times Square. We had to transfer our bags and pay $56 for 1 1/2 hour of parking that was supposed to be validated by staff. There are many wonderful hotels in New York, this is DEFINITELY NOT one of them!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Price is right hotel team was friendly in the lobby and the free breakfast buffet was decent. The hours for the rooftop bar are not very good and the bartender was incredibly rude. Rooms are small but clean and quiet and the hotel is convenient to everything. Not a bad stay for the price. Just need to fix the hours of the best feature the hotel has so you can come back to the hotel and unwind on the roof with a cocktail and a friendly bartender. Oh and restocking the cups in the room would have been nice too. Hard to make coffee or drink water without them.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Facilities were decent. However we had a bizarre unsafe experience. Had repeated many Knocks at 1 am which kept intensifying. Finally asked and was told it was housekeeping with towels. Front desk was too quick to say it was some mixup. No apology from manager or call though I registered a complaint with Marriott customer service. Felt very fishy to have supposed housekeeping bang non stop in the middle of the night.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My friend and i decided to do a day visit into the city and couldnt have asked for a better place to stay. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and treated us like family. They helped us with everything from direction, places to eat, where the best deals where right down to fixing our poor feet after a long day of walking. I am so glad they were there to help us along our way especially Daniel. We hope to return very soon!
user_name:
Alicia P
Warren, Ohio, United States

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Can't say enough great things about this little gem in ChelseaNYC-- it was so great, I'm compelled to offer my first TripAdvisor review, despite being a pretty frequent traveler. The hotel is ideally located near Penn Station, tons of restaurants, great NYC florists, subway stops, etc. I was thrilled to arrive and be the designated "guest of the day", with a complimentary upgrade to to the 18th floor (rm 1806). (...Proof that Marriott Rewards is worth signing up for.) The skyline view from this room, including a perfect angle on the Empire State Bldg, just can't be beat-- classic, charming NYC. I was taking pics from my window nonstop. If you need daytime sleep, there's some construction noise across the street, but it's not excessive & they were done by 5 pm during my stay. The front desk staff were always attentive, cordial, and quite helpful. My room (again, an upgrade) was a perfect size, the AC worked great (during a NYC heatwave), everything was impeccably clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast in the lobby is worth noting, as well-- nothing over the top, but perfect for my needs-- simple, but very tasty and fresh with various hot and cold items. This is simply a great, convenient hotel, such a terrific value -- incredibly clean & well-kept -- I will undoubtedly stay there again soon!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were able to check in early (at 2pm) which was great! The room was small but is not a surprise for a New York hotel. Free breakfast was included.The bed is very comfortable and I love the huge windows.The bathroom was a little too tight though.They also can store your luggages after check out if you want to explore the city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice clean rooms. Staff very helpful. Ashley at the front desk was very helpful. Lina the Assistant Manager was very caring. Great options for breakfast. We walked practically everywhere -Times Square and everywhere in between! We'll be back!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I booked in for four nights to start off our US tour. We arrived late after a long journey and the receptionist was pleasant, with check in being quite painless. When we got to our room it was very small with dark furniture but the bed was comfortable although AC quite loud.We had a search around for the safe and to our surprise couldn't find one. On enquiring at reception we were informed that they had all gone and the best they could offer us was to leave our passports (but not cash and valuables) in the office! My husband was not comfortable (as have been burgled before) with this and decided after the first night we couldn't stay any longer. Reception staff had changed and two women were now in place but we found it very hard to attract their attention as they were engrossed in their conversations! So after a few attempts we managed to inform them of our reasons that we would have to find alternative accommodation elsewhere. We then were landed with a cancellation fee on top of the room rate of $280 for the one night! Lesson learned that if these things are important to us, we will now double check before booking! A plus though, breakfast was included and there was a nice selection of different foods in an area that was quite bright and airy. There is a roof top area with seating.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My colleague and I traveled on business for two nights. We chose the Fairfield because it was cheaper than other options and it's proximity to our clients. The rooms were standard New York size, so they were on the smaller side but I was pleased with the amount of vanity space in the bathroom and it had the desk and coffee that I needed. My colleague said the A/C in her room sounded like a jet taking off but mine wasn't that loud. On the hotel itself, the front desk staff were very friendly. However, the lobby bathroom has a leak under the toilet and was dirty and smelled when I visited. Also, I went down to the lobby to get hot water and water and neither were available. There were two empty water pitchers sitting there. The most challenging bit about the hotel was getting a car in front of it. The street is so congested with construction that it is down to one lane. Be prepared to move down to Avenue of the Americas if you need a car. It was a fine stay but I think I will look at a different property for my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed for one week at this fantastic hotel in a great location. Located in the flower district. Short walking distance to Penn Station, Empire State Building, Macy's, Madison Square Garden and so much more! Located a very short walking distance to subway lines that take you all over the city. The hotel lobby and breakfast area were very clean, as was the room. Staff was attentive, extremely friendly and always eager to please. We had a few minor issues with the room: a slow draining bathroom sink and a phone that did not work. Both issues were taken care of promptly. The morning breakfast was great with a variety of hot and cold foods. Items that ran out were replaced quickly. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel. I chose it based on location and positive Trip Advisor reviews. You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was nice and it is always great to have a complimentary breakfast and a rooftop patio. The staff at the Fairfield at 116 28th St. was outstanding. From making a copy, providing directions to making adjustments, this staff was the best and they were extremely busy. A special shoutout to Lily, Kevin and Ashlei for their help and graciousness! Thank you!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A clean hotel. We very much enjoyed our stay in the New York City. Staff members were helpful and accomodative. Conveniently located. Close to the subway station. We felt safe coming back to our room at 11 p.m.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed four night while working a show at Jacob Javits in May, I didn't know that 28th Street turns into an urban garden every day. Short walk to Chelsea/Penn Station/Time Square/Village and Javits. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Ashlei, the Front Desk clerk, greeted us with genuine enthusiasm and that was the start of a magical stay in NYC. She worked hard every minute to insure that we had a good time. That's why I give the Fairfield Inn on 28th St in NYC a top-shelf rating.
user_name:
tinaturner_7497
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I came to visit the Fairfield a couple days with my husband. He checked in a couple days before me on business. The hotel was lovely. Even though Keisara said she was still learning how to get around the city. She was very helpful and gave great directions and even asked her manager just to verify the info she gave us. We loved them. However, you do have two agents at the desk, both Spanish speakers, wears glasses, you guys should know who I'm talking about since I don't want to leave a bad review with names. But they are the most unprofessional people I've ever witnessed in my life. While my husband and we're waiting for our Uber we heard some very personal things that we shouldn't have. It's very unprofessional to talk about lying about your kid being sick because you want to go out or talk about how the hotels owner is so cheap and you hate your boss. It's disgusting. They were talking about other platinum elite guest that were staying in the hotel and my husband is platinum premiere and will be calling Marriott customer care to let them know what goes on at your desk. Also you might want to tell your AGM to make sure no one is around getting breakfast while she's talking about guest in the kitchen. I loved the property and some of its staff but the others really put a bad taste in my mouth. Won't be staying here again, sorry.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Chelsea is a great place to be and the hotel is conveniently located. It was average for a NYC hotel. Typical tiny rooms. Air conditioner unit over powered the room...it was either cold when on or hit when off. Nice roof deck and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were in town for a concert at Madison Square Garden and this hotel was a short walk. This is a very nice hotel, that's not too expensive and close to a lot of things. The rooms were nice, clean and the shower wonderful. They also have an included hot breakfast which was rather nice and had a lot of options. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were met by Kevin at the front desk and thought his service was exceptional, but all the staff was friendly and helpful. A minor complaint is the lack of attention to make sure the coffee and cold water are serviced, although when I pointed it out it was immediately fixed. It also in the heart of midtown with easy access to penn station, Empire State building, Macys, and a short walk to Times Square but out of the congestion of people and cars.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Marriott was exceptional. The rooms were clean and quiet, the front desk and housekeeping were very attentive. The breakfast was great. The business center was located in a convenient spot. And last but not least they had starbucks coffee available all day!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Adam the manager is the BEST! Very understanding and great at his job in terms of customer service. I have stayed at the Fairfield Inn before and the service is alway exceptional!! I will recommend anyone to travel and stay here. Very close/walking distance to Times Square. My friends and I did not need a car!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The high point of this hotel was the front desk (Ashlei specifically) and the other friendly staff including the very professional and friendly housekeeping staff. The rooms are somewhat small, but not too bad. Overall great location. We walked to Times Square, Flat Iron District, Korea Town, Central Park, and many other places in between. The subway is also very close and cheap for a one-way ticket anywhere on the line with transfers included ($3.00). The top of this hotel has great views and places to sit and have a drink if you choose. Breakfast is standard Marriott fare - reconstituted eggs that can be covered in salsa to improve the taste, yogurt, waffles, etc.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It was my first time to stay at this hotel though I have stayed at many other hotels -- including Marriott properties -- in the Chelsea/Penn Station area. The impression was formed at check-in when the receptionist introduced herself along with the other lady working reception, thoroughly went through all of the basics for the hotel and made me feel at home. The rooms and amenities were adequate, the breakfasts were fine -- but made special by the sunlit porch behind the hotel -- and the location is great. Every staff I had interaction with was friendly and interested in my well-being. Within an hour of check-out while at the airport I received a message from the hotel manager asking about my stay and what else they could do for me. I don't think you could expect friendlier care from any other hotel in New York.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have spent over 250 nights in Marriott Hotels all over the world, all their brands including several Ritz Carltons. I give this property 5 stars, because for the money you get so many amenities, values and one of the best, friendly, accommodating staffs of any Marriott owned property. Special call outs to Ashlei and Kerwin at the front desk who bent over backwards to make my stay special. It started out with an early check in at 10am because my upgraded room was available. From there, they made sure I had what I needed for Memorial Day Weekend stay. They provided me with a refrigerator and special, personal welcome gifts. Great local recommendations for spas, stores and restaurants in the area. ONE NOTE: They treated me well because I was nice and patient with them. Don't expect the front desk to treat you well if you don't treat them well. Be patient, quiet and understanding and SMILE. Treat them the way you would want to be treated if you were working their long hours.The rest of the staff was equally friendly and helpful. They all deserve special recognition from Marriott corporate. Top notch hospitality.Highlights of the property:- Good free breakfast buffet. In NYC, this saves quite a bit of money.- Rooftop penthouse deck with views of the Empire State Building. No bar, by BYOB, which saves one even more money.- Decent sized, comfortable rooms with GREAT Marriott beds - Powerful air conditioning

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel location is excellent and near many restaurants, shopping and attractions. The room and hotel are very clean and tidy. (Room size was average and not small as some people have commented on.) The complimentary breakfast included a good selection and was above average. My husband and I were most impressed with the hotel staff -- all staff demonstrated a genuine friendliness and all were very helpful and professional. In particular, Ashlei went above and beyond to make our stay extra special as we celebrated a milestone birthday for my husband. We look forward to visiting NY again and will most definitely stay at this hotel again, and also recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We've been Marriott Reward members for years and we were looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel with a great location. Our son lives in Brooklyn, and this hotel was very convenient to Penn Station and subway lines. My wife was the "guest of the day" which made her weekend with a gift bag and other accolades. It's located in the Flower District with stores, shops and restaurants surrounding it. We had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room and it also has a very nice roof top deck. After trying several places to stay in NYC, we have finally found the right combination. The breakfast was way more than we expected with many hot and cold foods and Starbucks coffee. We will be staying there from this point on, no need to search for other places.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I loved this hidden gem and would absolutely stay again! The room was a bit tight, but the customer service was amazing! The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the ambiance of 28th was fantastic (the hotel is nestled between several flower shops). I highly enjoyed walking down the street and smelling the sweet smell of flowers! I

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had made a last minute booking for 2 rooms and checked in for 5 nights with another couple earlier this month. After an initial glitch with a running toilet and some concerns about the size of the rooms with very little storage, we were upgraded to larger rooms. The staff could not do enough to ensure we were happy with our accommodations.This place has such a warm vibe. It's all the little things, like the 24 hour tea & coffee station (a great feature after being out on a cold night), the welcome you receive upon return, helping us to book baseball tickets, booking our airport transfer for us and a hearty breakfast every morning. The rooftop terrace was an awesome place to have a nightcap and the view of the Empire State Bldg was amazing. Even though there are only 2 lifts, we never had a problem and thought they were quite quick. Our rooms were on the 7th floor right outside the lifts, and we never had an issue with noise.The subway location and close proximity to Macy's was a bonus and we loved the pavements covered in flowers everyday...the fragrance was beautiful.We would most definitely stay here again and would not hesitate recommending it to others. Thanks again for making our week so special.Glen & Donna

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Good location in the middle of all the flower wholesalers. Great staff. Easy to find reasonable food in the area and subway stops are handy. Rooms looking at the Empire State Building offer that special NYC view. Wish they had at least one more elevator.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Fairfield is in a terrific location, right between stations serving the 1 and the N/R lines. It's on a street known for its flower and plant shops and as such the sidewalk is a bit crazy, but it makes for pretty scenery.I checked in online (use the Marriott app - it's great!) and was given a room on the 17th floor. No view for me but that's alright. I wish the room had a refrigerator but there was a coffee machine and the iron was clean (here for work - need a good iron). The room itself was absolutely fantastic. Truly. The fixtures were far above what I'm used to in a Fairfield property. The shower was enormous - beautiful glass enclosure, strong water pressure - just ideal. I always wish that NYC hotels would consider going with just one nightstand and squeezing a soft couch chair in there somehow but the desk chair was adequate enough (people need to stop complaining about NYC room sizes). The people were terrific as well. They couldn't find a package I had sent prior to my arrival for a bit but we eventually tracked it down. Breakfast is complimentary and served in a clean, bright room - kudos to the folks working that shift (very friendly). I had some struggles with a printer one afternoon and they dealt with that issue quickly as well. Just a really responsive staff.I'm definitely going to stay here again if/when the price is right (the rooms even here can creep over $400 per - don't like that!). A really nice spot.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This lovely little hotel is THE place to stay if your are visiting New York. Plum in the middle of the flower district it has excellent facilities and a warm welcoming, helpful staff. There is a great breakfast. Coffee, teas available at all times - and usually a cookie to complement. It is close to the subway, buses and if you want to walk, the great city of New York is wrapped all around. Just step out! Thank you to all for a memorable stay. We will be back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Perfectly adequate accommodation in a good location only 6 blocks from Penn Station. Room fairly small but everything is there and clean. We required a fridge for medication and a small one was brought to our room within 5 minutes and plugged in at no extra charge. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was enough to get you on your way. Roof top balcony was an added bonus with city views. Air conditioning unit was a bit noisy so we slept without it but wouldn't want to try that in summer. Thanks for a good stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I know this is long past Due but our stay here was fantastic. The friendly staff went above and beyond to make our birthday trip very memorable. The location was great, and we were able to do so much in a short time. We walked to Times Square our first night and found the location was not as far as we thought. The front desk staff gave us information on how to get where we were going, places to eat and little tips for navigating. The rooms were clean, comfortable and modern. The breakfast was always warm and even if you were close to the end of serving time, someone made sure there was more. Check in and out was easy. We arrived early and were allowed to leave our bags until our rooms were being prepared until check in time. They also stored our bags after check out until our driver arrived. They also made our reservation for transport to the airport which allowed us to enjoy more time exploring the City.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was renovated and modern, the size was good because New York hotels usually are so small. Bathroom had all the utilities needed for a woman and shower really large. and no need to say that Marriott always got the most confortable beds. More than I was expecting with flowers surrounding the sidewalk during the day, a real surprise. The staff is here for you and really helpful, some customers were late for breakfast but still got what they needed. They make sure you leave with everything! Lina the GM makes sure you start your day the best way possible.The location is great, especially if you here for shopping, you are next to Herald square and the famous Macy's, Time square and Madison square garden. On 6th avenue you got a lot of nice restaurants and bars, this area is really safe and quiet at night. And if you dont want to go out, the rooftop has the best view of the Empire State building!I travel a lot by myself and guests were a nice mix in between business and tourist people, the breakfast area has a huge table and allow guest to interact, it was all fun!Family or business trip, this an amazing place to stay, really convenient!Lets not forget wifi everywhere from the 24/7 gym in the lower level to the rooftop, we all know how much this is important weither you have kids or work to do!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It was our first trip to New York and we stayed at the Farefield inn and suites at 116 west 28th St. We were in a small room at the rear of the hotel and had a few problems with WiFi and lack of storage space . As we were there for the whole week we were upgraded to a city view when one became available which was great. All the hotel staff went out of their way to help us particularly Jillian and also Kevin on the front desk.We were made to feel at home from the word go.The complimentary breakfasts were brilliant, serving bacon sausage patties breakfast potatoes every day as well as fresh Waffle's, porrage and a host of other things. The ladies looking after the food were lovely, as were all of the staff.West 28th isn't the prettiest Street but every day the pavements are filled with thousands of flowers and plants on sale as most of the shops were garden shops.The location turned out to be perfect for us, being only a 6 minute walk from Penn station where we arrived from JFK.There were metro stations at each end of the street and we were a short walk from The High Line, the garden in the sky. We could see the Empire State Building from our window.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My experience with this hotel and staff has been nothing but a NIGHTMARE! I have literally been scammed out of money and rudely insulted by general and front desk management, Adam Gollub and Kerwin Francis. Please, do yourself a favor and find another hotel to stay at. I have never in my life experienced such incompetence from a business!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was close to the elevator which was loud and the walls were very thin which meant no sleep. The toilet ran constantly and was never repaired. Then I left a personal item behind and called just hours after I checked out to retrieve it. I was directed to Housekeeping who NEVER returned my calls, and this is despite sending an email directly to the hotel manager - who also did not return any calls or emails. And I stay at Marriott hotels every 2 weeks! Save yourself a lot of trouble and do not stay here. And forget any brand loyalty.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A very comfortable hotel near several Metro stations makes it an easy to explore option in central Manhattan. Rooms are rather small but the free breakfast helps make up for this. I asked for a quiet room on an upper floor and was given one on the 7th floor. It was quiet as it overlooked the back of the hotel but did have a side view of the Chrysler Building. Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.Plenty of choices for breakfast.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was staying in New York for one night. We booked a suite to fit 5 people. When we arrived, I was told that there was something wrong with the room so we could not stay in it. This was already frustrating since everyone besides myself was from NY. The point was to stay together since we were their for our friend's party. The more frustrating part is that no one contacted me in advance to notify me. We then got two rooms next to each other at a reduced rate. The hotel called around which was nice, but they also recommended we all sleep in one room with one person on the floor which was an outrageous option. And the carpet was wet in the room from it being cleaned right before we got there.At 8:00am someone knocked on both of our doors to ask us if we were leaving today. We said yes, but it bothered us to be woken up for something that they could have checked on in the lobby. We then put our do not disturb sign up since we were still sleeping. 45 minutes later someone came and knocked on our door waking us up again to ask if we needed a towel, which we did not. All in all for a one day stay I thought it was more of a headache than a help and would not stay there again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was a comfortable hotel in a great location. They provide a full, complementary breakfast each morning. My only issue is that there was no dinner room service from the hotel - you are able to order out though.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for 12 nights during a business trip (including through the famous January 2016 snowstorm!). The best parts I liked were that the rooms were reasonably spacious for a Manhattan hotel, the reception staff was quite warm (there was a relatively senior lady one of the mornings who was so quick to understand I was a tea drinker and quickly arranged for everything in the middle of the morning rush), the breakfast restaurant was well-equipped (even during the snowstorm), the bathrooms were perfectly clean and I got a fantastic view of The Empire State Building from my room (1402)! Also, there was possibly a Hispanic member of staff, a young lady, who had this very special attitude of coming into the breakfast area in the morning and greeting whoever made eye contact with a very vibrant, "Good Morning" - she was very helpful with many of the senior guests too. The range of teas was also impressive and I was also impressed by all the healthy items that were available for breakfast as walnuts, etc. Overall, things were clean, of good quality and reasonably warm (just that Countryside, boutique feel with the New Yorkish touch of speed and efficiency).Another big plus, given I am Indian, was that there were a whole bunch of Indian restaurants on Lexington Avenue, just a short walk from the hotel. Also, if you did not want to take a taxi, there were multiple train stations nearby. And Macy's and J C Penney and a whole host of branded shops were just a walk away.There were a few misses, of course, (you expect some over a 12 day period), like the TV remote was just missing (though I got to noticing that only after a few days) and though they knew early on that I was not a coffee person, they did not arrange a tea kettle as a replacement and only on one day of the 3-4 days I asked, the receptionist just did not get me tea in my room in the morning since I did not want to use the coffee machine to make tea since it could smell of coffee!. Another miss was that though I told the possibly Hispanic young lady about preparing all guests about the snowstorm since many of us were from outside New York or like me, not an American and though she said it was a good idea, she possibly could not convince the management to act on it and they did not send any information and we were left to figuring out ourselves. Luckily, I had a lot of friends whom I could call and figure out what to do. Like, since I am a vegetarian, I decided to stock up on a few essentials during the snowstorm and they promptly arranged a refrigerator (which honestly I expected in the room in a top hotel as this, and I am used to amazing hospitality in good hotels in India and I should have understood that this was the US and Manhattan at that and special things do not come without request or payment here - they did not charge me for that).Also, one of the days I needed a taxi quickly and the staff just asked me to walk to the corner and hail a Yellow Cab which actually took a full 15 minutes to get and I will have expected them to call for an Uber or figure out a faster mechanism to get me a cab - again, this one was not an easy one to fulfill and I wound not consider this one as a big miss.The internet was also patchy at times.Overall, if it were not for those misses, I will have given a 5-star rating here (I rarely give!) and nevertheless, if you are on a bleisure trip (business + leisure) trip or just a business trip, I will certainly recommend staying at this hotel - I have good memories of New York from here!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed Monday-Friday for a work trip and decided to stay in the city and take the train to NJ for work every day. The hotel is very clean in a great location. The staff was very nice, accommodating and did everything right from checking in to checking out. The daily breakfast was very good. I got lucky and got a room on the 9th floor overlooking the city with the Empire State Building in my view and really enjoyed that. Short walk to the Penn station at Madison Square Garden and in the middle of everything if you want to do some sight seeing. Would definitely stay here again next time I'm in the city!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We booked a stacation in NYC. chose this place because of price... soon as we walked inside., the entire staff and (Bethany) were terrific! they Welcomed us and gave us a great send off.... The rooms were a bit close quarters but, it is Manhattan and they didnt spare any amenities...room was extremely-clean-modern-fresh. maid service was on point. the breakfast in the morning was way more then we expected. we figured it would only be coffee and muffins.. well they had everthing to offer and also for the health conscious. would definitely stay again and we recommend. nice place...!
user_name:
marioBjunior
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Thanks Beth and Sebastian for making us feel welcomed and for the sweet note and cookies. Clean hotel. We are used to bigger rooms from Marriott since we live in Fl, but its not bad for a couple. What matters is that they are clean. The Penthouse/ rooftop was okay. I wish they have something cute there. Maybe a fire pit or something similar so that you can sit and have a drink while looking at the Empire Building. It is near the Madison Square Garden and many places to eat. While there we visited Brother Jimmys bbq, and Friedmans restaurant which both were great. Again, I really would love to see something be done to the penthouse.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: When we checked in, Kevin helped us with that...and all went well. He was great and very friendly. When we got to our room...it was a little small for 2, awesome for one! We unpacked and thought no more about it, it's New York! Went to the roof top to see the spectacular view, (think Empire State Building) and on the way down we met Dennis. We were joking with him in the elevator about not having a bar on the rooftop, and the we JOKINGLY mentioned that our room was a smidge small. Readers, let me tell ya, I have never witnessed a manager go into overdrive to accommodate guests like this! Before we knew it, Dennis had us pack up all our things and moved us to another room on the front side of the hotel, that was larger!!! This guy even brought up a bottle of wine for us for the trouble...C"MON!!!In closing...this hotel is filled with a smiling FRIENDLY staff, CLEAN rooms, comfy bed, excellent location, and a great rate for being in Manhattan. Can't wait to come back!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My experience was awesome. First thing when I approached the building and saw the entrance swinging glass doors.... it had no finger prints on it , it was spotless, I found out that Chris who I got to meet makes sure the lobby area is spotless, that means a lot to me. The other two hotels down the street glass windows and doors were so nasty. The other thing,,,,Theresa the lady at the front desk is wonderful,she made my stay so welcoming from the beginning, she is so caring, When I arrived it was 10pm, I had a long day and she made everything easy for me. Thanks again Theresa. The room was very clean. The bed was so comfortable that it was the best night sleep I had in a long time. Breakfast was great, we had a wide variety of teas, it was a full/international breakfast. I'll have to stay there again soon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
