review_body: We arrived just as the epic blizzard was starting. Very friendly check in at 11:30 PM. Got upgraded to suite on 17th floor. Still a small room but decent for NYC. Located on quieter side street but 2 blocks from subway and some eateries. Room was very clean. Comfy bed, TV with fair amount of channels. Decent sized bathroom. Good breakfast in morning.The staff was just great. Due to the blizzard, the staff was stranded just like us. They kept smiling and keeping things clean.Depending on time of year, this hotel is a fantastic bargain for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a snafu parking our car. Jessica at the front desk and Adam, the manager were extremely helpful in solving the problem. They went above and beyond and I appreciated that when we arrived. As a matter of fact, all the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.Hotel is in a great location, we walked the streets and felt safe day and night. The room was immaculate and the breakfast was varied and excellent. I will definitely try to stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I've stayed here several times for its convenience from Newark Airport, especially since United no longer services JFK. Taking the easy NJ Transit Train from EWR to Penn Station, it's a few short blocks' walk to the hotel -- which also has easy access to major subway stops to all points. The hotel itself has few frills--after all, it's a Fairfield Inn, the lowest in the Marriott foodchain. So no real lobby, tasteful and clean but basic rooms. But hey, even high priced hotels in the Apple have tiny rooms.The rate includes a decent breakfast spread of hot and cold items. In NYC, a coffee and bagel alone will set you back a few bucks, a hot bfst at least $10 pp if you go to a sit-down place. Free wifi, good sheets and towels and amenities. Staff is friendly and helpful -- what more is there? A real winner in my book.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I always stay at Marriotts when traveling for business, so I have stayed in many. This location is a no frills spot. The rooms are bare bones (no fridge or Minibar). Also, no restaurant (food) or bar attached to the hotel, so make plans to get what you need before you retire for the night. The location is great. Waking distance to great shopping, restaurants and all mid town attractions such as Empire State Building. I do like to have more amenities, so the Courtyard Marriott on 30th is a better choice for that...it at least have a fridge in the rooms and a restaurant/Bar attached. "Dewey's Pub".

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was a 10 minute walk from the GO bus from Boston drop-off/pick-up location. Half hour walk to everywhere and a 5-10 minute walk to a few subway stations when it's cold. The breakfast was better than typical fare, and the rooms were decent sized. The first night they were filled and we ended up in an ADA compliant room. This room was very narrow, so even though the bathroom would work for someone in a wheelchair, the room seemed tight to me. Since we stayed for 3 nights the staff offered to switch rooms the 2nd night, and that room was more spacious and very nice. The staff was very friendly throughout.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay here. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The breakfast was hot and satisfying. On the COLDEST weekend in New York City, it was a great place to come back to after a busy day of walking.A few of our favorite perks:1. Close to Penn Station2. Amazing view of the Empire State Building if you go up to the roof3. Awesome staff (they deserve a second mention)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: After having stayed at many properties in the city, this is the best for service and location! The staff are professional, personable and always make my family feel at home. The location makes it easy to get anywhere in the city using mass transit or cab.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Ok- nothing fancy here. But- room is big, new, clean and satisfies all you need. Bed us great. Shower is awesome. Breakfast is not fancy- but nice and basically has all you need.Its not romantic or sth- but- if you come to the city for business purposes - and seek mon fancy comforts- its ideal!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at the hotel for two nights with three girlfriends. We were upgraded to a suite due to Marriott rewards status and we loved the extra space and second bathroom in the suite. The breakfast was ample and standard Marriott fare. The breakfast room was a lovely greenhouse behind the alley which was a delightful area to dine in the morning. If you don't mind a walk, the hotel is walkable to Times Square and Chelsea Market (about 20-30 min walk in opposite directions. We didn't mind so the location suited us. For the price, it was a great option since we were travelling on a budget. I would recommend this hotel. Staff was also very friendly and accommodating to our needs.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed for a week. Had to change hotel reservation last minute due to the snow storm and the hotel was very accommodating. Close to the metro station and several great restaurants. The breakfast was a bonus as it was included in my price. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a budget and wanting to be near the metro and a lot of New Yorks main attractions.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Is located in the "Flowers District", walking distance to Times square and Empire building. Metro just around the corner. Breakfast is delicious and the staff outstanding.A special thank to Daniel.We will be back.Valeria & Federica

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was lucky to book my stay with Theresa, who is the night receptionist.  She was amazing as well as all the staff there who couldn't do enough for me. I stayed 9 days in the hotel which is in Chelsea and therefore close to all the art galleries and museums and away from the tourist trap of Times Square area. Great room with plenty of space and free breakfast.Again the best part was Theresa who took care of me, and I understood that she does that for all guests at the hotel, in the most personal and efficient way. The Marriott is lucky to have her!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A clean, well located place, close to train, subway. Nothing special, but ok for a short stay in NY.The hotel is close to many attractions, TV in the room, mattress so so, bathroom clean. Nothing more to say. A good budget option.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were supposed to spend two nights at this hotel. Due to a blizzard, we had to leave early, so as not to miss a surprise 90th birthday in Long Island. They let us out of our reservation at 4pm on a Friday. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are small but very efficient. They offer a nice breakfast. The location, just off 6th Ave is quiet at night and offered plenty to do, see and buy during the day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had tickets to see Les Mis on Broadway the weekend that the blizzard hit NYC in 2016. I found this hotel online and the price was right. The hotel room was great, the location was great and the staff was fantastic. I couldn't have asked for more. And after walking out in the cold wind and snow for dinner, we came back to freshly baked cookies. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a visit to the city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My twin daughters came and stayed 4 nights at this lovely hotel! I would suggest booking directly with Marriott because Booking.com is less than par. I have nothing but great things to say about the lodging conditions, the breakfast options and the well equipped, professional staff that was so very friendly! They went over and above to make sure our stay was simply wonderful! A shout out for Lina the assistant general manager of this Marriott. She was beyond nice and SO incredibly personable!!!! I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler who wants a "home away from home" experience!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: very good location close to metro stations. Our room was at the top floor with amasing city view)and very clean) Thanks to Mena our stay at the hotel became interesting and he was great in advising places to visit and answering all of our questions. We really enjoyed our stay and the hotel. Good luck to the personel and especially Mena!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed on a Friday night in January for under $120, including breakfast and all taxes. Nice, clean room with king bed, and free wifi (not real fast, about 1 mb up/down, but adequate for email and info). Front lobby staff very friendly and helpful, and they kept our carry-on bags for free before check-in time and after check-out the next day while we toured the town. Good breakfast, and clean breakfast room. Good location only 3 block walk from Penn Station and easy walk one block to the 1 subway line. Overall, great bang for the buck in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Perfecct Point to visit NY, and High Level floor rooms have spectacular view if you are Marriott Elite Member you can enjoy view of Empire State Building as on the fantastic Roof-Top. Hotel is Clean and Breakfast is full and relaxing in a little courtyard. Most of all Staff is Great and helpful...Lina the Manager, the 2 "J" Jessica and Jillian, and the 2 boys at reception (one was Kevin?...sorry but i miss the names :) were nice and very polite.Location was perfect in nice Flower District, close to Metro and few blocks from NYC Heart of Times Square and MSG.We (me and my wife) we had a beautiful christmas time and our first year wedding celebration...Thank you all.Unforgettable NEW YORK....

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As to location I think it could not be better. Very central, close to Penn station and walking distance to the Empire State building and other main attractions. Hotel room and bathroom were very clean and so was the linen and towels provided. Breakfast was good with hot and cold food available, coffee and tea facilities were available 24 hours. On the downside we had a very small room which for a family of 4 was extremely close to claustrophobic No space to put clothes or suitcases. TV against the wall was in the way since space between beds and wall was only a couple of feet.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stay her regularly.Great staff...great location.I have never had an issue with the rooms or with any level of lack of customer service at this hotel. Two reasons for 4 stars and not 5?....rooms are a bit small (although expected in NYC)...and breakfast should be offered to 10 and not 9.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location for a couple of family of 4 (you can not fit more than 4 in a standard or double room...it's very tight) to be at a center location with walking distance to most attractions and right by the subway. Breakfast was great! However we had two rooms and neither had fitted sheets on the bed, I found that odd.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have had to stay in nyc for the past 4 weeks. Three weeks in November and 1 week of December. I can stay in any hotel I wish to. I love this hotel as they go above and beyond to make sure that you are comfortable and have everything you can need. I love the fact that they are each very friendly and helpful. I love the breakfast too and there was many times I was needing to get breakfast on the go, they would saran wrap the muffins and give me a bag . I love each of the staff they are amazing and professional. It is great to come in from a hard day at the office and grab a cookie in the lobby. The hotel is always impeccably clean. I love the fact that I don't feel alone when I am up there at the hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We ended up here after the Fairfield in Midtown had overbooked. Teresa at the front desk was awesome -- was able to answer all of our questions and was so accommodating. The beds were super comfortable and we had a view of the Empire State Building from our window. We liked being off the main street and in a little neighbourhood with a flower shop next door and apartments across the street. Spent the next night at the Fairfield up by Penn Station, and while that was also nice, we liked the cosi neighbourhood feel of the Fairfield in Chelsea better. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Awesome service. We needed to take a call the next day at 2 pm, and they extended the checkout to 230 for us. That was very nice of them. Leo, Jessica, Kevin, and Lina facilitated. Thank you for the help. The place is located near all the usual stuff you would want to visit in NY.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I've stayed in NYC many, many times in hotels ranging from small boutique to large upscale, and my experience at the Fairfield Inn and Suites on 116 West 28th Street in Chelsea ranks as one of the best-ever experiences. The room was comfortable, clean and exceptionally quiet, and the hotel, itself, was spotless, secure, and inviting. I arrived before check-in time, and while they prepared my room, I was made comfortable in a relaxing room provided with a TV, long table, computers and beverages for guests. Check-in was a breeze, and the receptionist was very welcoming. Indeed EVERYONE from the front desk, to the custodian in the elevator to breakfast room attendant was polite and personable. But I should mention two people, in particular, who made the stay exceptional. The first is sales manager, Kathy Mendez, who personally welcomed me and arranged for me to use the "Green Room" part of the breakfast room for a film interview. The stress that normally attends such a project was enormously reduced by Ms Mendez whose lovely, gracious presence was professional, warm and reassuring. I felt quite at home and supremely at ease.The other notable is Jessica Jimenez whose genuine smile and natural charm at the front desk provide a wonderfully inviting beacon of assistance. She went out of her way to find me a choice of restaurants and was concerned as to my dining experience afterwards which precipitated a conversation that left me smiling and refreshed after a hectic day in the city. The included breakfast was the an unexpected treat and was one of the best I have encountered in the city. Moist scrambled eggs, fresh orange juice, oatmeal, quality brand yogurts, and many other choices were available for guests to partake of in the accommodating glassed-in breakfast room with its pleasing natural light. The location, a mere seven-minute walk from Penn Station, could not be more convenient, and an added bonus is that this section of West 28tn Street is the wholesale flower district of the city. So one's walk to the hotel is a pleasant mix of aromas and colors.But it all finally comes down to people, and what truly makes this Fairfield an oasis in the city is the staff who seem to function like a happy family. I seem to have found a new home in NYC. I'd like to keep the secret to myself, but that wouldn't be fair.(Side note: at the same time of my visit a friend of mine stayed at a Fairfield in Times Square and had a miserable time with an overworked and under-attentive staff in a hotel that needed cleaning and was noisy. It's all about the management, and I hope the Fairfield on 28th St. in Chelsea keeps its present staff for a long time.)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We decided to take a spontaneous weekend away, our first time leaving our kids so I (mom) was extremely anxious the entire way and I couldn't wait to just check in and relax. Upon checking in, there was a small hiccup with the rooms that were available but Teresa fixed it and we never saw the issue. Shortly after checking in we went to park our car and the lot attendant gave my husband a huge issue and almost got physical, we called Teresa not knowing what to do and she called the police and stayed on the line with us the entire time to make sure we were okay. The issue was resolved and as soon as we got back to the hotel all Teresa cared about is if we were okay, you could see in her face she was genuinely concerned. So that was our first night lol. The following night we saw her again and she wanted to hear about our day and was so sweet. We were sad to not see her the next morning for checkout but she really made our stay great! My husband is normally a tough critic when it comes to hotels mainly because he hates staying at them but this time I didn't hear one negative comment from him. Only reason I didn't give the 5 stars is because the room isn't exactly what was pictured, I'm mainly referring to the bathroom. But I will say it was clean, and spacious. We payed half the price of our friends that were staying closer to Times Square and we had a bigger room than them! Everything was within walking distance and I loved that it wasn't so loud at night. Walking out of the hotel to see beautiful flowers lined up on the sidewalk was awesome. We love Teresa!! And we will make sure uses there next time we go... With the kids! :)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The service here was first rate. From the greeting to the food service to the room attendant, everyone was extraordinary. I liked the location, set amongst the wholesale florists. Very cool to see their operations. This was convenient to Penn Station and most everywhere in Manhatten. The free breakfast and free wifi were a plus.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We enjoy staying in this hotel, very well attended by Kathy, Jill, Angie and Leo, confortable room, and nice breakfast, depite the location, that was very good! Thank for making our stay very nice, we'll come back

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a room on the 14th floor facing the Empire State building and every night it was shining a different color. Rooms are a tad small, but I've come to find out that, that is a NYC thing. Staff was very friendly and always accommodating to whatever I could have wanted. I was also told in passing by an employee that I should go up to the Penthouse floor and it's a rooftop sitting area with Great views of the Empire State building.Complimentary hot breakfast in the morning and they have Starbucks coffee vs. the normal Marriott brand coffee.28th Street Subway is half a block away.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was a surprisingly convenient location and a really nice hotel. We usually stay closer to Time Square but because of the super expensive rates at the holiday season, we decided to give this location a try. The rooms were a little small, but they were clean and comfortable, and the staff was helpful and friendly. Also, nothing beats walking out the front door and smelling all the fresh flowers from surrounding florists.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: From the moment we checked in the staff greeting us were very friendly and helpful. Our rooms were very clean and facilities in the hotel were fantastic for the price i.e. complimentary breakfast with a huge choice from cooked breakfast to cereal, bagels, toast, muffins, fresh waffles, fruit & yoghurt too plus fresh juice and hot drinks on tap. As our stay progressed the staff continued to be helpful and were really interested in meeting our every need, from booking car service to taking group photos and not to mention helping us start Gemma's hen night off on a hilarious journey! Wilson and Lina deserve the credit for that. The maid service was fab, our rooms were immaculate and if we needed more towels the front desk staff were happy to oblige and the towels appeared in moments. The views from the top floor roof terrace of the Empire State Building were amazing. The seating area was clean and comfortable meaning that weather permitting we could enjoy the view day or night in nice surroundings.The location of the hotel is great, situated among flower shops and a short walk to the top of the street was a McDonalds. The opposite way was a short walk to the other end of the street where both direction subway stations were available. The Triple Crown Irish Bar became our 'local' and it was a 10 minute walk when turning onto 7th Ave to go uptown to Macy's, Madison Square Garden and Times Square. I would definitely stay there again due to the central location, friendly staff and value for money. I was able to keep in touch with back home with the free wifi which was fab! I'd just like to thank all of the staff at the hotel and hope you all liked the Scottish Cook Book we left for you a a small token of our appreciation for making our stay in NYC so carefree! Hope to return x

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The word that best defines our stay is: wonderful! The hotel is situated on a very nice spot, there's two subway stations on each corner on the same street, and there's a lot of necessary places around, like two Duane Reade, Whole Foods, Fairway Market, Two Bros Pizza and so on. Besides, I loved the rooftop with the Empire State Building view! The staff was amazing! Theresa was so kind and helpful at our checkin, and Lina was so enjoyable everytime we met on the lobby and brunch area. Jess, Leo, Wilson, Bethany and Kevin: they were so loving and nice with us! We loved all of them!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: How can this hotel be even better? There is no way!This hotel is perfect! People that work there makes everything! I arrived earlier and we were very tired, 9 hours flight, they found a room for us, and they didn't charge more for that. Theresa checked us in ans she was AMAZING! She was nice, The room is not huge, but is good and really comfortable! The bathroom is good too!The breakfast is delicious, waffle, fruits, muffins, baggle, yogurt, eggs, bacon, juice, and they have Starbucks Coffee. The stay was incredible because of: Lina, the Assistant General Manager, she was perfect, she talked to us, helped us to find a table in the mornings, she gave us some tips. Wilson was amazing too, he helped us during breakfast, during our stay.Leo the Supervisor helped us with a wrong thing in our bill and the bags, Kevin, Jessica, Bethany they were amazing too. They helped with bags, palces to go, places to eat, they were nice.I loved the hotel specially because of people!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: From the moment we arrived the reception staff were fab nothing was a problem for them and they arranged all our transport for all the things we had booked. Lina was great gave us lots of information and recommended great places and nothing was a problem. Wilson was also fab he certainly entertained us and was so helpfully and pleasant we all loved Wilson and Lina we would have liked to have left you all tips as you were fab and you defo deserve a pay rise for making our stay perfect. I would defo recommend this hotel and area to all my friends and will stay again if I get the opportunity to visit in the future. The rooftop was lovely in the evening and the hotel is central to subways pubs etc. Well done to the staff in this hotel x.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I searched for quite a while to find a place with access to many of the things I wanted to see in the city. I had only visited NYC one other time and it was overwhelming. On my daughter's recommendation of the Chelsea area of the city I booked this hotel and found it to be perfect. There are two subway entrances close to the hotel- one right on the corner - the other a short walk that took me everywhere I wanted to go. The hotel sits on a street in the flower district so everyday you leave the hotel and get to see all the beautiful plants and flowers being set out, it was great. The hotel itself was clean and the room was really comfortable if not exactly spacious. The bathroom was fairly large considering the room itself had a king bed, desk with chair which doubled as your night stand on that side, a small night stand on the other side, and an armoire of sorts all of which took up just about all the available space. You also don't have to worry about walking far to your room since you exit the elevator, turn left or right and your room is pretty much right there. It was very quiet. I was on the 5th floor facing the building next to us (not pretty but blinds closed) and could not hear the city sounds, which is actually amazing and a welcome relief after being out all day.Probably shouldn't have left the staff until last but they certainly are the best. They remember you and welcome you back when you return from being out. They work hard to be accommodating. I asked one morning at breakfast if they had soy milk, the person attending the breakfast said no but they could have it in 2 minutes. I said no don't bother, it was no big deal I would eat something else. Next thing I know, here she comes with soy milk they had ran around the corner to buy just for me. Pretty sweet. It did turn out that she was the assistant manager so it might have been over and above what another staff person might have done but she did make me feel like she was glad I was staying there and she wanted my experience to be a good one. I felt like all the staff I encountered had that same attitude.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our first visit to New York. I read trip advisor reviews for over a week before choosing Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea.I contacted the hotel the day before we left to confirm our 2 rooms would have 2 double beds. They were very helpful and reasurring. We arrived very late due to flight delays I called again on my way in because we got stuck intraffice and would not be arriving till after midnight. Again very friendly and reassuring that our room was waiting. We arrived at 2am to a very friendly staff memeber sorry I forgot her name. She checked us in quickly and got us to our rooms.First sight of the hotel and night does not look like much but the hotel was clean and well managed. In the morning it loooked totally different from the outside because we were right in the wholesale flower district. It was beautiful. Our room was clean beds were very comfortable. Everyday we came back from a long day our room and bathroom were very clean. The staff was amazing a very good continental breakfast was provided the staff offered us bottled waters to take on our long walks and adventures throught the city. The rooftop area had great views and if it not too cold its beautiful in the evening. I will definatley be visiting New York again and would stay here again. All the staff we encountered our entire trip were all very friendly and helpful. Thank you For everything we had a great trip.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The entire staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and very efficient. They went out of their way to be sure that we were happy. A gentleman named Kevin stood out. The room was very nice and it was clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I read about this place on trip advisor, which drew me to it. Now that I've been there its all I expected and more, the staff were great and made you feel as part of the family. It was almost like a B & B, special mention must go to Jessica, Kevin, Lina, Leo, Jillian, they didn't miss a beat. Always there to assist with any question or advise. The hotel is well positioned, whether you are travelling uptown or downtown, you are a short distance away. 28th street Metro was on the corner of our street about 100 m away. Breakfast was included, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, yogurt, milk, juice, bagels, muffins, eggs, bacon. More than enough to start the day. The room was great, its a bit small but that doesn't worry me, I'm only there to sleep, it was clean, fresh, linen was great, bed was comfortable, shower and bathroom were excellent. We were given room 403 which was at the back of the property, it was quiet, I did not wake up once from any sort of noise. The place has a rooftop terrace, with stunning views of uptown. The hotel is also in the middle of the flower district, as soon as you walked out you though you were walking through a forest. We stayed 8 nights, I will be back. Trust me, do not go past this place.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a week in late September, 2015. When we arrived at night did not have a good impression due to all of the garbage that is outside on the sidewalk on the entire block. But next morning a refreshing sight was seeing all of the beautiful flowers and plants aligned on the sidewalk (Flower District). The bed was the best, shower was good as well. The room is pretty small and had no closet or in room safe. Breakfast was good, but I would have liked a little more variety after three days. Staff was very courteous and nice.The hotel is very well located. Close to most places we were interested in going. Walked to Madison Square Garden for the Billy Joel concert, walked to Times Square and close to several Metro stations.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Without exception the staff at this hotel is the friendliest and most helpful staff we have ever had the pleasure of; Marriott hotels are lucky to have such a great bunch working for them. After a long journey from the UK we were greeted by Bethany and a chap whose name I’ve forgotten they offered us fresh bottled water and cookies. Check in was fast and we were provided with maps and if we needed any recommendations we only had to ask. I travelled with my wife and 2 older children; we flew in and out from Newark. We used NJ Transit train which are every 20 minutes and took 30 minutes to NY Penn station. Come out of Penn station (Macys is across the road) turn right you’re on 7th Avenue keep walking until W28Street and turn left. We walked it with a suitcase and hand luggage easily in 15 minutes. We could have taken the subway (Line 1; one stop) which is at the corner of W28 Street/7th Ave.The bedroom was very clean and had 2 doubles it was a little tight for room only but we managed; for younger children it’s perfect. Storage space was at a premium. The beds were very comfortable and we all enjoyed a good sleep after a hard day sightseeing and shopping. The bathroom was very clean and had a very powerful shower which was great; we were only given 2 towels on one occasion, not an issue as Wilson sorted us with additional towels. We were on 17 floor at the back of the hotel with a view of the 1 World Trade Centre. There are 2 lifts and they move quickly so there was never an issue getting to and from the room to the ground floor. There was free Wi-Fi for 3 devices in your room and the quality was excellent, probably the best Wi-Fi I have used in a hotel no buffering at all. The hotel as a rooftop area where you can sit, relax and enjoy the view of the Empire State Building.Breakfast was good, porridge, yoghurts, fresh waffles, bagels, bread, scrambled egg, bacon, sausage etc. The Starbucks was great and Tea Coffee and iced water was available in the breakfast area all day. If you ran out just ask and they bring f4resh. The ladies at breakfast were great always polite and they couldn’t do enough for you.My daughter was 21 while we were there. I emailed ahead and asked if we could dress up a table as a surprise for when she arrived at breakfast; they were delighted to be asked and they could help. One of the ‘breakfast’ ladies (I’m hopeless with names sorry but she had 2 young boys) helped set it up and Lina arranged a bottle of champagne for her. It was just perfect.We used the subway to get around. Turn left out of the hotel walk 200 metres and you reach line 1; 2 stops to Times Square and downtown to Battery Park, 9/11 Memorial. Turn right cross 8th Avenue walk 200 metres and you have Line N & R down to Brooklyn and Lexington Ave area.We hope we will visit New York again and if I did I would not hesitate to use this hotel again. Many thanks to Lina and her team for making our stay thoroughly enjoyable .

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is a great value for the price. Our room is flawlessly clean! Also, extremely comfortable mattress and the room is actually a bit spacious for NYC, even has a full closet and roomy bath! Location is great, right in the heart of Chelsea and subway is literally steps away. Breakfast is nothing special but is included in the price. Fabulous rooftop deck to enjoy the gorgeous views of the Empire State Bldg! I highly recommend and will return!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is my new go-to hotel when I am staying in midtown for work as everything about it was excellent. Every single interaction with the employees was pleasant and courteous like I was a regular guest instead of someone staying there for the first time. The bed was the best one I've had in a hotel in a very long time - so good that I'm ordering one for my home. The internet was fast, the water was hot, and the rooftop patio offers a nice view of the city & the ESB. My colleagues who stayed elsewhere at a higher rate were complaining about very small rooms and uncomfortable beds while I had a very pleasant stay. I can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was in NYC for one night, to visit a dying friend. The Fairfield gave me a warm welcome at the desk, a very clean good room. Everything in the room functioned well. All this was very appreciated. Having the hot shower since I hail from drought ridden California was terrific.Breakfast was very good and friendly. The surprise: a worker offered to get me a plain yogurt and actually went out to the store for that. Doesn't get much better.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room and whole hotel are in great shape, less than 5 years old. The staff and manager were very accommodating and great at addressing our questions.The location is near the subway in the flower district which added to the ambiance. The breakfast was top notch with a great selection of hot breakfast items, fruit and yogurt, and bagels.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was a 2 block walk from Penn Station. Staff was wonderfully accomodating when we asked to be on the same floor (traveling with my two sisters and my niece)... we had a king room and a two doubles room. Also... staff, everyone from reception to housekeeping, from the breakfast room attendants to the maintenance workers were cheerful, friendly, asked about our stay, and they were all very kind. My first time in NYC and it was just great! I highly recommend the people, the hotel, the convenience, and the location.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It was my second stay at this hotel and like the first time my experience was great !!!The hotel is in a perfect location, very nice rooms, excellent breakfast but the most important thing is that the hotel staff is very friendly and willing to help and make your stay the best as it can be.Special thanks for Wilson for all his help and also for all the front desk staff leaded by Lina.Looking forward for my next visit in a few months.Keep on the good work!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It was the second time that we stayed in this hotel in Chelsea and again everything was perfect (Location, Rooms, Breakfast, 24/7 free starbucks coffee) It feels like home. Extremely kind staff. Kevin & Wilson were supporting us all the time. Thank you very much guys. Definitely we go back there.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Loved how helpful the staff was. When I had a question, when I needede assistance, they were quick to respond and do so as friendly and quickness. The room was clean, the bed was super comfortable, the view of the Empire St Building at night was stunning. I've been in a lot of hotels and in NYC, this is one of mpy favorites for a reasonable price for the area. Fairly quiet rooms from other rooms and street noises.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very good location with an outstanding staff! Here's the however... Could use a facelift...and new towels. Marriott has modernized most of their Fairfield Inns...this is not one of them. The place was clean, and met my needs for 2 nights. The free breakfast is ...free

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is my fourth time on holiday to Manhattan and this is without doubt the best place I have stayed. Staff without exception were always friendly and helpful. Leo and Bethany, and everyone else, were welcoming and warm. Room was a good size (we had upgraded for the view), bed properly comfortable, TV large. We had the promised view of the Empire State Building too (I always have my doubts about view promises!). Breakfast was great. Good range from cooked to oatmeal to fruit and fibre cereal and Activia yogurt. Which is great in NYC when there is a good possibility you will spend the rest if the time eating rubbish. Location brill for us as less than ten minutes walk from Madison Square Garden and the subway was at the end of the block. Would absolutely stay here again. No problem with noisy guests either. Would not even look elsewhere now if I was to return to Manhattan. Thank you for a fab stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We arrived late and had a great check in experience. The lady at the desk was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable. The breakfast was a wonderful way to start each day. Great location, only a block from the bus/subway station for exploring. Many places to eat are located very close.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We arrived late into Chelsea and were greeted by the lovely Theresa and Leo.Due to length of our stay we were kindly upgraded to a suite by Theresa which was much appreciated and made a big difference. The room was bigger than the standard room, it had a great view of the Empire State building, a large extremely comfortable bed, large shower and quality bathroom products.Over the course of the stay Theresa and Leo became our go to people, always making things easy for us and greeting us with a smile. A special thank you to you both :)A big thank you to all the staff at this hotel as you are all great, friendly and helpful, and this makes a huge difference to the quality of the stay.The hotel roof top is a great space for guests and friends to use and if you are lucky enough to be staying on the right night, the hotel provided drinks and food on the rooftop for guests is great !The hotel location was ideal for us, with 2 stations nearby in short walking distance, Macey's and Time Square both in walking distance. Great coffee (Melbourne Australia style) close by at "7 grams", and easy access to taxis .We will definitely come back and stay at Fairfield Inn & suites in Chelsea.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our second stay in this hotel (we were here in Oct '14 too), and it was as good as we remember. Perfect location - subway is a 2 minute walk to the end of the block, and either a couple of stops on the 1 train or a 20 minute walk to the likes of Times Square, Grand Central, Madison Square Garden and so forth.Lovely, friendly staff - Jillian, Kevin, Leo, Angie and Bethany to name but a few of the front of house team, but the ladies and gents who serve up breakfast are great too.Free, unlimited breakfast (cereals, cooked breakfast, juice, yoghurt, waffles etc) really sets you up for the day and can save you buying food later in the day.Good sized room (well worth spending the extra to get a city view - who wouldn't want to see the Empire State Building out of your window), which was clean, tidy and well appointed. Decent, fast (and free) wifi for the duration of the stay was welcome too. Be aware - it's in the heart of the flower district, which means that the flower wholesalers on the street below start work at about 5am. The rooms are well soundproofed, so unlikely to disturb all but the lightest sleepers. For us, it was a bonus - we loved getting up early and watching all the goings-on below us.Bed was huge and comfortable. Bathroom was snug but had a good sized shower.There's a small gym in the basement (which we didn't use, but looked fine), plus a vending machine and ice machine.There's no opportunity for evening meals, but you can bring back food and use the dining room. However, we'd recommend taking a (literally) 2 minute walk round the corner to 6th street and visiting Waldy's Pizza and Penne. Doesn't look much from the street, but it's the best pizza we've ever tasted!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Me & My family had a great stay at the hotel. Where should I start : Check In was quick was helped by Ms. Bethany , she was very welcoming and made sure we felt comfortable.Breakfast was very good and the people who attended breakfast and took care of guest were hospitable, sorry I dnt remember their names.Room was a bit small but function able, good room amenities.Location was perfect very near to Penn Station where one can get connections to LIRR for JFk.The street every morning was full with beautiful flower and plants was awesome to walk.Over all the best part was the staff from Ms Bethany to all the staff who helped us guide our stay in New York to the last person who helped us check out the lovely lady who was working late shift was wonderful , she helped us arrange a Taxi at 4 am , she was wonderful , I wish I remember her name, please thank her It was a great stay overall.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We arrived at the hotel at 9 AM. The front desk staff Welcomed us (very friendly) and checked our bags, as the room was not ready that early in the morning.We found this site gave easy access to many NY sites we wanted to visit. On our second day there, my daughter wasn't feeling well, and the entire staff showed genuine concern for her, and kept asking us if we needed anything and offering help. The room was clean and well organized for the small space. The bed was comfortable and easy to fall asleep in. The hotel was very quiet until our last night when the alarm system went off. (Some crazy guest decided to smoke in his room) The staff was very professional and kept giving updates while the alarm service worked on silencing the alarm. Shout out to Lina the General Manager. She is amazing at her job and very accommodating.Actually all of the staff were. Thank you for a great visit Fairfield Inn Staff

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel, located in the plant district, was away from the mayhem of Times Square but central enough to walk to many of the main attractions - Times Square, Empire State, High Line, Central Park.The room was large enough with a very comfortable king size bed. There was a lovely view from the roof top where free drinks and nibbles are served every second Tuesday evening. Bethany at the front desk went out of her way to help us try to get a taxi on the morning of our departure. A quiet haven in a frenetic city. We would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We booked early and it was well priced in comparison to other properties in the area.The location suited us perfectly with good access to subway lines and other attractions. Walking distance to Madison Square Gardens, Macys, Times Square and Empire State Building. The area is very safe.Standard rooms are small for a longer stay. We were fortunately upgraded to a suite due to the length of our stay, which made a big difference. Bed (King Size) was extremely comfortable. Good bathroom products provided. It has a good roof top area available for guest use, with a great view of the Empire State Building. The hotel provided food and drinks on alternate Tuesdays during our stay which was a nice bonus.Staff are very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping were attentive and prompt.Breakfast is basic, but sufficient for a short stay. Hotel provides drip coffee and hot water all day. However, if you prefer Melbourne style coffee like ourselves, a short walk down to Seventh Avenue will take you to Seven Grams Cafe which serves awesome coffee. Highly recommended.CONS: For light sleepers, the in room air conditioning unit is fairly noisy. Ear plugs advised .

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We got to the hotel at 10:30 AM, well before check in and well before rooms were ready. The woman working the front desk was so efficient in getting our bags checked, directing us to some water and restrooms to freshen up, and then sending us out to explore the city. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was typical, neither horrible nor outstanding. Acceptable for filling up in the morning. Rooms were big for Manhattan and well-kept and clean. Exactly what you need when visiting: central location (blocks from Penn Station), right in the flower district, relatively quiet area at night. Recommended.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Where the hotel is situation it is in the middle of uptown and downtown Manhattan. A 15-20 min walk to Times Square and great shops. The hotel room is small but very clean, the beds are very comfortable. Great staff, very helpful with directions to places in New York. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I stayed 4 nights and had a very nice stay. The staff was friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a very convenient location away from the main tourist areas. We wanted to get a feel for some of the neighborhoods & this location is a good starting point. It's a block from the red line to go to WTC site and the yellow metro is 2 blocks to go up and down Broadway. The continental breakfast was nice and a good way to start the day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I go to the US Open tennis tournament most every year. This year we stayed for four nights at the Fairfield Inn and Suites/Chelsea. It was a very good choice for the Open and for sightseeing in NYC. Check- in was personable and efficient with Kevin. As requested, he assigned us a room on a high floor with a very nice view of the Empire State Building. The room, albeit it small, was well appointed and well-equipped. The room included the following: a very comfortable king bed, nice bed linens, a large flat screen TV, a desk/chair, iron/board, clock radio, adequate storage drawers/closet, nice toiletries and an adequate number of towels.The breakfast was very good and had a nice variety of foods, including continental type foods and cooked breakfast foods. The staff in the breakfast area were always helpful and accommodating.The hotel had a roof-top balcony with tables and seating which was open 24 hours and had very nice views of the surrounding city area. The hotel also had a small exercise room in the basement and somewhat unusual for NYC, the hotel had an ice machine and soft drink machine in the basement.The location of the hotel is great for travelling to the US Open. Penn Station is only a few short blocks away and the Long Island Railroad runs regularly to the National Tennis Center. The LIRR costs a few dollars more than the 7 train to the National Tennis Center but the additional cost is well worth it. The train in very clean, very cool and the seats are very comfortable. It is also usually less crowded and runs 24/7.The hotel is also well positioned for touring and sightseeing. A subway stop is about a block away which allows you to get most anywhere in NYC. The hotel is in the flower district so it’s very nice to walk through the fragrant flowers and plants when entering and exiting the hotel. Hell’s Kitchen is also close by with a number of good inexpensive restaurants in the area. Times Square is about a 15/20 minute “easy” walk from the hotel (highly recommend Matilda, if you want to see a very unique Broadway musical). The staff at the Fairfield are all very personable, helpful and accommodating. The cookies at night are a nice touch. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel for other travelers.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I want to thank the staff of the Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea for the care and empathy shown to my family.Last week, my nephew Caleb Wilford, 22, was diagnosed with cancer and had to undergo emergency surgery at Mt. Sinai Beth Israel hospital, down the street from your property. His parents, my brother Daryl and sister-in-law Sabina, hastily traveled from their home in Hawaii to be with Caleb in New York. I started calling the Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea for to book a room for the family, the hospital is right down the street.From the time I began contacting your hotel , at 4:00 am for reservations, Leo, Darren, Kevin and Bethany went above and beyond to accommodate our family. I had to call the hotel several times for arrival changes. I know I drove them crazy, I was scared and delirious. Fairfield Inn Manhattan/Chelsea, is lucky to have a very attentive and outstanding team working for them. The kindness they have shown to my family will never be forgotten. My sister Andrea Valentin is staying at your hotel too and passed on the hugs from me to Leo, Kevin, Darren and Bethany. I hope to see you all soon as we do not know how long our Caleb will be in the hospital. Thank you all and bless you.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in a great location and walkable to public transit and many tourist spots. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable especially Theresa. She is quintessential New York and helped us relive our adventures every evening and plan for our next day. She made our trip!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed at the Fairfield from 1st-7th September! This hotel doesn't disappoint. It's In a fab location, with easy access to the rest of Manhatten. The street is full of beautiful flowers, there just everywhere. Wonderfully maintained hotel, very clean and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are a little small but more than adequate. The thing I loved most about this hotel, was its amazing roof terrace, with the back drop of the Empire State Building, we mainly sat up there of an evening with drinks or a deli meal, the city just looks magical all lit up.. It's only a short walk from Penn Station, and even with suitcases was ok, there's a subway station at the end of the street too, so getting about was very easy. The complimentary breakfast always helps when deciding what hotel to choose, and there was more than enough to choose, from;sausage, eggs, potato, to cereal, waffles, yogurt, fresh fruit,bagels and muffins! Overall, I would give this hotel a huge thumbs up, it was a great base for our amazing holiday! Ladies, my only advice, is to take along your own hairdryer, there was one in the room, but it wasn't very powerful and didn't have much heat, it took ages to dry our hair. 10 out of 10, would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed at the Fairfield while in NYC for the U.S. Open. The staff couldn't have been nicer! One of the best I have experienced at any hotel. The hotel is clean and while the rooms were small, (not usually for NY) they were very comfortable. Loved the pent house roof top. Picked up a pizza and wine and took up to roof top to enjoyed. Great view of the Empire State Building. Be sure to check out Eataly, which is close by while you are there.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a small hotel with little facilities but the roof terrace overlooking the Empire State Building is lovely only spoiled by the amount of smokers using it. We had a problem with housekeeping one day I felt ill so put the do not service notice on the door which was fine , however the next day we did not put out the sign but the room was not serviced so we mentioned this at reception and the housekeeping guyapologised. However I think they might have been annoyed as when we returned the beds had been straightened but not toiletries replaced no spare toilet roll and when my daughter opened the towels they were only re folded not replaced which meant we had those for 3 days yuk. Eventually after complaining again we were given loo rolls and towels but a big blemish on an otherwise perfect stay. No housekeeping tip left this trip.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is about 5 blocks from Penn Station, a block from the 1-2-3 subway, two blocks from the N-Q-R subway and about 4 blocks from the 6 subway -- great location for everything. The staff are all very friendly. Rooms are small but recently updated with high quality bedding. Internet is free and fast. Breakfast includes eggs, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, all kinds of bread and breakfast pastries. Fast elevators. Reasonable prices considering what hotels charge in New York City. We will stay here on future trips.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We checked in in the early morning but our room was ready as promised and the front desk clerk was top notch, I wish I had gotten her name. The rooms are smaller than average BUT you are in NY. It was me, Hubby and a 14 year old and there was plenty of room for us although the bathroom is a little awkward because of the size but still very nice. A nice surprise was the breakfast with a decent selection of food and the upstairs sitting area to relax and have drinks or conversation. We enjoyed our stay and because the location was so close to a subway we will make this our go to hotel when in NY. We were lucky to find street parking, good thing the car stayed parked all weekend because you couldn't find it when all the flowers were out. You are definitely in the flower district.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed for a couple of weeks at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Chelsea. The front desk staff was really warm and welcoming, especially Kevin! Kevin was always friendly and sometimes even saved the evening cookies for us when we came in late! Bethany and Keshia were also nice. The rooms are very small - not much space to store luggage, but the location is great. The bathroom was very small, but well appointed. It was nice to walk out into the floral district and smell the flowers. The breakfast is really good and there is a lot of it. Easy access to the subway. We had a great stay! Good value for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My stay at Fairfield Inn & Suites--Chelsea was terrific! The rooms are kept very clean and have anything you need. The front desk staff was AWESOME and helped me in any way they could. Breakfast was delicious too. I would recommend this to anyone :)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location. Less than 200m metres from two subway stations, almost in the shadow of the Empire State and Penn Station and Times Square are walkable.This is New York so space is a premium and unless you have lots of money, hotels are small and tend to be a bit grubby. Accepting this, this hotel is OK. Our room was nominally for 4, but was basically two double beds in a single room. It was pretty cramped as our teenage kids are tall and so are we parentsA well worked little roof terrace around the 19th floor with an incredible view of the Empire State building was a nice surprise. There is no bar in the hotel but we took a bottle of wine up on a warm evening admiring the view and listening to the sounds of the cityBut where this hotel really scored was the staff. We had arrived from the rural south where the level of friendliness and courtesy are off the scale and so had braced ourselves more abrasive New Yorkers. All the staff could not be more helpful and friendly, getting us anything we needed and answering our dumb tourist questions without any hint of exasperation. We also witnessed the same treatment for other guests .A special mention for receptionist Britney who could not have been more helpful when we had to check out at lunch but were not flying until the evening. She tried to get us an even later checkout (tough as they were full) and then helped us store a huge amount of luggage and got us towels to freshen up on a sweltering day. Also got us a car which could cope with our excessive luggage. All this despite being on the late shift the night before and being heavily pregnant. All the staff (bell hops, cleaners, other receptionists and breakfast staff) was helpful, but Britany cheered up some sad brits who were on there way home after a great holiday . If the big Marriot corporate bosses read this, these foot soldiers are what makes the difference to us visitors

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have a lot of great things to say about our stay; Here is the brief, read on if you want to know more!Location: Good. Close to subway and pleasant walking distance to many attractions. In the flower district. Fast response from Uber drivers and cabs. Accommodation: Very comfortable. Small bathroom but the bed was great! We also had a great view of the Empire State BuildingCustomer service: Far exceeded expectations! Leo is fantastic!Breakfast: Satisfactory! Good to know: Wifi is good, there is a gym (we did not use it), comfortable rooftop access with view of the Empire State Building, Comfortable beds, blackout curtains, cold AC, hot shower, fast elevator.My husband and I just returned from a one week stay at the Fairfield Inn in Chelsea. We booked our trip to New York as a belated honeymoon, celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary as well as my 30th birthday. As we are in our first year of marriage we wanted something that was not going to break the bank, but something that would do justice to the multiple celebrations. The Fairfield Inn met and exceeded our expectations. About a week before the trip my husband called and spoke with Leo letting him know the purpose of our trip. Leo went above and beyond making our stay special. He was able to offer us an upgraded room and greeted us with a warm welcoming smile when we checked in. As we arrived several hours early, the staff offered to hold our luggage for us (for free) so we could go explore the city while we waited. Once we came back and checked into our room we were incredibly pleased by everything. The room was very comfortable and the view of the Empire State Building was unexpected and very nice! A factor for our decision to book with Fairfield Inn was the included breakfast. We were not expecting anything spectacular and would have been perfectly fine with cereal and bagels. The breakfast did include cereal and bagels, but also muffins, toast, hot eggs, fruit, a breakfast meat (sausage or bacon), waffles, yogurt, coffee, tea and much more. We ate breakfast downstairs almost every morning and enjoyed the variety. The staff were always very friendly and accommodating to us. We were meet with a smile and polite greeting every morning when we headed out, and friendly conversation upon return regarding our day. Everyone that we interacted with seemed to meet us where we were at. If we wanted to chat a bit, they kindly obliged and engaged in pleasant conversation. If we were worn out and just looking to get to our room, they did not intrude.The day we were to check out was very rainy. Since check out was at noon, but our flight did not leave until 7pm, Leo was able to allow us to check out late so we did not have to arrive at the airport 7 hours early. The absolute cherry on top of this fantastic stay was the little surprise we got one even upon returning to our room. The staff had decorated our room with rose petals, fruit, cupcakes, a bottle of wine and a card wishing us a happy anniversary. We were so blown away by the attention to detail and the customer service we experienced during our stay. My husband and I plan on returning to NYC regularly (Yankee fans!) and I know where we will be booking again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I checked into the Fairfield early and they did not have my room ready .Keshia worked with me to find me a room as I have some work to do . Keshia is always so atttentive to my needs and cheerful "even when its raining " I primarily stay at the Fairfield Chelsea when I am in NYC because it is consistently the best experience and the people genuinely enjoy their jobs and it shows!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were extremely happy with this hotel. It's very well-located and on the weekends the street has free parking. The #1 train is down the block. Also, the block is full of flower vendors so in the summer it's very festive.We were able to get a "city view" room with a perfect view of the Empire State Building. The bed was excellent. The bathroom was a bit tight, but fine. Breakfast was average and a bit cramped, but acceptable. The best part of this hotel is the staff. The front desk people, esp. Brittany, are terrific. Every staff member I encountered was friendly. I rode the elevator with one of the maintenance workers and he seemed sincere in asking how my stay was. Truly great customer service.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May 2015, the rooms were well equipped and very comfortable and the hotel was very well located in the 'garden district' of Manhattan. It's 6 blocks from Macy's and Madison Square Garden and a short walk to several subway stations.The staff were very helpful and very friendly, this was our 5th visit to NYC and this was the best hotel that we'd stayed in. The best 'extra' was the free breakfast in the conservatory. There was a very good selection of bagels, pastries, cereal and cold food. We'd definitely stay here again. It's not super deluxe but its good for the price for NYC.One tip for NYC - if you fly into JFK, get the subway into town during the day and get either the subway or a taxi at night. Do not bother with the shuttle buses unless you fancy a magical mystery tour of Manhattan / The Bronx / Washington Heights and a transfer time of a good few hours.
user_name:
Chris T
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is located within a few blocks of Times Square, Bryant Park, the worlds largest Macy's and much more. You can also see the Empire State Building from the rooftop of the hotel. There was a subway a block away as well.The customer service was good. Anytime we needed extra towels or blankets the concierge came promptly. Although the rooms were very small they were clean. You don't spend much time in the room with all of the nearby attractions so that wasn't a big deal. Breakfast stayed fully stocked daily and there was plenty of seating and room to move around. I would recommend this hotel and I will be staying here the next time I'm in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I found that every employee I had contact with was very professional and polite. Several went out of there way to ask if I needed anything. Housekeeping staff was excellent. Excellent service delivered by Brittany, Theresa, Keshia, Bethany, Leo, Kevin and Dennis. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel conveniently located near Madison Square Garden, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Highline. Receive parcels. Regular room service. Spacious rooms with no microwave, refrigerator and safety box. Breakfast very good. With an open penthouse for sunbathing or something. Front desk crew awesome. 1 block from the subway. 10 blocks from times square. 4 blocks to Empire State Building. My appreciation to Supervisor Kevin Cfuentes.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I visited NYC the weekend of July 10-12 and chose this hotel based on good reviews and close proximity to MSG. We were attending a concert there Friday and arrived early. We were told that early check in was to be determined upon availability on arrival. We were pleasantly surprised to find an available room on the 12th floor with a perfect view of the Empire State Building! The front desk clerk, Bethany, was a HUGE help and a doll to work with. Another surprise was the rooftop terrace! We enjoyed many cocktails up there while enjoying the unobstructed view of the Empire State Building! BYOB :) The rooms were clean and the bed was VERY comfortable, especially after a day of walking around the city. However, the bathroom was a tad small. You're in NYC though, so it's to be expected. I woke up the next morning early and came downstairs to find a nice continental breakfast spread. They had eggs, sausage, hash browns, baked goods, juice, and STARBUCKS COFFEE!! We enjoyed a great day walking around the city on Saturday and found a great Sushi place for dinner, located within the Bryant Park Hotel, Koi. It was delicious and Ya Ya the hostess went out of her way to seat us at the perfect table! On the morning of our departure, we called down to front desk to ask for the valet to bring our car and were told there was a two hour wait. We were not in any rush to get home. So, this didn't upset us, but if you need to get out at a specific time. PLAN ACCORDINGLY!!! It seemed as though there was only one man working the valet service, and on a Sunday morning at check out time, it's VERY BUSY! So, we went to plan B. Bethany, at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful and understanding. There is a $1500 charge for checkout time past 11:00 and she waved that for us, as well as gave us some good ideas on what to do with our "free time." We ended up taking a left out of the hotel doors and ran into the Highline walking trail. I highly recommend it! We had an amazing view of the Hudson River and lots of surprises along the way! Eventually we ended up at the Chelsea Market and were again pleasantly surprised!!! We made it back by 11:30 to find our car waiting outside the hotel for us. We had a great weekend and will definitely be back to the Fairfield Inn! :)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Good location, close to Penn Station (we walked down to catch the train to DC with all our luggage with no hassle), and breakfast included. The room was what we were expecting size wise. Big enough for two people but not a large suite. The bathroom was quite small and lacked bench space to put anything. The water from the cold tap in the bathroom in warm/hot so not very nice to drink from.The breakfast was basic; cereal, toast, bagels, yoghurt, fruit salad if you were lucky, and two hot options; either sausage patties, dry overcooked bacon, fried potatoes or scrambled egg patties which weren't appealing. There was also free starbucks coffee you could help yourself to anytime of the day.The let down was that there was hardly ever water available to drink at breakfast, I think I counted twice there was a glass water dispenser by the coffee you could help yourself to, otherwise you only had juice, coffee or tea to drink. A hot chocolate option would be a nice addition too. Also, the cereals weren't refilled during the breakfast sittings and most if not all options were high in sugar children style options.The fruit salad was also not refilled so if you weren't down there early you were tough out of luck.Our last morning there was a Sunday and the hotel clearly had a lot of guests. We had to go away then come back for breakfast as the first time there was no where to sit. Upon our return we noticed that even though there was clearly people still coming down close to 10:30 am (which is the finishing time for breakfast), possibly due to having to go away and come back again like us, the staff packed up breakfast bang on time. The breakfast maid was literally taking the bread away while people were still queuing for the toaster machine and locking up all the plates and cutlery etc. It actually felt quite mean and snarky and I witnessed a lot of disgruntled guests who missed out. We understand things have to run on schedule, but the dining area is too small for a large number of guests to use at one time and so maybe the hotel should either extend the weekend dining times or be a little bit lenient so nobody misses out.The best part of the hotel was their front of house employee Daniel, who always greeted us when we entered, was extremely welcoming and helpful with any questions or issues and farewelled us like we were friends.Overall a good stay and we would recommend this hotel to others and would probably stay at it again if we ever returned to New York.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We wanted to stay somewhere nice near Penn Station. We found the place. Just about a 10 min walk from the trian station and not too far from anywhere. Room was of course the usual NYC size, but we did score an ADA bathroom so we had plenty of room. Very clean and staff were so nice. Breakfast was the usual; eggs, sausage, and potatoes. The difference here was it was hot. It was right in the middle of the flower market block so the place smelled wonderful. Our room was at the back of the building and we did not year one bit of traffic there. Would mostly definitely book here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: All the people at the hotel are amazing!!! Leo and Kevin were so helpful at all times! They definitely made our stay in NYC great!!! Rooms were always clean and tidy and breakfast was superb!!!!!! The location of the hotel is perfect, so that you can go walking almost everywhere!! I would come back to the Fairfield Chelsea, no doubt!!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were going to attend an event at Madison Square Garden so booked a room at this hotel which is close by. Upon our arrival there was an issue with their computer system but we were still able to check in early. What could have been an inconvenience for incoming guests was handled with by a wonderful staff who went above and beyond to take care of their guests. Thank you so much Keshia at the front desk and the man who appeared to be the head of housekeeping who escorted us to our room. Also, the breakfast there was very nice with a large selection of fully stocked hot and cold items.
user_name:
Sue S
Wappingers Falls, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a late review for a stay in May visiting NYU with my son. I stay at Marriott hotels and this has been the best by far. It is located in a charming street lined with floral and ramen shops. It is quiet and close to the subway. The staff was outstanding, every single one of them including the personable mgr. Darren P, but Kawanna, was especially accommodating, and made every effort to make our stay special. She is a seasoned front-desk agent and does her job well. The rooms are modern, quiet, and spotless, and the beds are very comfortable. The setup is ideal, equipped with functioning fridges, great views, good lighting, clean carpet, sensible lighting, and exceptionally clean bathrooms. The breakfast area is a little tight and can get congested, but the offerings are fresh and varied. Would be great if they offered their famous yogurt parfait and fresh pastries. This will be my NYC hotel for the long run. Thx for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Fairfield Inn on 28th St. in Chelsea/Manhattan was an "interesting" stay. The staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. The street is also interesting in that apparently this very block of Manhattan is some kind of "floral district" so regardless of the warm weather "aroma" NYC tends to give you this time of year... each early morning, the vendors start to set out their flowers, trees, shrubs and plants for distribution/sale. The bonus that this street smells wonderful! Then each evening, they move them back indoors and it's like it never happened. But all and all, to an out of towner, it seemed like a pretty average big city street with a couple of indirect added bonuses. There are a couple of average-good restaurants nearby and a Duane Reade market on nearly every corner.Again, upon arrival the front desk staff was very kind and immediately offered a dinner destination (which was just ok). Be forewarned, most things about this hotel are quite small, including the lobby. By far the smallest lobby I've experienced. They they did somehow manage a nice little patio area out front to safely watch NY life go by.The rooms are also fairly, if not quite, small. I did have a King bed with 2 nightstands, a desk, a TV stand/dresser, small closet and small bathroom. All of which were very clean, including the shower (usual giveaway on cleanliness). The room was semi-modern and had a reasonable amount of outlets for charging all of todays devices, but I would have preferred a couple more on the night stands (1 per nightstand) and possibly some USB chargers around the room as most new hotels do. The bathroom was tiny (door has to be opened and closed to get around it to use the vanity), but usable. Again, shower/tub with cloth curtain was clean and water pressure was decent. Vanity was small but perfectly functional. Vanity mirror had an ambient light that is a nice feature. Bathroom did have a overhead light out that made it a bit dark though. All and all, better than average all around the restroom though.Upon arrival for some reason the TV was unplugged and the remote seemed to not want to respond to it very well. But ultimately it satisfied. Street view was interesting (from 9th floor) and I was able to see the Empire State Building from the room/bed - that was kind of cool. Otherwise, interesting views of other building rooftops and city life.I opted to take the hotel up on their black car back to the airport on my final morning at their recommendation - they said it would ultimately be cheaper than a cab or Uber - but with tip (20%) it ended up just under $80. I think I could have gotten a cab or Uber cheaper, but it was morning rush hour so who knows.I think I'll try a couple of the other newer hotels on 28th street on my upcoming trips back to this area, but if I had to stay at this hotel again, it would not concern me.Oh, one last thing... as usual with most hotels today... the wifi was atrociously slow. photo attached of the internet speed test. Thi

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Bethany, Leo, and Kevin were all great, they were so friendly and made our stay fantastic! They were helpful and accommodating. We'll be back!!Wine service would be a wonderful addition to the roof top patio!☆Tracy and Kym

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at this hotel over the Memorial weekend. Family members from Buffalo & Rochester came down on Amtrak to join me. They chose this hotel because it was within walking distance from Penn Station. I came in on local Metro North Railroad and took the subway down. Easy-Peasy! The hotel was small (11 floors / 10 or less rooms per floor.) but the rooms were very spacious for NYC. The price was excellent. The hotel is on 28th....which is where they sell wholesale flowers & plants. So the walk from the subway, restaurants, and other local businesses was down a sidewalk filled with beautiful flowers. How enchanting is that?Hotel staff was friendly. The breakfast was included....the dining room was a bit crowded during the "breakfast rush"...which was between 8 and 9 am. Many times the coffee urn was empty, however, there was always coffee and tea in the breakfast room at all hours. Afternoon tea ? Yes you can!If you are on a budget and don't mind a quite neighborhood hotel - this is the one for you. It's close to 2 subway lines and there were lots of taxis available. Two local markets within a block of the hotel....for a quick beer run after a busy sightseeing day. Perfect. Marriott never disappoints.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We (young couple) stayed three nights in Fairfield Inn hotel in Chelsea. Good thing about this hotel were breakfast as you rarely can find hotel in New York with breakfast included for this price. Wi Fi was poor and room was not spacious too.. Location is very good, close to Pen station, Empire state building other attractions..If you staying in this hotel, go to 230 fifth avenue roof top bar. Amazing!!
user_name:
And K
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A perfect spot in Chelsea/ Manhattan with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. We enjoyed being in the midst of the Flower District and just blocks from the Flatiron area's great restaurants and shopping. Excellent location within blocks of two subway stops.
