The staff is most helpful, and the hot breakfast in the "atrium" was a bonus. Will definitely keep this on our list of places to say when visiting friends and family in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was perfect for my weekend in NYC. I had a great view of the Empire State Building. The room was small (but I expect that in NYC), but totally comfortable and clean. The staff was helpful. I did not eat the breakfast. I will stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Me and four colleagues stayed in the Fairfield for a full on five days at NYCxDesign. From the beginning the hotel did everything they could to make things easy for us, when there was confusion on the number of rooms we'd booked when we arrived, Leo at the front desk (who was utterly charming throughout our entire stay) upgraded us instantly to 'rooms with a view' – and it was a fantastic view, with the Empire State Building towering nearby. Printing facilities were really helpful, especially as we were there in a work capacity, and everything was clean and the showers were satisfyingly powerful. The location is great – Chelsea, Meatpacking, the High Line, Midtown and the Village are all within easy roaming distance, and there's a subway at the end of the street for trips further afield. The street the hotel is on is lined with wholesale flower sellers, making the street a verdant urban jungle during the day. Top tip: there's a great coffee shop around the corner called 7 grams!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was very neat, nice, and clean. The housekeeping staff was extremely helpful and the front desk was very welcoming. They also provided high-quality shampoo and conditioner (Paul Mitchell) and have a little fitness center in the basement. There are several very good Korean restaurants just a few footsteps away from the hotel. Also check out the nail salon right next door!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: friendly reception on both daysclean roomlovely place with all the plant-shops aroundexcellent breakfast with big choice of food and drinks (unfortunately plates, fork and knifes made of plastic)quick transport at the end of the journey

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I stayed here 4 nights while visiting New York. The room was small and clean. Housekeeping was dissapointing. One day we didn't get our room cleaned and one day had to settle for having them hand us fresh towels because they didn't get to our room until late and we needed to get ready for our dinner plans. Elevators slooooooow. Breakfast was very good and the front desk was always friendly and helpful. Love Tiger, the cat that sits out front and greets all!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Fairfield for 4 nights in late May. We arrived a few hours early and we're checked in straight away (super convenient!) Our room had a king bed and was larger than expected. We were on the 11th floor and had a good view of the Empire State Building. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, breakfast was fine (Starbucks coffee available 24 hrs) and the wifi was fast and reliable. The hotel is in a good location, close to the subway and plenty of places to eat nearby.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stopped in NYC for a night en route to a conference in Upstate NY....so close to Penn Station, Subway, Chelsea Studios, SoHo and everything else you might want to do in NYC.Staff was so kind and patient, I called numerous times for assistance with directions and recommendations on places to dine, etc.Accommodations were actually better than I expected - I could see the Empire State Building from my room.Will ABSOLUTELY return if I find myself in this part of NYC again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My son and daughter-in-law recently moved to New York so my wife and I decided to extend a business trip and stay the weekend prior to the business meeting at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for a total of 5 days. When the business meeting got cancelled we decided to go to NY anyway but only to stay for the weekend. I changed my flight schedule but forgot to change the hotel reservation (which needed to be paid fully in advance - no refunds once the stay commenced). When we checked out on Monday morning the front desk agent informed us that the reservation was till Wednesday and that there was no refund in principle. I told her we had to leave anyway and she said she would speak to management to get me a refund. And indeed 2 days later I was informed that the hotel would give me a refund. This is one of the many reasons why I am a Marriott Reward member for more than twenty years! The service oriented approach of the front desk agent (Kawanna Phoenix) in my experience is typical of what the Marriott group of hotels are known for!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was well designed and as clean as could be, with a view that could only be described as stunning. The location is very convenient - right in the middle of the wholesale flower market - and the FULL breakfast was an unexpected delight. You're not going to find a better deal in NYC!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here with a group for work, they had the best rates in the area. We were all really happy when we found the hotel & rooms clean & modern. We've all stayed in so many NYC hotels that were less than desirable (run down, dirty, bad service) and paid a crazy high rate for. The area is great too, lots of good restaurants in walking distance. Also, it's in the middle of the flower district, so every day you exit the hotel to a jungle of beautiful plants & amazing smelling flowers. It was a real treat every morning!The staff was really nice, very warm greeting at the front desk and always very helpful and informative. I must make a special note for Leo & Kevin, they were both superb and sincerely friendly. Great guys! Overall, I definitely would recommend this hotel to travelers coming for both work or pleasure!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very good location- right beside a row of flower shops, Japanese restaurant (Ajisen Ramen) and walking distance to Times Square, Chelsea Market, even the High Line (well, it was not that near, but my family loves to walk and explore together). There were a lot of places to discover around West 34 street- with the street food fair, etc...At night, you can see the beautiful Empire State Building all lit up!If you want a simple place to stay in the city - this is for you. The bed was very comfy. The room was small but it was very clean and modern. The bathroom was also clean and updated in terms of fixtures and decors. I also liked that they have free wifi.The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The top reason for us to book it was the price, which was the best we found in the areas we wished to stay in Manhattan.The room was pretty small, but clean and the shower was great. The window is about 10 meters from the next building, so the view was just a wall with some windows. In the second night, our air conditioner roared like a blender, so we had to turn it off in the following 4 nights.There are no facilities in the hotel, except for the breakfast lounge (which didn't have enough tables in the peak hours) and the rooftop area (which has nothing but 2 tables, but the view to the Empire State is awesome). Sometimes we just took our breakfast up the rooftop and made a picnic with a great view).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was in a great location for where I needed to be for work! It was reasonably priced, and had a lot of great amenities, like free breakfast, free wifi, and a 24 hour gym. The staff was very friendly and the rooms and whole hotel was very clean. Great stay and would highly recommend! There aren't a bunch of rooms on each floor, its like a tall skinny hotel. There's only about 8 rooms on each floor. And I'd say about half of them touch the elevator bank. When it was functioning properly, you didn't hear a thing. It was a bit noisy when I arrived, but the staff was on it and it was fixed the next day. The rooms that touch the elevator bank, I'm pretty sure they don't have a city view either. If you get a room with a city view, you have a clear view of the empire state building. It's kinda worth the extra money.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem, literally situated right in the flower district. I stayed loved walking out of the hotel each morning and into the flower vendors' wares. The hotel is a quiet section of W 28th Street far enough from 6th and 7th for plenty of peace and quiet at night. The staff is both efficient and helpful, and held our luggage even after we checked out until it was time to catch our bus in the afternoon.The rooms are small but stylish and clean, and worked just fine for two.If you're a walker like my friend and I, then I highly recommend the hotel. It is located about an equal distance right between Times Square and Greenwich Village, and served as a great base for our exploration of the City. We look forward to staying here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I were staying Fairfield Chelsea at the end of April. The hotel has a very pleasant atmosphere. The room and shower were very clean, comfortable and very spacious. The hotel is close to two subway stations. Breakfast was tasty and filling.  I want to praise the hotel reception staff and especially the hospitality and professionality of Ms. Britney.Thank you very much! We will sure come again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: the hotel is in a convenient location and we appreciated the very small but clean rooms.What really took away from the trip was the noise the elevator makes when in use - a constant very loud and very annoying noise that feels as if it's right next to you......They said one of the elevators has a problem ( not unsafe to use it ) - and they switch it off at night but it's really really very loud when switched back on in the morning.....And why would it not be fixed ...???

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is one of the best marriotts ihave stayed in. The staff was fantastic,everything worked, andit was clean. Ask for even number room, they face the street and have space for suitcases, odd number rooms are small__ xx1, xx7 are very small, xx3 and xx5 are a little bigger.1block from 1 subway, 3 blocks from 4/5/6 subway. Three blocksfrom penn station,walk to hotel. Plan on subway, $31 for a 7 day bus/subway unlimited pass. Stay away fromcabs, everyone sems to ride the subways

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel has just about everything you would ever need for a trip to NYC. Amazing service, immaculate rooms and an amazing free breakfast. Every time we passed by the desk we were greeted with BIG smiles and always a friendly hello. As you exit the hotel you are awakened by beautiful bright flowers everywhere as the hotel is located in the heart of the Flower District. The hotel is close to Penn Station, Hearld Square, Times Square and several Subway lines. Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer. We will be back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Sunday morning and lots of people checking out, asking tourist questions, calling down for their cars, etc. How many people does management have on the front desk to handle all this in one of the biggest cities in the world? One. She is doing the best anyone could under the circumstances but there can be no excuse for such short staffing. As a result, I called down repeatedly to have my car brought around but no one answered at the front desk. And when I went in person, and made it to the front of the line, it took so long I finally walked to the garage and got it myself. In addition, the drain in the shower backed up and the light over the sink in the bathroom didn't work properly. The AC system lurched from too cold to too hot and couldn't find much room in between. I can say the breakfast was decent. And the staff they did have worked hard and were pleasant. But those are about the only positives I can come up with. I'm surprised Marriott lets their name be used when it is so poorly staffed.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We have stayed here many times and have always been pleased with the staff, the cleanliness, the breakfast etc. This was our first stay as Platinum members and we were a little disappointed that our request for more pillows went unheeded---since we received no other special gift. Depending on the dates of your stay these are sometimes not the lowest rates on Marriott....so always compare....even with the Hilton next door.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Many things are wonderful about this hotel. First the staff is outstanding, very helpful, friendly, room was spotlessly clean, etc. But the a/c heat system either blasted you with freezing cold air, or with heat. It was ok just to turn it off for awhile, but then it got too hot and we were forced to endure the cold blast again. Good things were a fabulous view of the Empire State Building from the 15th floor, the interesting location on 28th St between 6th and 7th with all the wholesale flower markets. In the daytime the sidewalk was lined with flowers, gorgeous. It is walking distance from Penn station, has good subway connections, bathroom was fine, the free breakfast was unusually good, with hot scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, cereal, yogurt, juice, hard boiled eggs, bagels, good coffee and tea.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I often stay at this hotel . I never get over how accomodating the staff is .Multiple times I have had special requests and they are always happy to help me out . Last time I stayed , I forgot some of my clothing in my closet ( I know, I know ) and had to call Lina . Lina made it so easy for me to recieve my clothing via Fedex . I would love to say they went above and beyond ( which they did ) , but this is not the exception , it is the rule with them . I stay exclusively in Marriott properties for business because I can rely on excellent service , clean on trend rooms and good locations . I will continue to stay at the Fairfield - Chelsea and look forward to my next trip back to NYC .Thansk Lina !

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location is great, rooms clean and comfortable, and good view. The rates are not terrible for Manhattan and sometimes there are excellent deals. Marriott treats its guests well. Leo and the others took good care of me and my colleagues who I also booked for this hotel. We'll be back soon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location could not be better. One block from the 1 train and walking distance from the BDFMNQR in Chelsea. The hotel is incredibly clean and the city views are to die for. The staff are incredibly friendly and professional. I always feel so welcome every time I come back. Prices are super reasonable for NY, so you never feel ripped off. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city.
user_name:
Kelforest20
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The staff at this hotel is superior! From the kitchen staff in the morning who cook the all you can eat breakfast, to the housekeeping, (they are constantly mopping the floors) to the front desk, everyone seems happy to be there and to help make your stay nice.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Excellente situation in the heart of Manhattan, Excellent service (Thank you Lina - assistant general manager- for your kindness and your effectiveness).Excellent ratio price/services, but we had booked very long time ago.Rooms a bit too small, but we got a room for 4 persons. A very good point for families.Excellent breakfast, but plastic cutlery. I'm not sure that it is at the level of this hotel...We had a room situated on the yard, and it was really very quiet.Overall appreciation: An excellent choice if you intend to visit New York in Family.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This member of the Marriott family of hotels boasts a convenient location in Chelsea on the same street as the Flower District, lined with numerous vendors of plants, flowers, etc. A subway station and Sixth Avenue are within a block's radius. Service is adequate. Rooms are clean and decently sized, but sounds from other rooms and the hallway sometimes do travel. The free wifi worked fine. Having room safes would definitely be a plus. A basic hot breakfast starts the day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: When we booked our hotel we were torn between finding a hotel in Brooklyn to be near family or in Manhattan, to be in the center of the universe. We made a decision that Chelsea would be great central point and we knew that it was a neighborhood with a lot of culture and charm. At first we hide a little trouble finding the Fairfield Inn as it was tucked away between two flower shops in what we soon discovered as the Flower District. We were pleasantly surprised to what we find inside this small but somewhat tall hotel. Our room was small but it was expected, after all, it is NYC and who goes to NYC to stay in their hotel room. The room was modern and clean, wireless was super fast and free, the hot breakfast buffet was amazing and offered something for everyone, hot or cold and the staff was unbelievable. I don't think we have ever seen so many smiles in NYC, it appears they enjoy their jobs and really care about their guests. We will be back in August and we know exactly where we will be staying. Thank you Fairfield Inn for a great experience.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Location is great. Awesome, HOT breakfast - Starbucks coffee, eggs, sausages!! Room is spotless, super comfortable. Free wifi!!!Upgrade to a room with a view of The Empire State Building - stunning.Staff really step up - Leo worked with Expedia to get a refund when my delayed flight meant I missed my first night stay. Kawanna organized a car for the airport for me. They even gave me a late checkout when my flight back was delayed. So friendly, felt like I was coming home to friends every evening.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for three nights. I arrived by car. It was convenient to get to off of the West Side Hwy and the hotel validated a nearby garage at $35 a night total (including the 18% parking tax!), which makes driving an attractive option. it's also a ten minute walk from Penn Station.The room was clean and small (it is NYC). 28th St has a lot of wholesale flower markets and things get loud early with deliveries etc, so if you want quiet, ask for the back of the bldg. The front has the benefit of a great Empire State Building view!The 1 train (Down Town to Greenwich Village all the way down to Battery Park or Uptown along the Upper West Side) is at the end of the block, making it a very convenient place to stay if you are looking to see the statue of liberty or 911 Memorial & Museum. A ten minute walk to the highline and chelsea market. 15 minutes to Times Square through Herald Square.Serviceable breakfast included for those on a budget. Not a lot of nightlife in the immediate vicinity, but Greenwich Village is 3 stops away (Christopher Street stop) or walk up to Empire State Bldg or Times Square.The staff was top notch - extremely courteous and helpful. Will definitely repeat.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is nearly perfect for a visit to New York city. All the personnel were very polite, friendly, and professional. The rooms are very cleand and up to date. The breakfast (included) is very good (egg, sausage, pastries, bread, fresh fruit, yogurts, juices, starbucks coffe, and variety of teas). The location is excellent, right in the middle of manhattan, with everything minutes away by subway (or walking distance if all you want is to visit midtown landmarks). The hotel has a deal with a parking garage (half a block away) were you can either self park ($35 for car, $45 for SUV - 24 hr rate) or valet park (extra $10). The rooms are not very big, but they are not "european small" either.In my opinion, for a base from which to explore the city this hotel is an excellent choice at a more reasonable price than many other hotels in the area. Definitely a great choice for the practical traveller. In my case there were 7 of us (4 kids, 2 adults) and two double bed rooms were perfect !!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed here prob 25 times the last 2 years and have never had a bad experience. The staff is very friendly and professional. It is far enough away from the tourist area, yet close enough to get everywhere. Wish it had a market place to purchase snacks. The free breakfast and nearby parking are very important. I will be back soon. The rooms seem a little bigger than most NY rooms too.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is the best hotel for the money in NYC. Location-wise it can't be beat. You're walking distance from pretty-much anything. The rooms aren't as ridiculously small as most Manhattan hotels. The front desk crew, particularly Leo, couldn't be any cooler or more accommodating.I wish I had more thumbs to turn 'up' for this hotel!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 2 days. It's in a good location in Chelsea and the 1 train is on the same st.(28). It's easy to get around even if you are not a native New Yorker like myself. The rooms are decently sized, however the bathroom is quite small. The door is quite close to the faucet etc. House staff was friendly and courteous. The pricing is quite affordable especially for NYC. If you are taking a few days in the city, I would recommend this hotel. It is in the flower district so mornings tend to be loud and from the vendors below. We had a front facing room on the 6th floor and got some awesome views of the Empire state building, at night it was breathtaking. I suggest one request a high floor just to see that.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have been in Management for over 20yrs, and stayed in hundreds of Hotels , as times changed the service did too, Not here they were Personal, Professional ,I felt as if I knew the staff for along time. that is something not often experienced today. I arrived early , they checked my luggage, and called me when the room was ready, outstanding . I was out for the evening and returned very late as i came in i was greeted and stated, may i have some towels sent up , by the time i arrived at the room the staff met ne as i opened the door . unheard of at least in my travels. I have stayed at hotels that were far more exclusive from suites Atlantic City Maryland, to just name a few most corporated choice, but still the service was in no comparsion to the staff at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Chelsea NYC . I have to return to NYC every 4 to 5 weeks and the obvious choice is Fairfield 28th st Chelsea, Quiet safe and in the area that is convient for my business in NYC .

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The Holiday Inn - Chelsea was a good experience for my little family of four. The rooms were well appointed, albeit very cozy (read SMALL). The front desk staff were very accommodating and even offered me a late check out upon arrival. We loved the hotel restaurant...the staff was great and children under 12 eat free. They offered a great breakfast to begin the day. The hotel is in a very central area and it was never a problem walking to find food, parks and/or catching a taxi to the sites we wanted to check out. Our stay was a quiet one for the most part, however, the rooms are pretty close together, so we could hear our neighbors leaving and coming. The downside to our stay was the elevator. On top of being TINY, it took forever to move between the 25 floors.Luckily, I requested a lower floor when I booked, so we were able to take the steps when the elevators took too long. The hotel also had FREE wifi for up to 5 devices, however, it was very slow.All in all, the 4 day/3 night stay was a nice one and I would recommend this location to folks visiting the city.
user_name:
Veronica K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location is perfect if you are visiting lower Manhattan. The staff is very professional both on the phone when making inquiries and in person. Rooms were attractive, up to date and inviting. Breakfast in NYC is a big PLUS and the food was excellent with a lot of choices.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was nice and clean, the bed was very comfortable and the staff was excellent. It was a nice size room for Manhattan, basic but nice. The only real problem I had was the bathroom had no shelves or anything to hold anything at all. It would be an easy fix.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for a business trip and loved the experience of walking down the sidewalk, taking in the sights and smells of the remarkable flower shops and displays right up to the discreet doorstep of the hotel. This has to be the greatest smelling hotel entrance in all of NYC. The rooms are decent size for NYC and surprisingly quiet. The location is ideal for public transit as well as walking to a few iconic locations. During a bit of downtime, I took about a 10 minute walk up 6th Ave to 34th street to see the historic Macy's, Herald Square and other shopping (the two story Sephora was very busy but a great experience). The service was at Marriott standards. The friendly staff accommodated my unexpected early arrival. I travel to NYC fairly often and will definitely add the Fairfield Inn Chelsea to my list of favorites.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I didn't think it was still possible to book a hotel and not on prices for less than $100 in NYC. I got this for $98 on Marriott's web-site. Fairfield Inn isn't the brand for me on the road but in Manhattan it's a great value and surprisingly good quality.There is a free breakfast every morning that was pretty good, Tazo tea, even honey for my tea, plus scrambled eggs, sausage, fruit, milk. If you're there with a family it's an even better deal.The building itself is small but tall. I walked right past it the first time. The hallways are narrow but the rooms are a good size for NYC. Free internet, Paul Mitchell amenities in the bathroom.I flew into LGA and had no problem taking the bus to the Subway and then coming in just a few blocks from the hotel. Much cheaper than a cab, adding to my savings on this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I stayed for a week and we must say that this hotel was a pleasant surprise. It has no restaurants as we know it for hotels, but the breakfast area with hot scrambled eggs and breakfast sausages added to their continental array and this was more than sufficient. Although we arrived very early due to our transcontinental flight, we were able to check in around 3-4 which was really the check in time. They were very accommodating to keep our kuggages in storage while we went around the city.Rooms are small but I suggest going for the Executive room or even the Suite as these are more comfortable and roomier. Thanks to Front Desk Receptionists Theresa and Britney , we were able to transfer to the Suite and Executive rooms during our stay. They made our week's stay really pleasant. Thank you ladies!Restaurants and shops are all over and easy walking around the Flatiron District. The plants and flowers for sale bursting on to the sidewalks around the neighborhood gave this area a wonderful feel.We like this hotel and we are coming back next week again for the weekend before we fly home.Thank you Marriott Fairfield for a great week!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We booked this hotel last minute because it was the closest, cheapest hotel to a friend we were visiting. Bottom line: 3 people stayed for one night, ate a fantastic breakfast and valet parked the car all day and the total bill was just under $200. Bonus was that everything was GREAT - the front desk staff were friendly and efficient both at the late-night check in and the next day, the breakfast was well-stocked, super clean, with plenty of room for everyone to sit in a cute area, the breakfast hours were good for both business and leisure travelers on a weekday (6 - 10 AM), The room was small but clean and comfortable. The location was really convenient - walking distance to the subway and lots of places to eat. Free wifi! The ambiance was not the strong suit - the street is not lovely, the views were not good, but did I mention it was less than $200 to sleep and eat and park the car?! The trade-off was so worth it!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Came to NYC for my birthday . Stayed fri a long weekend and had a very nice stay at This hotel. Room was a bit small but we managed as we only came in the evening to sleep. Room is clean and every thing is new.The location is great subway is 200 m from the hotel. It's near 34st and in a walking distance from union square. Complimentary Breakfast is a great bonus !2 things disturbed us : 1. No wifi for a couple of days .2. On our second night someone opened our door room at 10pm while we were sleeping without knocking . We asked the front desk for some answers-until today non... ( one week already from our return)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were in the city for a long weekend in February and were pleasantly surprised by the low rate (weekend) at the Fairfield. The hotel was clean, front desk staff great, breakfast was sufficient. Did not use the gym but took a peek and it too looked sufficient. The Fairfield will validate parking in a covered garage steps away from the front door for 30.00 a day. Well worth it! Keep in mind these were weekend prices and costs jump significantly during the week. We're going back to the city mid May and unfortunately prices have doubled so we will be staying in Stamford Connecticut. I wish this wasn't the case because we enjoyed our stay at the Fairfield.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Fantastic hotel! A great location, within a walking distance to all main attractions and surrounded by many cool restaurants. Subway station only 2 mins away. The room was very clean and modern, we got upgraded to a city view room and I would highly recommend it as the hotel overlooks the Empire State building. The breakfast was very adequate, with a selection of cereal, bagels, cakes and eggs & sausages, not very busy and the food never ran out. Coffee and tea available throughout the day which was very handy in winter. The room was cleaned daily. The staff were very nice and helpful. We will definitely be staying there again and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting New York. Stayed for 6 days in February as a couple.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was a low cost choice in the midst of NYC Winter. It's a little bit of an adventurous street which seems to be converting to the minimum service hotels of every chain. Check in was a little bit of an adventure with one agent being on the phone and having to help me at the same time.Rooms are minute. (Not like 60 seconds, but like insanely tiny). it's probably the smallest hotel room I've ever been in, including anything in the classic London hotels. BUT....it is immaculate. The rooms was in top notch condition. Everything worked, there are ample plugs, free and functional wifi, the usual HDTV and a really decent shower.This is not a luxury place by any means but it is a bargain for the neighborhood and actually kinda cute.
user_name:
Marc R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Normally, I wouldn't considering giving 4 stars to a hotel where my room was so small, but I'll do so here because of the overall package. Obviously, it's a Fairfield Inn and not a high-end Marriott, but the location in the northern part of Chelsea met my needs: a long walk to NYU (or take the nearby N train) but close proximity to the Empire State Bldg., Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and the ultimate Macy's -- all lots of fun to walk to at night (not a great nearby restaurant scene, however). Best was the dollar value: on a Sunday night, I spent less than $100, including taxes, which is an extraordinary bargain in NYC. Also important was the staff and basic amenities: terrific, super-friendly young woman at the desk, a free modest breakfast where everything was done right and seating was comfortable, a discount on nearby overnight parking ($35 a good price in NYC!), and good wi-fi, tv, excellent bed, and endless hot water in the shower. So, while the room was much smaller than I'm accustomed to in a Fairfield Inn or other Marriott, the overall value was worth the compromise. I'll stay here again (with a Hilton Garden Inn and new Hotel Indigo going up across the street, the prices will hopefully stay competitive).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel has a very good location. It is small but friendly thru good service and kindness of its personnel mainly the front desk people. The rooms are very clean and no noise was perceived in the room located at 12th floor.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Visited NYC with my brother and friend...had a long time deciding where to stay but was glad we settled in this cute hotel tucked in a small street. It was quite street and felt safe even with the unique characters around :-) Tons of restaurants around and cheap too....Rooms are on the small side but well planned...bathroom is adequate in size. Two fast elevator...VERY important in a mid/high rise hotel. Breakfast is sufficient to start the day...and the staff were very friendly a +++. Walkable to most places...well you can...take the metro or taxi for further places to see. Overall. ..I'll stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel was very modern and in a great location. Breakfast buffet options were not exciting but the food was good. The hotel staff are what make this a great hotel. All were very friendly and welcoming. I had some problem with a airport transfer and Ms Phoenix (on reception) was more than happy to help as much as she could. The only bad thing i can say about the room was that the bathroom was very cold and the heating would sometimes malfunction. The view from the roof terrace is amazing.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I lived in Chelsea for 25 years and so I bring my long-standing knowledge of Manhattan with me when I visit New York City now. From that perspective, the Fairfield Inn is outstanding. Sure, the rooms are small, but this is Manhattan! And anywhere else but NYC, you'd probably expect more for $300+ a night. However, the hotel is new, modern and very well-maintained. Our room was cleaned each morning while we were having breakfast downstairs. That's pretty unique. Again, as a former Manhattanite, I can attest to how quiet the rooms are, if you forgo the view (not much to speak of unless you're on a high floor) and take a room at the back of the hotel. You'll face other buildings and there is no natural light, but you won't have street noise. From the moment we arrived, the front desk folks were helpful and professional. They worked to find us a room to our liking. They greeted us every time we came and went. And they always asked if they could do anything for us. Even the staff in the breakfast room were helpful. One morning I wasn't feeling well and the staff helped my husband select and package some food to bring to the room. They are also very vigilant in terms of keeping all of the breakfast items restocked.The location is superb. You can walk to Times Square, Chelsea, the West Village, and you are in the middle of NoMad, a new hotel and restaurant district. There is a subway on either side of the hotel--one line on 6th Ave and another on 7th. And the Broadway and Lexington Ave lines are only a few blocks away. This is not a luxury hotel so don't expect plush towels and high-end toiletries. But if you want a great location and great service at a reasonable price, this is the place to stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights in mid January 2015. This hotel was great. We were surprised to find parking across the street and did not have to pay the muni-meter (check on weekdays tho). Very convenient access to shopping and trains. It is located in the Flower District, which was refreshing. The room is nicely furnished, comfortable bed but small room. Small is not a bad thing because they did it right with the shelves, desk, armoire, and bathroom layout. We only enjoyed a little breakfast (our own choice of brunch places), and it was nicely done. The breakfast area is nice, spacious, and updated. We are looking to come back in the next few months. Hotel staff helpful and nice. If you want a fun bar to visit, try Trailer Park NYC on W23rd (convenient to hotel)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 8 nights in early January, in an executive king room on the 16th floor. This was slightly larger room than the standard room, and we were pleasantly surprised by the size. The bed was very comfortable, the shower large and clean. We had a terrific view of the Empire State Building, which was definitely appreciated. As with some other reviews, we also only had one set of towels on arrival, but a call to the front desk and this was fixed within 10 minutes. Breakfast was more than adequate, but did get a bit boring after a week. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the short walk to 2 subway lines makes this an excellent location for getting around New York. On a very positive note, this was a quiet location, and we never had any trouble sleeping. Only one critical comment, most of the towels are getting to the end of their useful life and need to be replaced. Overall, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were unfortunate to encounter the same front desk girl as our previous stay .She is extremely rude and never looks to resolve issues that arise -Several guests had problems with her.I will not go into the Issues we had as a third party are involved but remember there are thousands of hotels in New York therefore customer service should be paramount .On a completely different not I don't think it is ever appropriate for a breakfast server to have her hair in curlers whilst in the dining room.Will never stay here again

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Enjoyed a few days over Christmas. The staff were welcoming and nice, the room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom modern and clean although only one bath towel supplied and had to request another on arrival. Bed/pillows comfortable and air-conditioning was ok and the window could be opened a little for some fresh air. The size of the room was on the smaller side but all good as it is NY and spent the days and evenings out and about. Had a great view of the Empire State Building when it wasn't cloudy.Breakfast was slightly more than a continental breaky with a small but adequate selection of cereals, fruit, yoghurt and eggs and bread and pastries but it was a quicker than the dead exercise and noticed some people with big bags and coats with big pockets, making sure they survive any future famine! The hotel ticked the right boxes for location, close proximity to a supermarket and bottle shop, restaurants, cafes and takeaway shops and shopping and central enough for a good base for plenty of walking to Times Square, Theatre District etc and not far from Penn station for ongoing travel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Honestly I haven't been to NYC for almost 20 years, we were going after Christmas to new years. This was booked through hotels.com,we almost always stay at Marriott brands and this was less expensive than those in times square. It is close to the subway station, maybe a 5 minute walk, that made it nice to get where we wanted quickly. Lots of little places to eat all around. The hotel did offer fresh cookies each night. The rooms were clean, but TINY, I was hoping for a great view of empire state building, but instead we got a level 4 room that faced another building and every evening we had to close the blinds because it was a yoga studio we could see them, and they could see us. This hotel does have a roof top you can go & see great views of empire state building. I did have a couple complaints, the first day at check in we get to the room, it had only one bath towel & 2 hand towels, I called down and asked for another towel , one for each of us & wash cloths, with in a few minutes they did bring us another towel and hand towel- not wash cloth but it was late, so we made do. The following day of our stay we came back to the hotel & our room had not been cleaned, we got in and there was a do not disturb tag on our door, I understand why it was not cleaned but I didn't place it there, not sure if it was in the hall on floor or what - but again I called front desk, and at least asked for fresh towels, 30 minutes later we still did not have the towels, I called again, they came within a few minutes. They offered breakfast, all the normal things, starbucks coffee, tea, hot chocolate, eggs, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, bagels, toast & muffins, yogart, boiled eggs. The breakfast area got really busy in the mornings and one morning there was no seating, When we ate at 8 am or earlier it was busy but still seating, the last day it was almost 9, a lot of food was gone, but they were working on getting it replaced, but so many people would line up & take everything just placed out- I definitely recommend going earlier for better selection & enjoyment! They held our luggage while we toured city on last day since check out was a t noon and our flight was at 8:30 p,m, Overall we enjoyed our stay. My biggest complaint was I didn't realize when booking through hotel.com we would not accrue our Marriott reward points, once I booked my delta tickets I was transferred over & booked directly through them, This was upsetting because of our week long stay I missed out on over 12,000 points, had I known this locations rules on that I would have called them directly. Also my preference of feather free room that is set up in my Marriott profile didn't go over, so I did ask on 2nd day to have linens changed because I am allergic to feathers and by day 2 my eyes were so swollen.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My team and I work in NYC every week and have been since October 1, 2014. This Hotel is near the office (within 8 blocks) and is very clean, very well maintained, and a great place to stay. The folks at the front desk, are fantastic. Kawanna, Brittany, Bethany, Leo, Keisha, and (the overnight lady that I can never remember her name) - Are all just fantastic. They make us feel like this is our home away from home. When we have had issues, and let's face it when you stay in a Hotel every week, you are going to have issues, they have been addressed immediately and the team makes us feel like valued "friends". I want to also add that the Owners of the property have personally reached out to us to make sure we are being taken care of, and when do you hear of things like that happening today. Great place to stay in a great spot in the City. Walking distance to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and a quick Subway ride everywhere else.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location of the hotel is fantastic. Few steps from the subway and very near to Empire State Building and many other "must visit" sites,such as Flatiron building.We had a room with the view and it was great to wake up and see Empire State Building from our king size bed. Unfortunately the room was too small for bed this big, with tiny place for wardrobe, with noisy and smelly air-conditioner (filters to be changed). The room was full of dust which was easy to see on dark furniture (never cleaned in 5 days).Regarding the breakfast it was poor and identical every day..even one who loves muffins will start to hate them after eating them 5 days in the row.The stuff was polite but not kind and helpfull.Next time we'll search for other place to stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel in Chelsea; rooms are reasonably sized, clean and well maintained. Hotel Staff is terrific. I have a team of people that are staying here and we have been impressed with the value for the price compared to a lot of other properties in Manhattan. Free breakfast, which is the typical standard breakfast that Fairfield provides.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel actually made our trip to NYC a success. It all started with Leo at the front desk, extremely helpful, all the employees we encountered were above and beyond, especially Leo. Very accommodating, as we were traveling with a 5 yr old and 9 month old twins. The other front desk, maids, maintenance, and food service employees were all extremely friendly, helpful and outgoing. With the service I could've sworn I was at a Ritz. The location is very good, not great, but very good, subway stations are close by, or cab fares to major landmarks are very reasonable, or you can get some exercise and walk to Times Square, Rockfeller, Grand Central, Penn Station, etc. Nice quiet (for NYC) street, nice rooftop to relax and look at Empire State Building. Street is unofficial flower district, so it was pleasant seeing some greenery every morning/afternoon. Parking isn't cheap, but thats NY, also valet can take awhile, so would recommend self parking. Decent food options in the area, not great but decent.Breakfast did the job, typical Fairfield, Residence Inn fare, carry you a few hours. My family found our new hotel when staying in Manhattan. Let me know of any questions. All the front desk was great, I spent time watching while we waited for our room, we arrived at 12 noon, but Leo was fantastic.
user_name:
PeteG789
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a weekend trip and didn't want to pay $350+ which is standard for New York hotels during Christmas shopping season. Hotel looks new. It's on a drab street but the N and R subway lines are only a block away. Decent breakfast included in the rate which is a plus. Rooms are small but OK for a short trip. Penn Station is 5 blocks from hotel. Overall, a good value for New York.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel. We were a group of 4 ladies and shared a room with 2 double beds. On our arrival, we were told we were given a slightly larger room but they were unable to give us a platinum member upgrade. I was fine with this, knowing upgrades are not always available. As soon as we opened the door, we were in disbelief of how small the room was. This was very disappointing, but we agreed that we weren't there to spend time in the room- we were there to explore Manhattan. The hotel itself was nothing fancy. There was a nice breakfast area behind the lobby and they had your typical continental breakfast foods.  The location, however, is a great location. We were able to walk just about anywhere. We did choose to take the subway to 911 memorial and sometimes to times square, if we were tired of walking. The Red line is just 1/2 block away, which made it very convenient.The hotel is clean, and updated and if you just have 2 people in a room it would be fine.They need to improve the lighting in the room and we also were never given the right amount of towels.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: One night stay in the heart of the Flower Market - interesting to see what they are selling at any given hour, often on the sidewalk. Great view from room of Empire State Building all lit up, and bigger than typical for a New York City Fairfield. Nice flat screen TV and good shower although hot water was tough to come by in the morning. One request would be either a bench to rest small suitcase on or chest of drawers so can unpack clothes. Typical Fairfield breakfast - free and no-frills. A bit on the expensive side for a Fairfield, but overall a very good stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Good value hotel near macys and maddison square garden. Staff were fabulous and helpful. Plenty of choice for breakfast. Tge roof garden has amazing views as good as a lot if the expensive rooftop bars. Could do with slightly brighter lighting in the bedroom and a bit better space to put clothes away, but it suited us fine and i would stay here again. Near penn station to get to and from Newark.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I can only address the issues we faced in our room and cannot comment about another experience. I found the room we were given very small. It was difficult to maintain a proper warmth in the room. At times we were left with only one bath towel for two people. I tried to take a bath, but the plug leaked and I was forced to refill the tub three times...and the water came out brown for the first tub full. To be fair, because we changed out times and added two more days, we were moved to a new room which was larger and more comfortable. But it had a shower and no bath. Not my day.The desk service was very helpful and when we called for additional towels, they were delivered in minutes!
user_location: Rainbow Lake, New York, United States
user_name:
patricke233
Rainbow Lake, New York, United States

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 3 weekend nights in fall, 2014. Great accommodations and lodging experience in the true center of Manhattan. Great location and central to all our favorite haunts. Situated between two major subway lines traveling the spine of Manhattan -- one block or less from the 1-2-3 lines on the west and the N-Q-R lines on the east -- 10 minutes or less via subway to Midtown and Times Square uptown and SoHo/Canal Street/Lower Manhattan downtown. Situated in the middle of the block on a street full of florists and flower supply shops -- this portion of W. 28th Street should be named "Flower Street". The rooms are surprisingly modern and spacious for NYC, and had all the amenities we needed. Roomy desk and closets, large flat-screen TV, spacious bathroom and sink area. A bit tight on deep enough space to lay out two open suitcases, though. Room thermostat and ventilation was more than adequate. Free wireless internet service in our room and public areas was also satisfactory and easy to use. Great view of the Empire State Building from our room, especially at night -- it looked so close I had to ask the front desk clerk for confirmation just to make sure -- making it slightly reminiscent of scenes from "Sleepless in Seattle". Complimentary breakfast in the morning was organized and very satisfactory. Eggs and breakfast sausage, along with breads, rolls, cereals, juice and coffee was standard fare. Surprisingly situated greenhouse dining area in the rear of the property made breakfast a very pleasant experience. If that wasn't enough, there are Starbucks and McDonalds right down the block in either direction. This neighborhood is a shopper's paradise. Macy's flagship store is less than 6 blocks walk uptown on 34th St and Broadway or you can take a train. On Saturday, there is a long 9-block outdoor marketplace and farmer's market all along Broadway from 23rd St. to 14 St. (the street is closed to traffic). Continue down Broadway to Canal St. to explore this great SoHo shopping district. Also close by to the hotel are Madison Square Garden and Penn Station just a few blocks walk from the hotel to the west. The hotel staff and daytime manager were extremely courteous and helpful during the extent of our weekend stay, beginning with the complimentary chocolate chip cookies when check in. The service (including Housekeeping) was excellent -- they accommodated our every request. On the last day (check-out), they offered complimentary bag service in their locked storage area until our scheduled airport shuttle arrived. All in all, we had nothing but extremely positive experiences at this hotel. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, and definitely plan to. Highly recommended !!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for one night on business. Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and decent size for NYC. Complimentary breakfast was above average. Ask for a room with a view of the Empire State Building if available.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had a very pleasant experience due to the front desk staff, Keisha, Kawanna, Brittany, Theresa, and Leo. They were very friendly and very attentive to my needs. They made sure I was comfortable in my room and helped me greatly when I needed to adjust my reservation. The valet service leaves a lot to be desired, not because of the facility but because of the service providers themselves, they were not very good at bringing around the vehicles in the time they should. Twice I had to wait more than an hour to obtain my vehicle from them. I felt as if the room was bigger than I would have thought and I think it's because there is not a wall between the hallway from the door to the bed and the bathroom as there are with quite a few hotels in Manhattan. The room was very comfortable. I believe if you have a room to the northeast you will have of the city and the Empire State Building but you can ask the front desk as they were very kind to offer a room with a view, it will cost a bit more naturally but the view is really nice from a high floor. If you're not familiar with Manhattan, this is the Chelsea area and the streets are pretty busy 24/7 so be prepared to give yourself time to get to from the hotel if you are driving or catching a cab. 6th Ave is not even a 1/4 of a block from the hotel so you can walk to pretty much everything you need without a long hike.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very good location near Penn Station ,Madison Square Garden, Midtown Manhattan.Fairfield Inn & Suites is completely remodeled lobby,entrance Breakfast lounge and rooftop.Room was neat ,clean,and usual commodities good service.Front Desk personnel very courteous,respectfull.Not expensive Recommend Stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice FI near a lot - Eataly/Madison Square Park/Garden, High Line, Herald Square/Macy's etc. We checked in early on a Friday morning and left our bags and car. When we returned after 3 pm, our room was ready for us. We were told we were upgraded to a room with a view. It was on the 10th floor facing north. No real view, but it was nice to be on the 10th floor. Not very noisy area (this the Flower district), but there are always cars honking. The room is small (no seating other than the bed) and the bathroom is very small (need to slip in to be able to close the door), but a comfortable bed and good shower makes up for a lot! The breakfast is typical FI, but staff keeps the coffee and food well topped off and there is plenty of room for seating. Oh, and the elevators are fast!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was clean. The mattress is on it's last legs, and needs to replaced. The reason for the poor review though is it's clear someone went through my bags the day before I left. Nothing was taken, but it was clearly rummaged through. Otherwise the front desk staff was incredibly nice and the location is convenient. Everyone at the hotel was really nice actually.I would probably look at staying here again for another work trip, some time things just happen that's not a reflection of the people that run the place.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I and our two teenage sons stayed in this hotel for a week when we cam to NYC for the marathon. Marathon week is a busy week in NYC and prices can be high. Yhe hotel is well situated in midtown conveniently located between two subway wtations and not far from Penn station. Although we took a cab to the hotel when we arrived we caught the train back to the airport from Penn station. This is a cheaper option and quicker during the rush hour. The room was clean with everything we needed. Considering the location the size and price of the room were good value for money. We got a deal for an extended stay. Breakfast was simple but copious and we had no complaints at all. Breakfast staff were friendly and helpful and the front desk staff were great. I would strongly recommend this hotel for families looking for a comfortable well situated hotel at a reasonble price.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at this property for the NYC marathon, as it was one of the more affordable options for this very pricey weekend in NYC.The street is lined with flower shops which creates a nice atmosphere. Subway stations are 2min walking distance, so getting around was no problem.the room was perfectly adequate (Had a great view of the empire state building) - clean, comfortable bed, the bathroom was on the smaller side but clean and fairly modern. Breakfast is somewhat basic, but definitely OK for a free hotel breakfast (Cereal, different breads and pastries, two warm dishes, yogurts, fruits...)The front desk people were amazing, extremely friendly and helpful!Next time im in the city, I will stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Trained in from Boston for meetings in Jersey City and a gala at The Pierre up on 61st. Fairfield Chelsea was perfectly located to Penn Station and the PATH on 33rd, which made it so easy to get around. On a relative basis, 28th Street is pretty quiet. Front desk staff was great...thanks for a great room with a view of The Empire State Building. The few machines in the exercise room (appropriately named) allowed for a good morning work out. A clean comfortable room made my stay a perfect 10.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a very basic property in Chelsea. My room was clean albeit with a very small bathroom. The staff were friendly and always said hello and asked how you were doing. The breakfast (which was free) was basic but adequate. They had some computer issues and the printer did not work, but the staff offered to print things in their office. And the rates were significantly lower than in Midtown or Uptown. This street is filled with flower shops and it was fun to see the folks putting their plants out on the sidewalk in the morning and then taking them back inside at night. The neighborhood restaurant scene is not as vibrant as in other parts of town, though. All in all, the hotel served its purpose and I would stay there again if I ever had business in this part of town.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Half my Manhattan stays are in this hotel. It's not the easiest to reach from LGA in late afternoon traffic, but just over 30 minutes isn't bad. The staff is always friendly. The rooms are updated, clean and comfortable, though small-ish like all Manhattan hotels. Breakfast isn't gourmet, but is always good, especially for a Fairfield. Higher floor rooms have a little view, but nothing magnificent. A solid hotel on 28th about a 10-minute walk from Madison Sq Garden.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I am Marriott Platinum Elite, and a regular at this hotel (Fairfield, Chelsea) for pleasure. Previous visits have always been excellent. This one was seriously marred by our first use of the valet parking. I called down to the desk at about 10:30am for our car to be brought round. We went downstairs shortly thereafter. There was a lot of construction on the street, so we asked the desk for guidance on where we would be met. Mr. Lopez(?) wasn't very helpful, but we figured on a one way street we'd work it out. And so we waited. After half an hour we checked with the desk and were told "your car is on the way" by Mr. Lopez. Another half an hour later we checked again (remember, we are standing on the street all this time with suit bags, suitcases and laptop bags since the front was blocked with construction vehicles). This time Mr' Lopez called the lot to check, "Car is on the way". Another half an hour passed. Finally. nearly 2 hours after we'd called for our car, it pulled up on the street and we had to get into it right on the street (no parking left after this two hour wait). We asked the valet where the lot was... on 25th Street... THREE BLOCKS AWAY. We could have walked that distance in 5 minutes. Though it really wasn't the valet's fault, we were quite frustrated, so no tip. The desk clerk (Lopez) was less than helpful, and certainly not apologetic for our interminable wait. After many great stays at this hotel, we are seriously considering never staying there again. We at least have learned the lesson to never, ever use the valet parking service there again. We'll handle it ourselves, much more efficiently. Was the valet lot called in the first place? I doubt it.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights checked in at 1.30 no problem upgraded to the top floor and an executive room very clean with a great view of the Empire State Building . My only complaint would be the noise from the elevators our room 1804 was opposite the doors so was annoying at times . The hotels location is great for the subway lines a 2 minute walk away .breakfast was very good as well always well stocked and area clean all in all a very good stay for us hopefully be back here again in March

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a difficult time finding a room for a reasonable rate for our 3 night October visit. The price we found for this Fairfield Inn was the best rate for a centrally located hòtel. We were pleased we found it. The hotel is located amongst florist shops, and we walked right by it at first. There are tons of shops, cafes, and restaurants nearby. I love Argo for tea, and it's right around the corner. It's close enough to the theatre district to be an easy walk, but far enough away to avoid the crowds. The rooms are clean. Beds are super comfortable. We didn't have much of a view, but we couldn't complain because our room was so quiet at night. My only complaints were the noisy AC and the very poor free wifi service. The staff was friendly, but not as helpful as the staff at our usual NYC hotel. Breakfast was included with the room and included cold cereal, bagels, toast, yogurt, fruit, scrambled egg and pork sausage. How nice it would be if they offered turkey or chcken sausage instead of pork! Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and this may be our second choice hòtel from now on when we go to NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at this location for business purposes. This property is new..only 3 years opened. The location is 3/4 block to the 28th street subway station. So, transportation is easy. A real "plus" for business travelers. About 1/2 hour to uptown or Brooklyn by train, during rush hour. So, good location. The subway is "red" 1,2 trains.The neighborhood is safe to walk. There is a Starbucks 3/4 block on 28th street. There is a nice market called Fairway 2 blocks on Ave of the Americas. This market is opened until 11pm. It is a great market.The rate are less expensive than Times Square area or even Brooklyn. The only downside, the room are small. But it is New York..all rooms are small. Space is a premium.The staff is VERY COURTEOUS and helpful.Overall I highly recommend, for business and recreational travelers.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very central for both upper and lower Manhattan attractions. Easy to walk to all locations and loads of restaurants. First impression of room was it was smaller than expected, however there was in fact sufficient space for all clothing (we were on a 3 week touring holiday) and to store the suitcases. Bed was large and comfortable, bathroom compact but clean and had a good shower. Great breakfast area and lots of choices. Would definitely recommend for a short stay in New York and would go back for the convenience of location. Staff were pleasant and helpful and hotel was clean and tidy.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We normally stay over near Times Square but since our son moved to New York we stayed at this hotel since it was a few blocks from him. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When we first arrived I was not very pleased but we had been traveling for two weeks and stayed in hotels that were nicer and bigger but this was a good buy for the price. Rooms were small and we were right by the elevator but that did not end up a problem since the hotel was small. Continental breakfast was pretty good. We did valet Parkin Bruce would not do that next time. We assumed we. Luke get the car when needed but that was not the case. Fortunately we did not need it but next time would park it ourselves since here were several parking lots near by and would have been a little cheaper. Wish the rooms were bigger but was clean and we would stay there again. By New York standards it was good.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location is very good. Close from the Empire State Building and walking distance to many nice areas. However, poor service… my room was not cleaned the second day with no clear explanation, and the reception service was inconsistent. Rooms OK - a bit dated. Fire alarm twice at 11PM with evacuation of the building with no explanation or apologies for the inconvenience.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My friend and I stayed here 9/7-9/11 and were very impressed with what the hotel had to offer. It was my fourth time in NYC and keeping in mind that most hotels in the city can be cramped, our room was perfect for the two of us, unlike hotels I've stayed in in the financial district and midtown. It was nice to have a king sized bed and a large shower. There is so much to do and see around the hotel, with many historic buildings within walking distance and two main subways within the block! We ate sushi at Kobeaki on 7th ave and around 26th street, a gyro from the street cart and one night we walked over to the flat iron building and ate at Madison Square Eats and Eataly. BRING GOOD WALKING SHOES!!!The breakfast was standard, but still very filling, and the view from the penthouse (which they say isn't advertised, but you can go up there) is amazing. I do wish they had a fridge in the room, but it wouldn't impact my decision to stay here again. I just loved being greeted by the staff every time we entered! It's true what you read, the hotel is VERY clean, and even though our view was of the back alley, it was still a nice view of the old buildings, and I found it mostly quiet. 28th street was busy during the day, but very quiet at night. Not scary, but always be careful into the late night in the city. One thing to be cautious about is airport access. It's completely doable, but be sure to give yourself ample time. We flew in from Newark and took the air-train to Penn Station for $12.50 and walked the 4 blocks to the hotel, which worked great, but on the way back we didn't want to chance having to wait for a train back to the airport so we got a car service for around $100. But we did feel less stressed and also didn't have to lug our bags around as much. If we would have timed it better, we would have taken the train back to the airport for cheaper!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: After looking at an exhaustive list of hotels for my business trip, I chose this one and was very happy I did. The front desk staff were very friendly, the location was great, and the room was exactly was I was after. Quiet, clean, traditional, comfy bed, good TV, large shower. Some reviewers have said the rooms are small, which was a little concerning to me. However, I thought the room was sized just right. My only two concerns (not really complaints) were there wasn't a fridge in the room and the free breakfast was pretty weak. I've stayed at a Fairfield before though, so I knew about the breakfast. McDonald's is just around the corner and I found a few diners within a few blocks.I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in Chelsea from friday 15 aug. to wednesday 20 aug, 2014. Moving our daugther to a nearby campus, this Fairfield in Chelsea was ideally situated for us, between 6th & 7th avenue. In that area on 28th street, there are many wholesale florists, so the street is filled with all kinds of plants during the day. Nice ! Towards the South, you are about 10 minutes walking distance to the Flatiron Building (23rd & 5th) and towards the North, about the same distance towards Madison Square Garden and Macy's (34th and 6th). A 20 minute walk towards the south will lead you towards Greenwich Village. The room is small but comfortable and clean. The included breakfast is generous and offers all the main morning staples. This is a great (and rare) feature for NYC. The gym is small but did the job for me. The Wi-Fi worked well (total of 3 devices). For Parking (if needed), go the the one situated on 28th street just below 6th avenue (south side) and make sure to get the coupon stamped by the hotel for a 30$ a day fee. Enjoyed that hotel and would go back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed for business for five nights. Although they did not a knowledge I was a marriott rewards member, it was noted on reservation and my room was on rewards high floor. The room was small but was everything I needed. The bed was comfortable, nice size shower and bathroom. The room and floor was quiet and the room was always extremely clean. There is a breakfast room with the basics and computers available. The hotel is fairly new and hidden on a street of wholesale flower stores. EasIly accessible to taxi and subway transportation. The staff is courteous but not very knowledgeable on places to eat other then sports restaurants.i suggest Eataly as itis an easy walk and fun place to.visit and eat.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was amazing. My friend and I had narrowed down a list of about 10 hotels and this one fit all our categories - close to Penn Station, Free breakfast and the cheapest one from our list. We were not disappointed. We stayed there the first weekend of June 2014. We were always greeted by the staff on duty and they were always more than willing to help us. The room was excellent that had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. It was the perfect location for us being walking distance from Penn Station and between both 28th St subway stations. I have recommended this hotel to everyone and will definitely return if I find myself in New York again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is our go to hotel. It is wonderfully located, most of the time reasonably priced, comfortable, clean, clean clean. The staff is simply wonderful. This is out 4th trip to this hotel and it is never a disappointment. The only complaint is the drastic jump in rates mid week, but this is across the city. I love walking out to the garden centers lining the sidewalk with plants. It is just a great feeling all around. The continental breakfast is just so so, nothing to really mention.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: we stayed with our kids for 4 nights. Always happy with the service and the cleanness of the room and he lobby. Breakfast is acceptable with start bucks coffee, fruits, cereal, milk, egg and yogurt. aOn your way out you can also can ask for bottles of water for free. Very secure area, Mc Donald less than block away and also a pizza place. Empire State Building and Macys Store is walking distance. Subway estation very close. We were very happy with our stay>

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located and affordable right in the flower district of NYC. It is literally steps from a red line 123 metro station and also very handy to 34 Street Penn and Herald Square. The view from the front door is of the Empire State Building, and the street is lined with flower wholesalers so there are gorgeous displays out on the street each morning. Plenty of restaurants close by. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and a reasonable size for NY with a small amount of storage space. There is no in room fridge, but there is freely available ice from the machine downstairs. The elevators are quick with very little waiting and the shower in our bathroom was great. There are three things I could fault, but that didn't affect the overall experience of the hotel - the towels were quite small and thin; the breakfast is pretty average and offered using disposable everything (not great for the hotel's carbon footprint); the air conditioning was set very low so we were turning it on and off a lot as we got too cold. I would highly recommend this hotel for value and convenience.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I been there for business on june . such a great location with absolutely committed stuff. Such great guys working there gave us tons of advices. I want to mention Daniel for his commitment to help the guests. For conclusion great location great stuff. Will come back there

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First of all the standard rooms are very very tiny BUT once you overcome the shock of tiny room you will enjoy the hotel! Very clean. Wonderful free breakfast. Very nice Very Friendly outstanding front desk employees! Free wireless internet and not slow! A tiny hotel which makes you feel your getting more personal service. We definitely will stay again but next time get an executive room which are suppose to be larger. A+++++++++++++++

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend before heading off to business meetings on Long Island. Great location, walking distance to some great restaurants in Chelsea and The Village. Staff was friendly and helpful.It's on an interesting street filled with plant and flower vendors. It was fun to watch the locals shopping and the deals being made. Great people watching.The big bonus came as a complete surprise. We had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. We really enjoyed seeing it lit up at night. Especially when it was done in red, white and blue for Flag Day.Room was a comfortable size for NYC. The bathroom was tight with just enough room to open the shower door. My only gripe was the breakfast. Nothing wrong with it except there was no variety what so ever. The exact same thing every day. Just a little change up would be most welcome!On the plus side, the breakfast room is a nice little sun room on the back of the building. That was a nice surprise and definitely improved the breakfast experience.Will definitely stay here again if the price is right. I've seen rates from $139/nt to $900/nt on the Marriott site. It's a steal at $139 but you've gotta be kidding me at $900.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room was small, but sufficient. They had to put us in a handicap accessible room or we could wait (because we arrived earlier than check in, so we decided it would be ok) I would probably not do the accessible room next time because the bathroom was just a bit messy with showers. Also the shower didn't have a great supply of hot water or great water pressure, but overall we would stay again. The bed was comfy and the free breakfast was really nice. Also, the discounted parking was a great plus (25 per day instead of 75 per day without the hotel discount)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I arrived at the hotel one months ahead of my booking dates (sort my mistake in month) and with my amazement the reception staff were very accommodating to find me a room even with better price deal. Room was assigned for disabled person but it was ok beside the bathroom floor keep water stagnant. Breakfast was simple, same item each day but ok for light breakfast. Good thing is that hotel is centrally located and very easy to get around anywhere from the hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
