The hotel is located between 6th and 7th Avenues, which is the Flower District. There are numerous nice flower shops located within a few feet of the hotel. The location of the hotel is ideal for 2 reasons. First, it is within easy walking distance of several key New York attractions, including High Line Park and Chelsea Market. Second, the hotel is removed from the more congested areas of New York. My wife and I arrived shortly before 1 PM, and there was a room ready on the third floor. Our checkin went very smoothly. Our room was very clean and comfortable, although small in size. The bed and pillows were also very comfortable. Furthermore, our hotel was very quiet, and we could not hear any outside noise. A free breakfast buffet was included, and there was an outside patio for eating.Our checkout also went smoothly, and we were allowed to check our luggage while we conducted our sightseeing for the day. In summary, my wife and I were very satisfied with our stay, and we strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City.
user_name:
William S
New London, Connecticut, United States

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here one night while visiting New York for a hair convention in Harlem. The hotel is located in a great area, near the subway (1 train) and walking distance from the transportation hub located in Herald Square, including Penn Station and a number of subway trains. The hotel room was small but that is expected for a Manhattan hotel. The room was clean. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I arrived several hours earlier than check-in time and the staff allowed me to store my bags there so that I could explore the city while I waited for my room to be ready. The hotel also offers free wifi (a plus) and a complimentary breakfast (e.g., toast, cereal, eggs, coffee, tea, juice, and yogurt). There are also several restaurants and fastfood places nearby. The staff recommended a pizza place a block away that served some of the best flatbread pizza I have had in the city. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I've spent 10 nights at the Fairfield Inn in June-July 2013. The hotel is quite small: 18 floors with around 5-6 rooms per floor.Rooms were very clean, and my room was quite specious (for a NYC room).The hotel location is great, with subway stops less than a block a way (red lines and yellow lines).I've slept on the 17th floor which was quiet 99% of the time (you can easily hear people waiting for the elevator, and the elevator ping, but not across rooms). The complimentary breakfast is a great start in the morning. It has everything you need, including fresh cut fruits and pastries.The stuff was friendly and helpful throughout my stay (though I didn't have any real issue).Few general comments:-My room was equipped with a 37'' TV with around 30 channels. -I've spent 10 days at the hotel, and my sheets were only replaced after I specifically asked for it (they basically don't replace sheets throughout your stay unless you ask). When asked, they were replaced that day.-There is no refrigerator in the room. There is a single ice machine in the lower Lobby floor- The AC system is EXTREMELY loud and weird. When clicking on off, it takes around 10 minutes for the system to actually stop working. Any change of temperature, also requires a long wait before it actually happens. However, the room was always cool enough for my needs.- The mattress is very soft- Free Wifi across the hotel and rooms Bottom line - a very positive stay and a hotel I will surely get back to.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Every year we make one to two trips to the NYC area, often staying in New Jersey and taking buses or trains to Manhattan, but this time we opted to stay in the city itself.As others have written the street itself is awash with color, as vendors sell plants, trees and flowers of every size and description and perhaps for this reason the traffic on 28th was bad. The parking is very close, just after crossing Sixth Ave and was just $25 with hotel validation.Check in was easy and Bethany who hails from Texas and later Brandi were super friendly and helpful. They allowed us to check in about an hour early at 2pm. Our room on the 8th floor was clean and certainly large enough for the two of us. However it's possibly a little too small to practice the hammer throw or discus!Air conditioning worked a treat and I must single out the bed as perhaps one of the most comfortable we've experienced so far. I hope Fairfield management can point us toward purchasing a similar mattress! We also loved the bathroom and large walk in shower.Public areas were spotless, the rooftop "penthouse" (observatory) was a nice distraction and the breakfast area was spotless, cheerful and well stocked - not bad for a free breakfast. I also loved the small number of rooms per floor, resulting in lots of peace and quiet and the elevator responded quickly on all but one occasion. I could say that a small fridge would have been nice, but it's really difficult and probably a little bit unfair to even consider leveling criticism at this superbly run hotel. We loved the area too and short walks south on Sixth, Seventh and eight Avenues led to a wide array of excellent eateries with the West Village within walkable distance too. I'm glad too that the hotel is south of the touristy mayhem that seems to start at around 33rd Street and move north. It's a reflection of the location of this hotel that we never used the subway or a taxi during our two day stay. We walked everywhere. I really hope we can stay here again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here. The front desk staff were amazing, and our room was well-appointed, albeit small. The bed was SO comfortable! Our room didn't have a view, but that's ok. We were only there to sleep anyway. We liked the free breakfast, and the afternoon cookies were tasty.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 3 days and would definitely recommend it. It had everything you needed for a NYC stay. Good clean room (nothing fancy or not a great view - but this is NYC, so I hadn't expected anything else) and a very friendly staff.Most of all I have to give thumbs up to the location. You are right by 28th and 6th ave and I found it a great location as my base for seeing everything from Brooklyn, Roosevelt Island, Pier 86 (USS Intrepid), Meatpacking District, High Line, West Village, 9/11 Memorial, Alphabet City and Central Park. I wasn't aware of nor expecting the complimentary breakfast, but ate it one morning and it served as a good starter for any long day of sightseeing, without being a huge buffet, but had everything I needed.On top of everything - it had by far the best price I could find through any search-tool on the internet.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My parents and I recently had the pleasure of staying at this Fairfield Inn over Memorial Day weekend. As previous reviewers have noted, the location is great, but what really makes this hotel a standout is the staff. We encountered staff members while checking in, when we came in in the middle of night from sightseeing, and then again at checkout and each time, every person that we encountered was not just courteous in a detached professional way - each person was genuinely friendly, funny, and interested in making our stay pleasant. The front desk staff were helpful in safely storing our baggage after checkout so we could continue sightseeing and responsive to needs like calling cabs, setting wake-up calls, getting the internet password, etc. In one instance, a front desk clerk who helped check us in was still at the desk when we returned from sightseeing around midnight and she revealed that another staff member had called in sick so that she would have to stay until about 7 the next morning. Even though she had every right to be tired and surly under those conditions she was funny and charming. In speaking with the staff, they not only seemed to care about the guests of the hotel, they seemed to care about each other, which evidently makes it a pleasant working environment that they freely share with the guests. Coming from the south, I had braced myself for the unfriendliness that is rumored to exist in New York, but we felt as welcome in the City as we have anywhere else in the world - everyone we met, including the staff of this hotel, was fun and friendly. We had an amazing time. I don't know who does the hiring for this hotel, but whatever they are doing - they are doing it right. As an aside, there is a not-very-good movie called "Premium Rush" about bicycle messengers that I recently saw and some of the action in this movie takes place right at the doorstep of this hotel. So that's kind of cool. The rooms are pretty small, but the bathrooms are spacious. Everything was very clean. Great job!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Booked the hotel after reading the reviews here and we were not disappointed. We stayed only for one night but will definitely be coming back! The rooms are good size, extremely clean and well maintained. The location cannot be beat! it's in the heart of the city close to absolutly everything. FREE WiFi!!! FREE breakast! And the added bonus is to relax on the rooftop patio with the view of the empire state building after a long day. The people at the front desk were the nicest and so accommodating our request. Best value for money in NYC!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: One of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff were very accommodating considering we were travelling with a one year old.The hotel is very clean, lovely comfortable beds, great breakfast and excellent staff. We couldn't have asked for more than that.The hotel is great for walking to most shops. Central to pretty much everything. Having a baby meant it was a hassle getting the metro but the cabs were very accommodating.The hotel wasn't overly cheap, but the cheapest we could find for this quality

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I'm writing this review on behalf of my daughter and I who stayed at this hotel for 3 nights...May 31st to June 3rd 2013. This was a mother-daughter get-a-way planned since Jan. We took a shuttle from Newark Airport, and on arrival were greeted by friendly staff. We stayed in room 207 which does not have a good view, but was nice and quiet, so we didn't mind, and like other people have mentioned, we didn't spend much time in our room anyway. We did go up to the terrace which was fun. The beds were super comfortable. Room was clean. It was great having the breakfast included. We always found lots to eat. Starbucks coffee was great. We did find our air conditioning very cold. It seemed like the temperature couldn't be adjusted, so that in a matter of a few minutes, it went from being warm in the room to freezing! Especially with the room being small. We tried leaving just the fan on, but it didn't make a big difference. It was so nice to see all the flowers on the sidewalk as we stepped out in the morning. Overall, we had a great experience there, and I would have returned except for one thing that happened. My daughter left behind a shopping bag in the wardrobe in our room (never mentioned to me that she had put it in there out of the way). She had gone to one of her favourite stores and bought 2 blouses and had also picked up a souvenir t-shirt and put it in the bag. We did not put anything else in the wardrobe. On arriving home, approx. 12 hrs. later, she realized that she had forgot it. She phoned the hotel the next morning and explained to the staff, described the bag, where she had left it, what was in it, etc. She indicated that she has a friend who lives nearby and could go and pick up the articles left behind. This friend is actually coming to our city next month. After a couple of phone calls, she was told that the bag wasn't found. That's it. No other explanation. She phoned back and left a message with the manager of the hotel, but he did not return her call, and it's been well over a week. There is no doubt in her mind where she left the bag. There must be a policy in place at the hotel for articles left behind, but since my daughter did not hear back, we don't know what that policy is. So unfortunately this has left a bad taste, and we would not stay there again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were greeted politely upon arrival and received the obligatory phone call about 10 minutes after getting to our room to check on us. I recommend you do not stay in Room 503, because it is very cramped in this corner room, and there's no space for luggage. The room was tiny for two adults and had a very narrow bathroom (no counter space, and you could barely close the door once you entered). I would steer guests away from this room, as you can hear every conversation in the hallway, every guest urinating in adjacent rooms, and the elevator dinged seeminly non-stop. There is also a loud, buzzing bathroom light. Although there was music and loud drumming echoing from the alley outside from a nearby nightclub, it did stop before midnight. Try to get another room--otherwise this Fairfield Inn is fine--good location, typical FI breakfast, reasonable rates for Manhattan...

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really struggled finding a place to stay in the city that wasn't a crackerbox and had standard hotel fare at an affordable price. Prices ranged from $109.00 for a room with a bed and common bathroom to $1000.00 for rooms that looked like standard hotel rooms. I decided to go with The Fairfield Inn because it seemed like what I had in mind and offered some things that all hotels should include free of charge, those being a continental breakfast and Wifi. Sorry but free wifi is more important than having a phone or Bible.Nowhere did I see that Wifi was available in all rooms so I took that chance. Wifi is available in all rooms. I told them upon checking out that they need to make sure everyone knows that they offer this and it's a pretty big deal.What was a bigger deal was how nice everyone was at the hotel. I had perhaps the best experience I've ever had in the city and a lot of it was due to The Fairfield Inn. I was taking a class at the Parsons School and had to print out papers for a test, no problem, printing free of charge, as many sheets as necessary. Candy at the counter, cookies on Sunday, everyone extremely happy to help out with great personality as well, it was just a great experience. The room was $249.00 a night. There were additional taxes and fees upon leaving but I knew that would happen and I think that is the case at any hotel in the city. Those totaled about $40.00 per night and seemed if anything, slightly lower than other hotels I was pricing. I was pleasantly suprised to see the breakfast choices available, also included in the price. Bagels, scrambled eggs, sausage, starbucks coffee, yogurt, more than enough choices.The room was a little dusty in the corners but this could be just me. I'm a little wary of bedbugs so I gave the place a good going over and saw nooks and crannies that hadn't seen the light of day for awhile. Overall, the room was clean, a decent size, up to date, elevator time was always short, I've got nothing negative to say about this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I found this hotel in a desperate online search after other accommodations turned out to be a disappointment. I booked this at 11:00 Saturday morning at an excellent price, and hustled over there by 12:30. All of the staff behind the desk hustled to accommodate me, and Joanne in particular helped arrange for me to get checked in quickly. The room is clean, the furnishings are new and, particularly important for NYC when it gets above 90, the air conditioning is excellent. Marriott's higher end brands have been third or so on my preferred list for business travel in the past, and I've tended to favor Hilton Garden Inn or Hampton when paying for my own travel. Service was cheerful, proactive and created an excellent impression of the hotel and of the Fairfield brand. I spent twelve weeks in six trips to NYC on business last year and I've bookmarked this hotel in the browser and will continue to check it for availability. Thanks Joanne and crew for your help! Great experience.
user_name:
Rich W
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of May 2013 while on vacation. It was even better than what I expected. We arrived on Thursday morning (we took the red eye from California) at Newark and took the AirTrain to NJ Transit to Penn Station. Super easy! Then we walked 5 blocks to the hotel and even though our room wasn't ready, they held our luggage and let us use the restroom to freshen up. They even said that we could help ourselves to breakfast even though we weren't checked (it was 9:30am). So nice! We returned around 2pm and we were quickly checked in and given our room keys to room 1002. Our luggage was already put in our room. What a great room! Tenth floor, overlooking the street below, with a fabulous view of the Empire State Building. The room was bigger than expected (one king bed), very clean, had a nice little closet, and the shower was great (no tub, but I'm not a bath person). The bed was a dream! The only downside was hearing the sounds of honking cars throughout the night, but after one night, we quickly got used to it. Plus, we ran the fan and it basically zeroed out the traffic noise. The breakfast was very nice with a wide range of items, including English muffins, toast, muffins, bagels, fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, and juice (orange and cranberry). There was also a coffee station with Starbucks coffee and hot water, with a large assortment of tea and hot chocolate. Yum! On weekdays, breakfast ends at 10am, 11am on weekends.There are also two computers in the breakfast room with printers. What a nice touch! We used the printer three times so we could print tickets for the 9/11 Memorial and Top of the Rock, in addition to our boarding passes And best of all, free Wifi in the room! I find it so crazy that some of the high end hotels out there still charge an arm and a leg for internet access. It's so nice and refreshing when it is included in your stay, free of charge. Did I mention that we got a sweet deal on this room? We booked pretty far in advance, and it was worth it! We checked the price of the room a few days before we left and it had nearly doubled. My husband and I also used the breakfast room one night when we brought our dinner back to the hotel. It was so much nicer than eating in our room. There is a large TV in there and it's very relaxing and no one else was there. For being my first time in NYC, you can't really beat the location. We got around mainly by foot, but we occasionally took the subway which was conveniently located on the half a block away. We walked to most of the sites including Times Square, Theater district, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, High Line, West Village, Chelsea Market, and SoHo. While some of these sites were farther than others, it was so much fun to see the city by foot. A major plus was the local flower market. It was so nice to step outside the hotel and see these beautiful flowers and plants lining the sidewalk. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to return to NYC. I'll be back at the Fairfield Inn without a doubt.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I looked long and hard to find an affordable place to stay in NYC. I was more than pleased to find that the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chelsea was more than to my liking. The rooms were very clean. Yes, the space is small, but then we are in NYC. I was also very pleased with my decision to upgrade to the higher floor, with the floor to ceiling windows and view of the Empire State Building. Especially at night with the colored lights at the top. Breakfast was included which was great, with a good variety of food including some style of eggs each day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in a fantastic central location in the Flower District. We got to the hotel using the AirTrain and subway from JFK and just walked the 5 short blocks from Penn Station. It was well placed for getting the subway uptown or downtown and we could walk to TS within about 10 mins. The street outside was lovely during the day, with all the flowers laid out and it never felt unsafe when we walked back at night.Check in was very quick, but we were initially a little disappointed with our room as we looked out at the building(yoga studio) directly at the back of the hotel (4th floor). The room itself was small but had everything we needed and to be honest we only slept and showered there so it was ideal. The bed was very comfortable and by putting our cases under the desk, we had enough space to move about easily.The complimentary breakfast was ideal, enough choice for us and replenished frequently. The hot drinks were available at any time day or night.The rooftop terrace was great to see if we were missing out by not paying extra to have a front facing room (great view but as I said we wernt in the room very often). It was fun to be able to pick out the hotel from the top of the ESB - which was only 5 blocks away.The hotel staff were always lovely and friendly and were happy to answer any questions we had.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Had a stressful trip to NYC to move my daughter out of her dorm at FIT and pack her for study abroad in Shanghai. The front desk staff is beyond friendly and helpful! From printing out a final exam project to making a copy of her passport, the staff treated us like family. Especially, George and Brandi! This hotel is located close to FIT on 28th, but also easy to walk wherever you need to go- located between 6th and 7th and close to Penn Station. It is in the flower district which was beautiful during the day. The rooms are clean and nice. We had a view of the Empire State Building. Great experience! Won't stay anywhere else.
user_name:
Robin S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Staff: friendly and responsive to your requests. I pointed out that coffee had run out and they replaced it in less than 2 minutes.Rooms: clean if a bit small; the restrooms are not only small, but the door opens into the restroom. In Room 803, you have to almost push yourself against the shower door in order to get the door open and get out. I strongly recommend adjusting the door to open outward or replacing the bathroom door with the sliding type.Food: Starbucks coffee. The muffins are very tasty. The sausage leaves something to be desired and the shake n' bake eggs look absolutely terrible. Terrace: Great view of the Empire State building. Could use some more sturdy chairs.Overall: Great value for your money in NYC, walking distance from Penn Station.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was in NYC for a surprise birthday trip for my son. The hotel is right around the corner and within walking distance from Penn Station. The streets are lined with flower shops so their are beautiful flowers everywhere. We arrived Friday afternoon and the staff was very acommodating. They upgraded our King room to a city view. The bed was extremely comfortable. They also have breakfast daily. (boiled eggs, bagels, cereal, muffins, fruit, juice, milk, breakfast sandwiches) There is no mini mart inside the hotel but there is a Duane Reade right around the corner. I had a great experience Friday-Sunday and I would stay here again.
user_name:
NH923
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed at this Marriott property for two nights on business and was very pleased. As others have noted, the hotel is clean and well-managed. A shout-out to everyone on the front desk - uniformly friendly, knowledgable and helpful, no matter the hour or how many people were in the lobby. My room was small but that did not matter to me as I was on my own and seldom in the room. The heat/AC system was not noisy like in many other hotels and so did not disrupt my sleep. I was on the 11th floor, speaking of sleep, and heard very little street noise.The breakfast area and food served are typical for the brand, and yet I would once again give extra credit because the breakfast area was pleasant, clean, well-organized and had a reasonable amount of seating. For those of us who don't drink coffee it was a pleasant surprise to find higher-quality Tazo Teas on offer with the hot water, instead of just generic tea bags. As others have noted, Penn Station is a 5 - 7 minute walk away and the subway is quite nearby. My only quibble - and I would call this minor - has to do with the bed pillows!! They are oddly small and not overly comfortable. Otherwise, well done!
user_name:
Linda L
Winston Salem, North Carolina

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights and had a great time in NY. Comfortable bed, good breakfast, great location, you can easily walk to many attractions (and Penn Station is also not very far). Subway is nearby as well. Staff is very friendly. There are some rooms with city view, mine was out the back... no view but very quiet instead. This will definitely be on top of my list for a place to stay on my next visit.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Living in CT, we normally take the train in to the city (New York), go to a show or museum and return home by train at night. For my birthday treat, we decided to stay overnight at this Fairfield Inn. We were unable to bring any overnight bag items because we went to the musical "Newsies" and the Nederland Theater has no leg room, coat room nor lockers. So with toothbrush and meds, on the 14th floor we did fine at this hotel, enjoyed a sense of quietness and had a great breakfast in the am. As others have mentioned, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff here was A1 okay. Loved the block outside too, filled with fresh flowers for sale up and down the street. Only wish it had been easier to get a cab on this street.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband had a business trip to NYC, so our 3 year old and I decided to tag along. We wanted to stay somewhere close to Times Square without blowing our budget, and we thought this was a great option.We traveled by Megabus from Washington DC, and we were dropped off very close to this hotel. We were a little early for check in, and they gave us the option of checking in right then, or waiting until actual check in time for a room with a fold-out chair for our daughter. We opted to wait, and they were happy to hold our bags while we killed some time. All of our dealings with the staff were very professional and personable. They even gave our daughter a little cow toy, which she played with the entire stay.The room itself was smaller, but that was to be expected in New York City, and for our short stay we didn't mind it. Our three year old thought the fold out chair was one of the coolest things in the world. For an adult, it would be a little tight, but she slept soundly on it all night. We enjoyed the king bed, it was very comfortable.I'm a big fan of anywhere that offers free breakfast, and this spread did not disappoint. They had lots of good options for all of us. To name a few options, they offered cereals, toast, bagels, yogurts, Del Monte grapefruit and fruit cups, hard boiled eggs, orange and cranberry juice, apples and bananas, coffee and hot chocolate, and Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches. It was so nice not to have to worry about breakfast every morning, especially with a child in tow. There was plenty of seating available.The location was great. Walking distance to Time Square and Penn Station, and a Subway station on the same block. Lots of reviews mention the flowers outside, which is true! It is a nice touch.As we checked out, we grabbed some cookies from the front desk. I was impressed with the staff who were friendly and happy.Overall- this was a great deal, with a comfortable, quiet room and free breakfast, and friendly staff. Our room was on the smaller size, but perhaps they offer bigger ones, or this is good for smaller traveling groups. Easy access to public transportation, and also walking distance to many attractions. We enjoyed our stay here!
user_name:
liliribs
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was the best NYC hotel stay I've had in a while.My room was large by Manhattan standards, with space to move around, a small closet (big enough for storing clothes and a suitcase), a d desk area and flat-screen TV. And, the room and bathroom were both spotlessly clean.I had paid a little extra for a view room, and got what I paid for: a great view of the Empire State Building.I loved the rooftop deck - the view was outstanding and it was nice to go up there for some fresh air (or a smoke).The staff - particularly those at the front desk - could not have been more friendly and helpful.I loved the Chelsea location - lots of food options nearby, and walking distance to one of my favorite bars/clubs.My only (very minor) complaint was the configuration of the bathroom - when you opened the bathroom door the toilet stuck out and was kind of in the way so you had to open the door all the way to get around the toilet to the sink area. Not a big deal, though. The shower was great and the sink was stylish with plenty of space (including cupboards underneath) to store stuff. I really enjoyed my stay here. In the future this will definitely be one of my top choices for my favorite long weekend travel destination - New York City!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I normally stay within the Hilton brand chain so this was my first time trying a Marriott. I must say everything about this hotel was fabulous. Joanne and Brandi at the front desk were so accommodating with everything my mother and I needed. They provided prompt service, gave us a room before the designated 3pm check out time which was great since we needed to get dressed and head to a TV show taping. Rooms were very clean. They weren't the most spacious, but it's New York so what do you expect? But the amenities were very modern and the location is to die for. Right smack dab in the middle of Chelsea. Breakfast was good too! Would definitely stay here again. Thanks for making our stay so fabulous front desk!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We have never been to NYC so we were kinda shocked to get a large room,new and clean. As we have heard from other people on their visits to NYC the complete opposite.Rooms are excellent and the staff this hotel are amazingly helpful and sooooo nice and kind....loved it and we will back.Thank you to the staff for everything!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a simple and small hotel that has reasonable rates ( FOR NEW YORK ) but boy the service by ALL the staff was simply fantastic! I have never come across such sweet and friendly hotel staff........ THANK YOU GUYSmy first trip to New York and I was not expecting people to be so friendly.The room was on the small side but very nice, with great views of the empire state building and it looked like it had been recently renovated. Breakfast was included, very basic, but it was ok. the location in the midle of the Flower district was very cute and the hotel is only five minute walk away from 5th Ave and Empire State Building........if your like us and only use a hotel to sleep and wash, this is a very good one thats closs to EVERYTHING. well worth a stay

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in April, in a king room. As previous reviewers have said, rooms are small but this is the norm in NYC. Our room didn't have a view but was really quiet, something we have not experienced in NYC before. We paid $250 + taxes per night which was reasonable compared to other hotel prices as it was just after Easter.The best bits - friendly helpful staff, complimentary Starbucks coffee & tea 24/7, very comfortable bed, view from the rooftop of ESB & the skyline, close to the subway, reasonable continental breakfast, and delicious free cookies in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Absolutely no complaints at all during our four night stay. Can't think of a single thing to gripe about since this inn exceeded all our expectations AND was a great value. The staff is excellent, the location is really good and very quiet, the bed and pillows were comfortable, everything spotless and in good condition/working order, breakfast was a cut above, plenty of lighting in the room which is rare, plus the elevators are fast and larger than many. I could go on and on, but you get the idea - we're really happy campers! Be sure to take the elevator to the rooftop for a wonderful view of the Empire State Buiding.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had a gallery opening on W 25th St and was searching for a reasonably priced hotel for my stay.The Fairfield was in an interesting neighborhood and a short distance away from the gallery and many other interesting attractions. You walk out your door and you are in the middle of the Flower District with flowers everywhere - a great sight for March ! and a view of the Empire State building.Also walking distance for sight seeing and photo ops. Our walk included a vist to the meat district undergoing a grand transformation and a visit before leaving to Battery Park.And yes, as other travelers have mentioned - the front desk people are super !

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location for MSG. Polite, helpful staff, parking easy to access and NYC reasonable, clean, we'll appointed, comfortable. Continental breakfast adequate, nothing to right home about. Internet was free. Area seemed safe we walked back twice from MSG after midnight without concern.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here for three nights during an anniversary trip to NYC. The hotel is clean, comfortable, sand well-appointed. We liked the location being near a couple subway stops. We bought a week long subway pass so we could hit all of the Manhattan sights whenever we wanted. The folks on the front desk were super helpful and friendly. They mailed post cards, offered advice on parking, schedules, etc. The breakfast was good enough-- no frills... Nothing hot other than a toaster for bagels and hot coffee/tea. They had a good selection of cereals and fruit. The immediate street that the hotel on is ok... Not the nicest, but we didn't feel uncomfortable. Overall, a great hotel in a super location, we would stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed on 8th April 13. The check in was late 4pm but we were able to drop off our bags early. Very nice clean room with a lovely large walk in shower. Shower products in bathroom. Coffee maker with complimentary coffee and water. Bar area very casual, if you require something to eat they call next door to get you a takeaway, great if you are tiered and want a sack, i.e. burger & chips, salad or sandwich, however the food was good. Friendly waitress who gave us a complimentary drink to take to our room, we did buy 2 drinks beforehand these were not cheap but nothing is in New York !Breakfast was very good with a good choice go hot and cold food. We asked for a slightly later check out, this was not a problem and there was no charge.I would certainly use this hotel again, it was about a 10 minute walk to Times Square.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The place is still fairly new, clean & in a decent area. Close to subways & restaurants. 5 Blocks from Whole foods. Our reason for choosing this locale. Staff was pleasant & helpful. [However, we arranged for car service to LGA & were burned twice. The drivers ask for more money than the service is advertised. And on our departing trip, the driver refused to take the quicker tunnel & went 30 min out of the way because we told him that the hotel told us that the tolls were included for the $50 fee. Jut take a cab or if you have time to spare, take the M60 bus to LGA.]

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location and pleasant flower district, as an oasis in the bustling metropolis. The room rate includes continental breakfast. I would say that the breakfast is quite monotonous. Really pleased, it's a free wi-fi and free tea and coffee around the clock. The room is quite spacious for New York, we had a city view room with king size bed. The room was a good sound insulation. Staff friendly.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We researched Mid-town to find a reasonably priced hotel with good reviews. We are so glad we chose this one! Just returned today from 9 nights in Manhattan. On arrival we were a little apprehensive, night staff not overly welcoming and room seemed small, but as the days passed, it grew on us. Most staff very helpful, especially Thomas, who sums up the spirit of the city. Room small but very clean and managed very well. Breakfast adequate and coffee 24/7 a bonus, with occasional complimentary cookies, perfect! Easily accessible between 6th/7th Avenues its well placed for touring the Island. A few good bars on 7th and diners at hand. Look no further.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights and we had a great time.The standard room is very, very small. The only picture you see in the web site, with sofa, is very different from the reality. Our stay was long, so we were very worried about the room size and small wardrobe. Our decision to say at Fairfield, was based on the photos we saw. So we decide to show them the web site photos, and ask for a solution. Mia, a very professional staff, was very helpful and move us the next day to another room.Good continental breakfast, bagels, juices and coffee. Our room was nice, comfy king size bed, cleans lines and towels, free wifi and coffee maker.Close to subway, Whole Foods Market in a walking distance.Thanks Mia for a great stay!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Had a chance to stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites/Mahattan-Chelsea on March 30th thru April 1st. I was in New York for a concert at Madison Square Garden that Saturday night. Ley's begin with the location. It's on West 28th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues. You are going down a street that seems to be all strew front stores, and then poof, you see at tall, skinny, 18 floor hotel that is the Fairfield Inn and Suites.The Lobby: The lobby is a small as everybody says it is. And I could see if a large group showed up, that it could get very, very crowded. That being said, I found the lobby to be clean, the front desk staff to be most pleasant and comfortable. There is a small 4 seat seating area in the front lobby. Straight ahead is a set of 2 elevators which zipped you up to and down from the floors. Around the elevators to the rear is a separate seating area which contained the continental breakfast, which I did not use, but it had the usual bagels, fruit, cereal, and assorted coffees and juices.The Room: I was in room 707 on the 7th floor. As I said the hotel itself is a very skinny building, and the hotel only had maximum of 7 rooms per floor. I have been in some small rooms in my travels over in Europe, and I have to say my room was a very tiny room. That being said, I found the bed to be extremely comfortable, with 5 pillows. The room had a 42 inch plasma/lcd TV mounted on the wall. The room had a small work desk and a small cabinet that held a ironing board, iron, coffee pot with setup and the ice bucket. Plenty of hangars were available, and there was 2 small drawers on the bottom. There is a temperature interface that hooks in with the wall mounted heating/air conditioning unit that is mounted on the wall under the window. When its on heat, it purrs like a kitten, but, when the air conditioning comes on, it is somewhat noisy. However, when the ac is on, it's like the north pole is coming out of the vents, great for a hot day. The window did not have much of a view, basically the buildings next door, so if that is important to you, ask for higher floor. It was not a problem for me.The Bathroom: The bathroom had a 2 person shower, that I found very clean, excellent water pressure, and plenty of hot water. The sink/vanity area was fitted with Koehler faucets. The bathroom had the standard bath soap, body soap, and hair conditioner.The hotel is very conveniently located, only 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, etc, and also to plenty of restaurants and bars. Closet subway stop was up on 33rd Street, at least that is what I found.Overall the Hotel is in a great location, close by everything, excellent staff, and a comfortable bed. I was charged $224/night for a King bed, a great price if you ask me. Would definitely stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here for one night last October with 2 kids. At the time we went, the price for the room was one of the cheapest I could find in the Manhattan area. But traveling with kids, price is not as important to me as a clean, secure property with amenities and a good location. We lucked out on all accounts. Here are some of the things we appreciated most:1. Flower district location -- so cool coming and going. For a city that otherwise smells like cigarettes and sewer, the fresh vibe on this street sets it apart.2. The staff was extremely friendly to me and my kids. Friendly like, offered to call me a cab. Brought me a bottled water while I waited for a cab. A food item had run out at breakfast and one of my daughters asked an employee if they had any more of it and he happily sought it out. We felt very welcome.3. The rooftop patio. We made hot chocolate down in the dining room at night and brought it up to the rooftop to enjoy while we took in amazing views of the city. The Empire State Building is just a few blocks away and made for a breathtaking skyline. Nobody else was up on the rooftop. The seating area was comfortable. We felt pretty lucky to have this special time in NYC.This place is a little treasure.Thanks for a great stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is very quiet. We had a great sleep. Not great to drive to but there is a parking lot one block away, then you can walk to restaurants, bus or train.You are surrounded by flowers since you are in the flower district. There is a very nice breakfast in the morning included.We totally enjoyed our evening before retiring.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Yes it's Manhattan and yes it's expensive for $350/night for this place is not bang for buck. Unfortunately, I had to book last minute and there were slim pickings. The Fairfield is clean, relatively quiet if you're on a high floor and comfortable after a long day on the town. But it's no frills. As a Marriott Gold member I expected a little more, heck for the price I expected a little more. But I guess a warm cookie in the evenings will have to do.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have to give this stay a thumbs up for quiet. I have never had so little noise, especially in a relatively low rise building. I was on the 15th floor, facing away from the street. I was dead silent during the night. So if you want a quiet place, this is it. I was in 1501, and this hotel is like many midtown hotels, room face front and back only. No side views. So I know rooms ending in 01 and 03 face the rear for sure. Not a great view, but quiet.Other than that I have to also say the staff here was very nice, helpful, and efficient. Gave great restaurant suggestions, directions, and other advise. Room was good size, clean, big bathroom, shower only. No refrigerator. Breakfast was typical Fairfield fare, which was fine. Fitness room was also typical. I went to Planet Fitness on 27th to work out.Parking is $25.00 per night if you validate, and is about a block away from hotel. The one thing about this location is the street itself is pretty grim, especially when the daily flower vendors are wrapped up for the day. Not a pretty block. But a walk a few blocks away will change that perception. Did feel safe in the area.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here the weekend of 3/15/13 to 3/17/13. I was very surprised how well my stay was. The staff was the best. They had a smile on their face and would greet me every time I went out and came back in. The room was great. It was clean and everything worked. The even came to my room to check and make sure the room had been cleaned. I thought that was a great touch. The hotel is in walking distance to everything, Penn station, Times Square and a lot of great places to eat. The free wifi worked great and did I say free. I will stay here on my next trip to New York City. Thanks to the staff and the Fairfield inn for a great stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Rooms are clean, nice bed, close to Madison Square Garden Events and other Midtown venues, Typical small rooms for New York, and truthfully on the pricey side given the size of the room. Great Location

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: There are a couple Marriott properties near Madison Square Garden. This one is in the "garden district", flowers everywhere. Safe, clean and just a couple blocks from everything near MSG. Stayed here for a basketball tournament over an extended weekend. Prices kept creeping up, so book early! It also was a quick walk from Megabus' drop off stop. Very convenient! Breakfast was good, muffins were like they were homemade. Rooms was clean. View was probably typical NY view, of another hotel next door.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I loved everything at Fairfield Hotel. It's in a good location, close to the subway and within a walking distance to the most important places in the city. Really comfortable and clean room, very friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast (continental style). I'd stay there again and totally recommend it! It was a great stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice hotel near Macy's and flatiron building. Room was very clean, huge comfortable bed and big bathroom. Staff was helpful and nice. We can recommed this hotel and we will come back! Hyvä ja edullinen hotelli, huone oli siisti ja sänky oli erinomainen, hotelli tarjosi myös aamiaisen mikä oli ihan ok. Hotellilta on lyhyt kävelymatka Macylle, Empire state building ja Flatiron buildingille, metropysäkki löytyi myös ihan nurkan takaata.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a great time exploring the city. The staff at this hotel was always helpful and went out of their way to take care of us with a late check out and hours to wait until our train left. The rooms were small but clean and perfectly fine. Breakfast was cheerful and plentiful. We would stay here again! Very conveniently located and lots to do within walking distance.
user_name:
Astrogrl14
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed at this Marriott property multiple times and enjoyed all visits prior to my most recent trip. I stay here due to the amazing proximity for work and really love the location, it's short walk to the subway and other things.But this was an overall subpar visit for two reasons. The first? I arrived from the West coast via a red-eye flight around 11 a.m. on a Sunday morning and was told my room wasn't ready. That was totally cool, as check-in isn't until 3 p.m. However, the woman at the front desk told me she would give me the first open room that became available. I told her I would sit in the small waiting area not 15 feet away from her in her eye line to make sure she remembered I was there and ready. More than two hours later, at least one other person checked in successfully and it was only when I went up and asked if a room was available did she say "yes," which made me irate because she knew I had traveled without sleep to NYC.Second? I woke up Monday morning and prepared to depart. As I was gathering my belongings on the bed, I noticed an array of blood stains all over the white comforter. Absolutely disgusting. I took multiple pictures of the inexcusably laid comforter and delivered my complaint to the desk upon check-out.As a Marriott Rewards and "Friends & Family" member who has numerous business associates inside the Marriott Worldwide walls, I was appalled to only receive $20 off my stay having spent thousands of dollars at various Marriott establishments nationwide.This whole experience has made second-guess staying at this property in the future after enjoying every other prior visit. Very disappointed.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I just stayed there for a quick work trip and found it very clean, comfy and modern. Great staff as well- they are very nice and helpful! The welcome bags with water and cookies are a nice touch! Would look to stay here in the future,

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel pictures are misleading, therefore you should keep your expactation low. Hotel rooms are very clean, I can't tell the same thing for public areas. Breakfast area was in mess for the most of the time. None of our special requests (such as bed type, high floor preferance, close rooms) were taken care of. Rooms are very small, no space to place the luggage, if you travel two, forget about second luggage. Small wardrobe, no shelf on the bathroom.However for a city like NY, you shouldn't expect more on this price level, I think this sub-brands do not promise more than this. Just good to know what to expact in advance. One more thing regarding payment; Although every room either guaranteed or paid on arrival with their individual credit card, my credit card (as I made the reservations at the first stage) was charged for the first night fee, which is non-sense, I had to find it out on my return through my bank statement. I had to call the hotel and sort it out. They were kind and quick on the phone though. Staff is professional in general.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Wife said find me a place near the Empire state building that is safe with free breakfast! First trip for our family of 6 to NYC! I went to trip advisor and saw that this location was a few blocks from Empire state building and seemed nice. The picture of the facade appealed to her so we booked! We were very suprised with the room in comparison with some of the competitors we looked at. We had 2 bathrooms and 2 separate rooms with a sliding door which was excellent way to have kids sleep while parents wound down. View on 18th floor south was very intersting. The breakfast area was congested and the hotel staff had a hard time keeping up with the crowds. Parking was free out front on weekend night which was pleasure since parking structure for hotel was a few blocks away. To our surprise in the morning we thought our car was gone for sure when we went outside and in all directions we see plants. Eventually walked into the street and saw our car amongst the rain forest that had appeared over night. Turns out this was the florist/garden district. Very nice people helped me load the car since they needed the room to help unload more flowers.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Once I got passed the fact that this is a New York City coffin size room, I came to like this hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast very good. And any time I had to ask for something they were extremely polite and helpful. On my arrival when I noticed my room did not have a hair dryer, I called down to ask if there was supposed to be one in the room or if they did not offer hair dryers. They apologized on the phone and sent one right up. The person who brought up the hair dryer profusely apologized.Two drawbacks. There is very little shelf space in the bathroom to store cosmetics, etc. And the free wifi is very slow.But I would return to this hotel. The location is very good and as i said, they were really friendly and the breakfast was good.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Clean room, great location, helpful staff, great amenities for the price. This hotel is a fantastic value for Manhattan, a gem staring you right in the face. I plan to look here first for future stays in New York City.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: my wife and I just spent four days at the Fairfield while in New York for the Gift Show. We followed the advice of travelers on Trip Advisor and once again are very glad we did. Although the rooms are extremely small, even our King Size room was very tight and we needed to be quite creative to find any storage space we managed and enjoyed ourselves completely. The complementary breakfast is fair, cold cereals and bagels, egg muffins and yogurt Ian good supply, better than most chain complementary breakfasts but not great. Location was fabulous whether a tourist in New York or business traveler ya sous are right in the middle of everything. We always choose hotel with a fitness center and the one was better than most that chains have to offer with elliptically, treadmills and all with televisions attached. The front desk service was exceptional, pleasant, helpful and full of spirit employees on all shifts were professional and seemed pleased to be able to help. Can't beat the price, especially if you know your dates and can book and pay in advance. All in all a wonderful experience, would recommend highly as lassoing as you can be flexible and deal itch a smallish room.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel several times and It is my hotel of choice. Prices are good, rooms are clean and new. The rooms are on the small side, but typically the price point is also small compared to other similar properties. Breakfast is included making the price point even more attractive. The hotel is located on the street as the stores that make up the NYC flower market. In January, you walk outside the hotel and on the sidewalk are narcissus and hyacinth along with their wonderful fragrance. The hotel is is a block away from the 1 subway - 2 stops away from Times Square. Easy walking distance to Penn Station - easier than maneuvering the stairs of the subway. Get an unlimited metro pass $29 for 7 days and use the subway and busses unlimited and all of NYC is yours to be had. I found that I was more knowledgable than the staff regarding restaurants. I would suggest that the hotel get a couple of copies of New York Zagat guides to let guests borrow. For extended stays- I might send over some better feather/down pillows.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and I and another couple spent January 18-22 at this hotel in Chelsea. We had a wonderful rate from Marriott on line and our rooms were modern, reasonably sized for NYC with good bedding, a great shower and enough space for all of our belongings. Location was superb for us - 2/3 block from the 1 train. The staff was friendly, gracious, helpful and efficient. [Our companions were NOLA4158] We highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I just returned from spending 4 nights at his wonderful hotel. We were with friends celebrating birthdays. We come to NYC at least once a year and decided to stay in an area we had never stayed in before. The hotel was perfect - clean and roomy. The front desk staff could not have been more professional or helpful. We will definitely stay here again. Thanks for making my birthday celebration so memorable.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This property offers a convenient quiet location and wonderful staff, particularly the man at the front desk (did not get his name) and friendly Mia who has the best food tips for an out-of-towner.But the hotel smells very strongly of Febreze or something like that they must spray in the rooms and lobby. We had to air out our room from the noxious smell. If you have allergies you may have a problem like we did. Also, would like the TV volume down or off in the breakfast room. Don't need to hear about the latest infamous murder as I eat my cereal. There was loud music from someplace in the back of the property but it turned off by midnight both nights.The bed is very comfortable and strong pressure in the shower.If not for the the chemical smell we would come again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, the view from the roof top is great and it's fairly close to subway. Hotel staff was very nice....we will keep this one in mind! Thanks Marriott :)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I visit NYC for business & pleasure six times a year at least. This Fairfield Inn on the edge of Chelsea is great. Its new and clean with great rooms.....on the small size but so well appointed that its not a problem.....same with the smallish bathroom. The mattress is one of the best I have ever slept on in a hotel and the shower head was super. I guess its the little things that add up to make a decent hotel. What makes a really good experience is when the hotel is full of knowledgeable yet friendly employees. I have to give a special nod to MIA on the front desk....who took great care of us and was so friendly while doing so.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As a tourist visiting New York you know that Manhattan is where you should stay. We book about 3 weeks before our Jan 2013 trip to NYC and I think we had a very good deal, here are our comments :+ points1. Location, between 7th Ave and 28th St, a lot of major attractions are within walking distance. our room has the view of the Empire State Building. Subway is within 5 min walk. 2. rooms are renovated recently, everything feels fresh and new. good bed. 3. service is top class, when we complained that there might be a suspected leak in the toilet, they call the engineer to check out, after 5 mins they have already getting us another room.4. good breakfast, free fast WIFI, star bucks coffee served in room. - points1. if you have to find something, the rooms may be a but small, but this is the middle of manhattan.will stay there again !

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Recently, my husband & I found this hotel available for a great rate and decided to take advantage of the deal. It was the best decision, as it is a gem! The hotel is centrally located in the city and is incredibly clean & new. Actually, I was told it was built in 2009. The room was well appointed and was a decent size for Manhattan. The bed was very comfortable. Our room was also very quiet. The staff was accomodating and extremely friendly. The breakfast was perfect and the service in the dining area was great. We were so pleased with everything this Fairfield Inn had to offer & hope to return again soon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Just loved this hotel. Excellent location, very friendly staff and great breakfast. Could of done with tea and coffee making faciliites in room and a little more light other wise fantastic. Loved the fresh baked white chocolate macadamia cookies they provided free in the afternoons.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our 2nd stay here and the entire staff is terrific! Front desk are helpful, efficient and friendly. Housekeeping very tidy and flexible. And Tanya at breakfast runs a terrific room! Highly recommend for reasonable rates and location.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I'm a Marriott Plat, and while I understand that perhaps this hotel doesn't upgrade Plat members to suites, I was surprised to check in and find I was assigned one of the worst rooms in the hotel - a low floor room that, from the floor plan view, appeared to be one of the smallest rooms (an x01 room) facing the back alley - no offer was made of even having a decent street view. The layout of the room barely permitted use of the desk. I don't mean to seem overly entitled but what's the point of getting status if you're assigned a priceline-type room in the middle of low season? The room itself was very dark due to facing the alley and was very cold - I had the thermostat cranked up to 75 but the room constantly felt like it was in the low 60s. The hotel is in a decent location and is new, which is nice. The complementary breakfast is....well you get what you pay for. Enough to fill you up at least.Moral of the story: Marriott elites, look elsewhere. Even the other Fairfield in Times Square treats elites better.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I had the opportunity to go to NYC and took a chance on this hotel, not knowing anything about it. What a terrific stay we had! After coming from the train station early in the morning, we got to the hotel and asked to store our luggage until check in much later in the day. Not only was the young woman at the desk friendly and very helpful, she asked if we had breakfast yet. We had not. She immediately took us to their breakfast room and made us feel right at home! We were so impressed with her kindness. The hotel is very close to Penn Station (about 6 or 7 blocks), close to shopping, restaurants, etc. There is a subway station at the end of the block as well. A perfect location for us! We had a great day and came back to the hotel in time to check in, change clothes, hop on the subway and zip off to see a Broadway show we had tickets for. All went like clockwork. The afternoon hotel crew was friendly and very helpful as well. I have stayed in the Time Square area several times and the rooms were always small, cramped and at times, the hallways were scary. At the Fairfield we stayed on the 16th floor, the room was bright, modern and a decent size. Even provided a coffee pot! It was quiet and absolutely more than met our expectations!!! In the morning the staff was great. Breakfast was the typical Fairfield Inn start to the day, but they were right there to replenish anything that ran low. We had another great day exploring new neighborhoods. Later in the day we came back to retrieve our luggage, grab a quick cup of coffee to go. The desk clerk asked if we would like two bottles of water to go with us. She put it in a handled bag, retrieved our luggage and sent us on our way with many thanks for choosing this Fairfield Inn. Needless to say, we have told many, many friends about our GREAT experience and will return again! Thank you so much to all the great staff and for the very comfortable surroundings. We stay in Fairfields often when we travel and, by far, THIS IS THE BEST ONE ON THE EAST COAST! We will be back!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for 9 nights, can't fault the hotel for location, cleanliness, friendliness and service.We were upgraded free of charge on booking in just because we were staying for longer than a few days. The room was spacious with a king size bed and we had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building.My only grievance was in relation to payment. We booked on line using our Visa Credit but when we checked in we were asked for the card we would be using to pay the final bill with. We handed them a Master Card Debit which they swiped.We had purposly pre loaded the card with enough Dollars to cover our bill and some extra to spend.This was intended to save the exchange fees charged on Credit cards.As expected our Master card was debited on arrival with an estimate of our final bill.I was told this would be released on checkout.What they actually did was take two lots of pre authorisation fees from our Master card and a further amount from our Visa Credit card (not swiped and no authority given) and the full final amount from our Debit card totalling $6984. Our actual bill was only $3319 .All but $700 was put back on our cards. It has taken me 30 days of constant emailing to try and get this released. We were left with no funds at the airport because of this. It was finally credited by our bank. Please keep track of your debit /credit deductions and note they will debit a card even if they have not swiped it, the details will be on their booking system.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our second "Girl Trip" to visit NYC between Christmas and New Year's. We reserved two rooms in August including room 1805 - a two room suite with two double beds and a sofa pull-out and two full baths for the 20 and under crowd and another two double bed standard room for the three middle-aged moms. Even though I had called to confirm the week prior when we arrived the standard double was not available because the prior guest decided to stay an additional night. We were "upgraded" to a King room with pull-out chair/bed. This would have been fine except that attempting to sleep on the chair was impossible. I've never been on something so uncomfortable. This could probably be remedied by offering memory foam toppers to use on the pull-outs. Other than that the hotel was great even though it was very busy during this week. Breakfast is simple but adequate and was kept stocked. They could use an additional coffee/hot water station when this busy to keep up with the breakfast crowd. The large table in the eating area was great for our group as well providing us a place to sit and visit. One night we brought in take-out from the Japanese restaurant just down the block and had dinner there.There is a large wall-mounted TV in that area along with another in the atrium eating area for breakfast. There are also 4 lounge chairs with a TV in the lobby.The entire staff and manager are incredibly pleasant and well-trained.Beautiful view of illuminated Empire State Building from the roof-top which was accessible by the elevator or stairs at night.
user_name:
Kim W
Clarence Center, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We found that the Fairfield was in the right location for all the places we wanted to get to. The room was small but clean and well appointed, the staff were friendly and helpful and it had all the things we needed for our weekend in NYC. I'd agree with a previous reviewer that it can be noisy (we were facing 28th St) and if you are a light sleeper, then earplugs may be useful. After a busy day of walking and touring though, we didn't have a lot of problems sleeping through the noise. We'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: There's an old saying that "you get what you pay for." Not sure that applies here. Often more expensive than neighboring Hampton Inns, the Fairfield Inn is not superior. In fact, while Hampton serves a freshly cooked hot and varying breakfast every morning, Fairfield Inn offers pre-wrapped Jimmy Dean sandwiches to heat by microwave oven. And, although the hotel is fairly new, the rooms are already starting to show wear and tear. So unless you're a Marriott loyalist, you may be paying a higher price here than at a similarly themed Hampton Inn and not getting anything in return. Of course if you're a Marriott Elite, upon check in you get two bottles of cheap water with a value of less than 50 cents. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: It is overwhelming to try and pick a hotel to stay at in Manhattan but our driving force was to pick one in close proximity to Eataly where we had a cooking class to attend. The rooms are small but omfortable. The people who worked the front desk and the breakfast area were really helpful and nice to us. The hotel is clean and for the most part price matches what you get for a NYC hotel. It also was nice and quiet for NYC.The morning breakfast which is included in your hotel rate was very more than adequate to start your day off. Coffee is on 24/7 which is nice when you are there in the winter.. It is still close to places like Chelsea market, Macy's, and Times square.When we go back to NYC next winter we would stay there again. Jonathan Gersh, Assistant General Manager was very helpful. say hello to him from us.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Nice Hotel. Interesting area walking around New York surrounded by vendors selling trees/flowers on the street. Added a unique twist to the experience. About 3 blocks from Madison Square Garden. Great location. I am Platinum at Marriott and wasn't even offered an upgrade of any kind. Breakfast was great and delicious. Nice indoor courtyard to eat. Wireless was fast and convenient. Fitness gym was nice, under ground and no windows but equipment was sufficient. One recommendation for management - Provide ear plugs to guests. I was on the 7th floor and there were non-stop sirens at all times of the day. Annoying but understandable being in NYC.Overall a nice stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First of all, the location is excellent. Two different subway lines within a half-block. In the middle of the flower district, very pleasant walking through the fragrant and beautiful greenery and flowers that the shops put out on the sidewalks to sell. The hotel staff were top-notch. Always pleasant, eager to assist, knowledgeable about the area. The complimentary breakfast was much more than your standard fare. Many hot and cold options in a self-serve area that was kept well stocked, as well as neat and clean. Proteins, fruits, cereals, and multiple beverage choices. Lots of seating, too. It was also a very nice surprise to find complimentary hot coffee/hot tea/hot chocolate available to guests 24/7. The room was excellent as well. Comfortable and clean. Not too cramped, unless you are trying to cram a family of 3 or 4 into one room. In that case, it might be a little tight. I did not have a single complaint during my four-night stay. There was not anything that I wished were different. Thank you, Staff of the Fairfield Inn in Chelsea. Well done!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We just got back from a trip to New York and stayed at the Fairfield Inn Chelsea. It was a great hotel and the staff was amazing! Friendly, always upbeat and genuinely helped us with all of our needs. The location can't be beat, only a few blocks from Macy's, the Empire State Building, and Times Square. The rooms are very clean and each morning there was a complimentary breakfast which was a perfect start to our day. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again for our next trip to New York.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a pleasant stay in the flower district in Chelsea. You arrive on a street, on which the sidewalks overflow with plants, orchids, flowers, and decoratives. Rooms facing the street have a great view of the Empire State Bldg. The rooms are clean, beds very comfortable, bathrooms well appointed. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We liked the location, easy access to subways to Brooklyn where our kids live, and good walking area. Excellent complimentary continental breakfast with glass enclosed eating area. Great value!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel room was extremely small for 3 people at a cost of $400 plus a night. The hotel was on a very noisy street and you could hear everything from the garbage collection, to the wholesale florist receiving their deliveries and neighboring construction. Do not expect for the high price tag a restaraunt, bar lounge, pool on premise etc.
user_name:
Lilly E
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We live in Zone A (NYC), and lost power during Sandy. Were desperate for a room. Only thing us desperate refugees from downtown were able to find for Thursday November 1st, and Friday November 2nd was this place. Rates you ask? $416 per night for a basic room, 2nd floor, facing the street.What could we do, we paid. There's nothing special about this place. The rooms are basic, and there's nothing included in the rate (such as coffee, breakfast). The staff? Oh my god. When I mentioned to the "gentleman" at the desk that the rate sounds ridiculous even by NYC standards for a place like this- I was told "supply and demand".When we finally got home and compared stories of what we did and where we stayed with a neighbor, I found out he had stayed at the same place the night of the storm and was charged $160 (of course he was!! they didn't know part of NYC would lose power yet). I WAS LIVID. Promptly filed a complaint with my local Attorney Generals Office.
user_name:
chris_elle
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: With the expectation of East Coast hotels being small, I had prepared my family that the rooms would be small...2 adults 2 small kids. Boy was I wrong. The room was smaller than I had expected and never mind the bathroom...not the cleanest hotel. Small and slow elevators.The staff was nice but with for the price that I had paid for, I was expecting much better service!Nice location in Chelsea and just few blocks from the subway station.Maybe that I am being too critical being from West Coast, but I would not recommend this hotel at the price that they are charging.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We searched the web for an economical modern hotel in Midtown Manhattan at a value price - lower than most charge. We came across Marriott's Fairfield Inn on West 28th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, at the southern edge of Midtown, just a few blocks south of Macy's and the Empire State Building. The Marriott Fairfield is a modern "no frills" hotel with a very good room design. Particularly at this price scale, the rooms are ample, not tight, with a king bed, end tables, large screen TV, and a generous number of clothing storage drawers as well as an ample closet. The bathroom has a glass shower although the bathroom was short on shelf space for toiletries. It’s one of the very few hotels we've stayed in, in the U.S. and overseas, where the free wired and wireless Wi-Fi worked very well at all times even in a fully-occupied-hotel. There is a comfortable chat and computer lounge behind the lobby, which is also the food-service area for the free continental breakfast. That space opens into a large enclosed glass atrium with tables and chairs for those lingering over breakfast. Coffee and tea is available at all hours. We had a 2nd floor room facing W. 28th Street, and the room was absolutely quiet. The 2 elevators are fast and responsive. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Subways and buses are nearby, as are some moderately-priced nice eat-in and/or takeout cafes on 7th Ave, as well as some smaller food shops on 6th Ave. Starbucks abound of course. At first glance the block looks dreary, but you'll immediately see two other new hotels across the street. The neighborhood is changing to condo lofts in the old garment factories. Some wholesale and retail flower shops remain on the block. Because of our very satisfactory 6-night-stay at this hotel, Fairfield Inns may well become a brand of choice in the future.
user_name:
georgeblomme
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: everything was perfect. Check in was a breeze, the location was great, there were subways in 3 different directions,the staff was amazing even the elevator is lightning quick.we highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Took a weekend trip to the city to see a show. This place came in with the right price, but being a bit farther south than I usually stay, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. The good: it's an easily walkable 3 blocks from Penn Station; there's a subway stop at the end of the block and another a block and a half away the other direction making it very easy to get around; the rooms were clean; the location was quiet. The bad: in room lighting (we turned all the lamps on in the room and it's still too dark, adaquate,but not bright); rooms are a little on the small size even for NYC (functional 15x15 room but no extra space - basically a bed, desk, and TV with a bathroom down the entranceway); TV service is terrible (OK, who has cable service which doesn't receive any of the major networks including all of those in the city? Let's ditch the oddball channel selections and get normal service - not sure what was going on here as the services book in the room showed a good channel selection, but none of them mapped to what was actually on the TV). The hotel staff was friendly and they were more than willing to hold our luggage while we went out and about to see our show prior to being able to check in.
