Breakfast is included, but we did not take advantage of it as we headed uptown early in the morning and just grabbed something on the go (there's a 24-hour McDonalds right down at the corner).We'd stay here again as the price is right and there's nothing "wrong" with the place (other than maybe the TV), it's just not as high on our list as some of the other Marriott properties in midtown/midtown east.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I actually considered not writing a review on this hotel since it may make it harder to book a room next time, but honestly, they deserve all the excellent reviews that they receive. First of all, it's an incredible location, the Flower District, which is between Greenwich Village and Time Square. You are surrounded by florists, but plenty of places near by to eat and explore. We really appreciated being in a quiet setting and away from the touristy Time Square area. Secondly, the staff is so helpful and friendly. We checked in early, knowing that the room would not be ready. They stored our luggage and even invited us to grab breakfast. The rooms are small, which is often the case in NYC, but the space is used wisely. For example, the TV is wall mounted. Planning on staying here the next time we are visiting New York and booking early.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Every aspect of our stay here was more than adequate. Friendly, helpful staff, convenient location, pristine room, high quality breakfast and all-day drinks facilities. Cookies at reception and a flower market on the path outside every day.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We booked a queen room with a pullout sofa online for our family consisting of mother, father and a tall teen son. When we checked in the pullout sofa ended up being a pullout chair. We called the front desk and they sent someone up immediately. She took one look at our son and said that the pullout chair was unacceptable for someone his size and she wanted him to be comfortable and walked us to a queen/queen room at no additional cost, We were so greatful and impressed with their promptness and accomodation to our needs. The hotel is compact, but clean, modern, well appointed and well staffed. It is conveniently located in the flower district and between two subway lines (7th Ave and Broadway) making it very easy to get to anywhere in the city. Walking down the street and seeing and smelling the flowers was amazing. The breakfast was pretty typical but the ambiance of being in an atrium type of atmosphere was nice and made you feel a little New Yorkish. And at the end of a long day of walking in the city who doesn't want to come back to their hotel to a batch of cookies waiting for them?

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a compact hotel wedged in among the rows of flower and plant stores in The Flower District. The rooms are well planned, and you get what you need. I had a king sized which didn't leave too much space, but in NYC you don't want to be hanging out in your room, right? The finish was excellent, and the bathroom had a large walk-in shower which was great.The roof terrace is a great spot, but it has noisy aircon vents and only a few plastic chairs for furniture. I bundled up my pillows and duvet and made the plastic chairs cosy for looking at the nightime skyline, the aircon noise soon becomes background.Breakfast is basic but good and included in the rate for all guests. You eat in a spacious conservatory.Ideally located to get to all parts of Manhattan. Right between 6th and 7th with only a short walk to the subway. And about a 10-15 min walk to Times square. The staff were all great [housekeeping were told politely to come back later, and they did]. came at I paid $317 inc taxes per night, which is the most I have ever paid for a hotel room! Hey, its New York City, Baby!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Was great from the arrival. Not expensive for Manhattan, very well located (flower district, close to lots of subway lines and a short walk from SoHo, Times square, High Line Park etc). We felt safe even at 4am! Front of house was amazing! The ladies at reception were so friendly AND helpful. Special mention to Mia (?) who was all smiles, we absolutely loved her. We had a king size room and I can´t understand the complaints on the size. It´s a budget hotel and the room size is great, bed is comfy and we didn´t experience any noise. We pretty much left early in the morning and went back late in the afternoon for a shower and out again and the hotel was perfect for our 6 night stay. We mentioned that it was our anniversary and they left a little bag with some water, chocolates, very considerate. Breakfast wasn´t amazing but one could go and get some fruit, cereal, muffins, yoghurt, boiled eggs and have a quick bite before going out. I will definitely go back if in New York again, 100% recommended. Best budget hotel I´ve ever stayed in.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed here at the start of September 2012 and was very impressed. The rooms are quite spacious for Manhattan (king bed with plenty of floor space left over) and very clean. The bathroom is also nicely finished with a large shower, even if it's all a little squashed in. The included breakfast is a continental breakfast which is enough, but don't expect too much from it, and if you arrive late on there isn't a huge ammount of seating.The staff are very helpful and polite, and let me check in almost 2 hours early to make my statue tour ferry, and stored my bags for almost 5 hours after check out until my flight.The location isn't the best for viewing the city sights on foot, but there is a subway station at the end of the street which if you take the number 1 train (every 10 minutes or so), it takes you straight to times square and central park uptown in about 5/10 minutes, or to battery park and the island ferries downtown in about 15/20. If you like shopping the best thing to do is get the subway to times square then walk 2 blocks over to 5th avenue for the major shops.I was really happy with my stay as the rooms were nice and the subway connection was very useful. At $150 inc. tax and charges, for the middle of Manhattan it's great value for money. I would definately stay there again and reccomend it to anyone going to visit NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The daily rate was way over priced at $479 a night. The service was the worst I've experienced. The Front desk clerks were rude and unfriendly. The room was decent, however personally had to tell the maid not to clean my room at 9:00am I needed time. She shows up comes in while I"m sitting in the room and cleaned around me. I was staying two more nights. She didn't speak english and she ignored my request. She rushed through the cleaning barely making the bed. Their complimentary breakfast was more like boxed breakfast. NO restaurant or room service. NO movie chanels. I wouldn't stay their again very disappointed the whole way around. Many other hotels in NYC that I would recommend first!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Hotel is situated in midtown, close to Empire State Building and on the "flower street". A newer hotel, there are modern amenities, nicely decorated rooms and very clean. Breakfast was good, but perhaps management would consider offering hot food (eggs, ham/bacon, waffles). Hotel staff were very friendly and provided excellent service. Do not hesitate to book this hotel!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We spent a week here on a sightseeing trip and it was a fantastic place to stay. The hotel is a couple of blocks from Penn station, and was able to walk to hotel after arriving in NYC via Amtrak. The hotel itself is tucked away on a sidestreet, opposite the Hotel Indigo,and is in a neighbourhood which has access to a number of Subway lines and some good eateries. The rooms are very clean, have been refurbed recently. The breakfast on offer is standard, but with a really good range of food. There's usually hot coffee on standby during the day, which is nice when you get back from a day's touring. The wifi is fine, and there are a couple of PCs with printers, which were handy for printing off train tickets and boarding cards. The staff are very friendly and helpful, with a good knowledge of the area. I can't emphasise enough how pleased we were with this hotel, it was really nice coming back to it every evening to relax. I would definitely stay here again, we really enjoyed our stay and it's my preferred hotel in NYC from now on.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We spent a night here and it was great. The location was perfect for us coming from Penn Station; we were able to walk to many attractions and the subway was convenient. The hotel was clean, our room was comfortable and modern looking, the staff were very friendly. The breakfast was a pleasant surprise, with more choices than a free hotel breakfast usually offers. Free wi-fi, as well. We would recommend this hotel and consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: For the price you pay in NYC this was a decent place to stay and I would stay there again. The location was good -- walking distance to Penn Station and a reasonably short taxi ride to many other attractions. The room was clean, nothing to complain about there at all. Upon getting off the elevator I was dismayed to see our room was right across the hall. I figured we would hear the elevator all night, but I never heard a thing from it.The buffet breakfast was adequate. No gourmet food but more than just carb-heavy sweet rolls and bagels. The bedroom was simple - the bed, a desk area, and a chest with the TV on top. The toiletries were OK if you hadn't brought your own. They were not a luxury brand but they would suffice. About the only disappointment was that there was no little safe in the room. I find that to be a nice peace of mind amenity when staying in the city, not that anything happened to our possessions. Everyone who worked there was very pleasant and helpful, right down to the housekeeping staff.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The room is really nice and clean. The problem is I was charged twice for the same stay. I made reservation and prepaid via Priceline.com. A few days after I came home, I found out my card was charged for another $87.95. I didn't use any paid services, and I was not being told I was charged for anything when I checked out. I called and they said the charge was a mistake promising that will give me the refund tomorrow. Except this mistake, it was a pleasant for me.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Terrific central walking distance location. Excellent windows - I think any view is buildings. Atypical of many NY hotels - larger walkin shower bathroom. I was happy with my high floor, next to the elevator noiseless king. This property exceeded my expectation. It is an absolute first consideration for my next visit.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel itself was centrally located; subway was at the end of the block, Times Square was a 15-20 minute walk away and there were lots of restaurants in the area. The hotel was very clean, the lobby always had iced lemon water available when coming back, breakfast had lots of variety with good hours. Coffee and tea were available at any time.The hotel room was great; king size, comfortable bed with a good sized shower! Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly; Mia was amazing! The rooftop offered a great view of the city day or night and parking was down the street about 2 blocks with hotel rates ($25/night).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great little hotel, within easy walking distance of Times square. Hotel and rooms were clean and well maintained.We had a great view of the Empire State building. Good free breakfast in the conservatory each day.Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is on a street full of flower shops, the small is gorgeous. Next doors cat is a permanent fixture on the doorstep. Would recommend highly.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: When I say "low key" I mean it's not a big fancy hotel, it's very simple with a small lobby area and the entrance is on a quite side street (West 28th Street). It's easy to pass by if you're not looking for it. In my opinion, Low Key is very good!I stayed here for one night on the 4th of July and used my Marriott points for the stay. I do think this hotel prices good for it's location in NYC, but NYC hotels are VERY expensive. If you are a senior or AAA member you will get a discount. LOCATION:- very good, just off 6th Avenue and a short walk to the subway on 7th Ave. Right along 7th Ave there are plenty of restaurants and quick service places to get a nice meal or something on the go. There's a McDonalds on the corner of 6th Ave as well. It's right at the tip of Chelsea, so mid-town is maybe a 10-15 minute walk that will get you to Times Square, the theater district, Empire State Building, Macys, etc. Greenwich Village is also a 15 minute walk in the other direction. You'd need to take a subway or taxi to lower Manhattan or Central Park unless you LOVE to walk & explore. The 2 closest major streets are 23rd Street with a lot of stores & restaurants and 34th Street where you will find Macy's, the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden & lots of fast food places nearby. As I said, the lobby is small and comfortable, there is a small sitting area there and outside there is a small area to sit as well. The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful, they really made me feel welcome. THE ROOM - my room was on the 7th floor and I could see the Empire State Building from my window, they gave me a room upgrade which was nice of them. The room isn't terribly large but very comfortable. I had a king bed, which was one of the most comfortable beds I ever slept in. There was a nice flat screen tv with a good amount of channels, a desk with a lamp & electrical outlet, coffee maker with coffee & tea supplied, free WIFI, phone & clock/radio with alarm. There was an iron & ironing board in the closet. The AC kept the room quite chilly if turned up. The window does slide open slightly on each side if you want a bit of fresh air. I don't recall seeing a mini-frig. The bathroom was nice, but small. It was odd how the door opens into the bathroom. When you open the door the sink is then behind the door. So you have to scoot in & close the door to get to the sink. It wasn't a big deal though, it's NYC-space is at a premium. The tub/shower was very nice and after a long day out & about, the shower is very soothing. They had some amenities in the bathroom like a small bottle each of shampoo, conditioner, & lotion. The hotel also offers a complimentary continental breakfast each morning. Unfortunately I slept in and didn't make it down for the breakfast nor did I see the breakfast room - sorry folks! I enjoyed 4th of July evening a little bit too much and got in very late. Speaking of that, we left the hotel around 10-1030pm to go out and even though most stores were closed (McDonalds on the corner was open) & the streets somewhat quiet, we felt very safe walking around the area as well as coming back around 130am from The Village. It is a major city though, so be careful. Parking - NYC is not a good place for a car as it is expensive to park and street parking is extremely difficult to find and you often have to move the car for street cleaning. They have a deal with 2 parking garages within a block from the hotel. I parked at one between 5th & 6th Aves (on 28th St). It is $25 a day for hotel guests and you MUST get your parking voucher validated at the hotel - you pay the garage when you pick the car up. I checked around for less expensive parking but couldn't find any. I would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We LOVED Staying at the Fairfield hotel, the room was pretty large for nyc, the wifi reception was pretty good all over the hotel, the location is quite convinient - near the 1,2,3 and n,q,r trains, and a walking distance from penn station, breakfast was pretty good too, but what really made the difference was the staff which were ALL very helpfull, polite and smiley. Next time I'm in nyc I'm sure I'll return. The only thing that wasn't bad was the holiday inn hotel I've moved too after the stay at the fairfield. see my previous review for details. in a word - Nightmare.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Family stay with 3 teens in early Aug 2012 for 5-day NYC sightseeing trip. Booked 2 rooms-pleasantly surprised that front desk gave us side-by-side rooms for convenience. Very clean lobby/rooms/bathrooms. Breakfast well stocked (cereals, bagels, muffins, toast, sandwiches, fruit, hardboiled eggs, granols, nuts, yogurt, 2 juices & water) with lots of seating. Kids loved the lemon water available free all day in lobby and free cookies at night! Front desk helpful with information for restaurants, taxis and directions. Great location and felt safe walking. 2 different subway lines are within 2 min. walk from lobby. Turn Right out of lobby and get to 6th Ave or left out of lobby to 7th Ave. We WILL stay here again! 28th street is full of plant/flower/garden stores so the street is clean and nice to walk thru on way to subways. Many restaurants, pharmacies, ice cream, coffee stores within 2 minute walk. Had great dinner across street from hotel @ sushi restaurant.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our second stay in the past three months; our five nights at this well located Manhattan property was great: the front desk staff are welcoming, energetic and interested in taking care of the guests. We were able to check in early, and the short walk from Penn Station (if you are coming in from EWR as we did) makes this a great spot. With 7 rooms per floor, it is a quiet, well maintained property. Free WiFi, and complimentary coffee and newspapers are a welcome amenity. Standard breakfast fare included, in a comfortable quiet area opening into an enclosed rear courtyard. The room was well maintained, and our 12th floor view of the Empire State Building a plus. Located on the main street of the Flower District, each morning was a pleasure to walk out into the flower and tree lined sidewalks. Many casual restaurants within two blocks. Definitely will return.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: NYC is a place you go to experience the city. That said, at the end of a day of walking, sight seeing, going up & down the subway stairs, and eating the great food of the city, you want a comfortable place to lay your head so you can start over the next day. Fairfield Inn fit that bill perfectly! You are in a central location making it easy to go wherever you want in the city and it is clean and comfortable. The rooms are small but anyone complaining about that is spending too much time in their rooms! Next time I head to the city, I would choose this hotel as long as it's still a reasonable price. Compared with similar types of hotels, this was a steal. Also, what is better than walking out into the smell of fresh flowers thanks to be located in the heart of the flower district? :)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was my second time travelling to New York City for a 4 night vacation with a friend. From check in- to check out, everything went smooth. We arrived 2-3 hours ahead of check-in time, and were given the room we requested (upgraded to high floor with a view of the Empire state building) right away. They were happy to accomodate our early arrival. Within an hour of arriving in the room, the front desk staff called to ensure everything was okay with our room. It was very comforting to know they were concerned about our needs. Furthermore, the following day the housekeeping staff stopped into the room and asked if we had everything we needed. We asked for additional paper and pens and it was delivered in minutes. Upon inquiring about check out time (noon) and if they could store our bags as we had a late afternoon flight, staff were happy to extend our check out time until 1pm, free of charge. They also offered to store our bags after that time. The rooms were awesome- no complaints about the size, typical for NYC and larger than expected. The bed was SO comfy- best I have ever slept in a hotel. Only minor complaints in regards to the room would be the water from the tap never seemed to get cold and the toilet paper was awkwardly located underneath and behind the toilet.Although all the staff were very friendly and helpful, Mia definitely stood out as one of the best desk staff we have ever encountered. She was so helpful- always giving us restaurant suggestions, directions, and asking how our day was. She had the biggest smile and made us feel so comfortable, welcome and safe.As for the location- the hotel is a 1 minute walk to the Subway that can take you right to Times Square (or a 15-20 minute walk), and a few blocks away from Penn Station where you can access many other Subway routes. The location was perfect as it was away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square (nice quiet street with lovely smelling flowers), but close enough to access shopping there, as well as Herald Square and the Soho district.Food- we tried a few eateries around the hotel that I would suggest. Around the corner is Waldy's Pizza, BRGR, 5 Guys, Triple Crown, and Mustang Sally that are all great CHEAP eats. Of course for breakfast we always filled up on the continental breakfast which was awesome.The hotel was reasonably priced for what it offers, and in the lower lobby you can find a savings rack of coupons for different attractions. We visited the Bodies exhibition and the Museum of Sex both of which I would highly recommend. We also saw Chicago on Broadway- a classic!Overall- a great hotel with awesome staff and service!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Room was quite pleasant and good size for Manhattan -- basically like my bedroom at home but with a desk. A continental breakfast was available in a wonderful sunroom. Yes, you can just eat there but you're in NYC - so try other food! The front desk and cleaning staff were great. I'm stilling feeling badly that I forgot to tip the very pleasant cleaning staff! We were on the 10th floor by the elevator. I was fearful of noise but it was quiet and had a great view.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Love this hotel, great customer service, refreshing breakfast!! Suite #1801 rocked. Very quiet and great view of freedom tower. Would definitely stay here again! Very clean and no bugs!!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I spent one night at this hotel after flying in from Paris. I needed a good night sleep, and a comfortable hotel to regroup after many weeks of travel. This hotel was exactly what I needed. The king sized bed was amazing, the room was spacious, the noise was minimal, and there were a lot of nice extras. My room had a huge TV, and Starbucks coffee in my room for the morning. Breakfast was included and though the selection was not huge, it had most things people would want:bagels, cream cheese, muffins, breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, more Starbucks, fruit, and cereal. The staff were very helpful, and the location was great as well. I loved my stay and was sorry to have to move on.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The staff at this hotel make you feel welcome and appreciated. The rates were the best we have ever found for a good hotel in the city. It is near the subway station and in the flower district, so you have a pleasant surprise outside the main doors.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a very bland hotel in a boring yet acceptable neighbourhood. I would not stay there again, but I must write a review on their customer service. It was just super friendly. We were treated with greatest respect and interest towards our needs. We arrived very early on a red-eye flight and were given a complimentary day room to sleep and relax before the actual check in time. This almost never happens and I am so greatful, it saved our first day in NYC. Also, the complimentary breakfast is very good and the lady who works there is just wonderful. Rooms are small and old in this hotel, yet it helps a lot when you have such a great personnel!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Four foriegn exchange students and two teachers stayed four nights in three rooms. Loved the location, staff was great, free breakfast, and wonderful warm cookies late afternoon. Outstanding!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I really cannot agree with all the great reviews. This hotel is so bland, no personality no nothing. I know a Fairfield Inn but yikes tiny tiny tiny. Tiny everything. Got a king room (no upgrades for this Platinum Premier) that was claustrophobic. Bathroom, be careful trying to move around. Really depressing room. Location is okay but certainly nothing special. Even at the "bargain" price you can do much better. Bed not too comfortable. Breakfast as the best part of the hotel stay and that was adequate.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We showed up early and were able to access one of our rooms almost immediately thanks to the hard work of the entire staff and upon checking out were able to store several pieces of luggage for hours.The rooms are small but nice, completely quiet and have just about everything you can need.It's located a block away from the subway, McDonalds, Bank Of America and a few blocks away from Macys, Madison Square Garden and Times Square, extremely convenient.The breakfast is fantastic, coffee, milk, juice, toast, english muffins, muffins, fruit etc and the lady in charge really goes out of her way to keep everything clean.Free WiFi, free computer access, free print outs etc...do yourself a favor and don't bother looking anywhere else, I will definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for a weekend, prices 1/4 of the Fairfield Inn near Times Square, good size room, great shower! Plenty of hot water, view onto 28th Street. Best part about the hotel was Mia, at the front desk. Very friendly, helpful, quick with advice on restaurants. I was there early and she immediately worked with housekeeping to find me an available room. Can't wait until my next trip!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very friendly, quiet, clean, well-updated hotel in Flower District of Chelsea/Manhattan. Very close to subway - 1 block. They accommodated both my early checkin and late checkout. Really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast consisting of many hot and cold items, including eggs, meats, pancakes, fruit, etc. I will book this hotel on my next visit, and you should try it too!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here for a vacation. The room was larger than we expected for New York. Most of the room was clean except the carpet which looked old. Our window faced the alley which made for a more quiet experience. There is an air conditioner in the window which works well, but can get noisy at times. The bathroom was small, but we expected this in New York and it was clean. The hotel is on 7th Ave and 28th street which is a good location and we were able to walk to Penn Station and Time Square. However, there is also a metro station very close to the hotel. The breakfast is included with the room and the staff at the breakfast were very helpful and asked us if we wanted more food before they closed. Overall, it was a good experience and we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have stayed in other Fairfield Inn hotels and are just good, not great, so I didn't expect much from this one. Since my arrival was pleasantly surprised! Lobby looks good, rooms are bigger than many more expensive hotels in New York, brand new rooms, good furniture, very comfortable bed, great bathroom. I got city view room and it was very nice, looking at the Empire State building. Breakfast is very basic, neighborhood is very quiet, located in a flower shop street, there is a subway station at the corner. And the price (at least the one I got) was amazing. Strongly recommend the hotel!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I love this area of Chelsea! It's the best of all world's...a nice stroll to the heart of Times Square or The Empire State Building (about 15 minutes) or a very inexpensive cab ride. ($8) This street is part of the vibrant garden district of Chelsea, so it's lined with lovely greenery during the day ... But the stores close early & it's a quiet part of the city for a peaceful slumber.I stayed here in November with my sister in a room with 2 double beds. Upon entering the hotel, you notice the bright lobby & are greeted warmly by he front desk staff. The hotel makes use of every square inch of available space. The rooms certainly aren't huge, but they are well appointed.I use a folding, motorized scooter to get around, so this took up a little extra floor space in front of the desk/closet area. The TV was sensibly a flat screen mounted on the wall so that extra furniture isn't needed to house it. Although it was cozy, it was what we expected for NY (almost exactly like the HGI directly across the road) & we had more than enough space for the 2 of us, our bags & all of our shopping!The bathroom was standard size, with standard amenities. When I called for some additional pillows to prop up my sore leg, they arrived very quickly. Breakfast was actually an unexpected surprise. The room is lovely! Skylights make it very bright & open. The selection was better than many other places I've encountered, too.The whole feel of the hotel to me is new & clean. The staff as a whole was very friendly. The beds were comfortable. When you consider the very limited amount of time you spend in the room before you dash out to your next exciting activity in NYC, this should fit the bill quite nicely!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Pluses: great customer service, clean room and public areas, wonderful bed, plenty of light, perfect shower. The reasonable rate included internet and a good breakfast buffet with many healthful options; the buffet was kept tidy and well stocked, and there was plenty of seating. Convenient location near Penn Station, Times Square, the High Line, etc. The downside: small room (though not unusually small for NYC) and very tiny bathroom, only one real chair. Overall, a very satisfactory choice. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Location: 8/10 Let's face it basically anywhere you stay in Manhattan is going to be in a decent location for attractions. You can pick up the subway at almost every street corner and there are taxis everywhere. This specific location 16 West 28th Street, New York City, NY 10001 is literally a five mini walk from Penn Plaza which is the home of Madison Square Garden. To put it mildly, it doesn't get much better then this, you are smack dab in the middle of the fashion district with Fashion Ave a block to the left. With this location comes some typical NYC cautions. After dark outside the street the hotel is on can be dark and uninviting from a security standpoint, however this is NYC. There are always people out walking around and there are tons of apartments in the area over looking the street, so it's not horrible. Take caution after concerts, games or entertainment functions occurring at the Garden, it can get very "festive" depending on the event being held.The Hotel Itself: 6/10 I am always a tough person to please, mostly because I stay at so many hotels every month. The hotel itself was built in late 2010 and opened in early 2011, so everything is new. The hotel was built during the big hotel boom occurring in lower NYC, which includes a competitive and equally sized Hilton Garden Inn adjacent to the Fairfield. The entrance to the hotel is nice, small but functional. Towards the back is the breakfast area along with the Internet Cafe machines. See my review below for words on the breakfast, etc.On to the room, I had the "City View" package which puts you in the front of the hotel for two weeks in a row. Killer view of the Empire State Building, the higher the room floor the better the view. No complaints with this, however it gets noisy. The front rooms have dual shades that includes a shade plus a noise canceling insulated shade on the outer side which does help substantially but not enough. If you need quiet ask for a room in the back of the hotel, if this doesn't work, bring some noise canceling headphones or even better stay in New Jersey.The showers are full glass with fake marble printed tiles and nicely designed sink area, albeit on a small and tight scale, this is NYC which is to be expected. No more then 2 midsized people in the bathroom at a time. The shower is actually quite large, almost half the size of the bathroom itself which begs to question the design choice. The toilet is always in the way with a tiny sink and huge shower. Not sure what the designers were thinking on that one, again, I am being very particular about this!I had two different rooms on each of my week stays at this hotel. The first hotel had a bathroom door that seemed to have been forgotten about during the assemble stage. You have be behind the toilet and angled in a certain position to close the door or it will whack you in the face, knees or legs. Better yet, we are talking about maybe an inch between the door closing and the toilet, make sure no one tries opening the door while you are doing your business or you going for a ride with a few choice words on the way down. A pocket door would have solved this completely, and there even seemed to be plenty of room for on in the wall. Be careful on the nightly runs to toilet too, it gets worse in the dark!The second stay I was on the opposite side of the hotel with a slightly different layout with a much more functional door and bathroom layout, but still had a huge shower with a rain shower head, nice, but still odd design choice and questionable functionality.The Staff/Checkin-Checkout Process: 5/10 The Achilles heal for this hotel is its front desk staff. It's not that they aren't helpful, they are too busy. At some points there was only one person working the counter for a hotel with 200 rooms in downtown Manhattan? Unacceptable. They need two people working at all times at the front desk, especially during the morning and afternoon hours when guests are checking in and out. The checkout process was fine for me each time, basically handing my key card to the person and walking out. This included stepping in front of a line of four people checking in. The need for a faster check in/out process can't be stressed more. Another issue is the elevators are directly in front of the front desk. This makes it challenging when people are lined up at the front desk, getting it of the elevator with luggage and maneuvering around people with their own luggage is not fun. On the other side of the coin, placing the elevator on the other side, exiting in the breakfast area poses another problem, a very narrow corridor to bring bags through to the front. So I guess this a typical design challenge when you have very little room to work with in NYC. You will always have an issue or problem somewhere design choices have to be made. It works, just not well!!Breakfast/Coffee/Internet Access 4/10 Yes that's a four! I was very disappointed in the breakfast layout at this hotel. I have stayed in many Fairfield Hotels and they usually do a great job with the continental breakfast. The problem with this location was specifically the layout! Items are all over the place in the breakfast room with what looks to be last minute shelving installed and questionable placement of every single item. Zero flow in this area, when I am up at 6AM and want a nice NYC bagel, it shouldn't take me 10 minutes to walk around the room to find a knife, then the cream cheese. If you want a coffee that's at another location in a small tiny corner, one person at a time in this area to get coffee, yes, I said one person. Wait until 8AM when ten people want coffee, failed design choice on this. The food was fine and typical Fairfield items served, nothing to knock your socks off and the coffee was drinkable "Cheap" Starbucks.Internet- Blatent FAIL. I actually reported this directly to Marriott corporate. If you have a hotel in the busiest city in the world, with the utmost best location, the LAST thing you skip on is the Internet access. Speed tests were horrible, 1.5MB/1MB up in the morning with hardly cracking dial up speeds in the evening. Come on Marriott, this is NYC you HAVE NO EXCUSE not to have the best or at least a corporate connection for the location. If you have work to do, take a walk down to Panera Bread a half block away, they have Fios 20/10 line that smokes. Final Words: 6/10 I am going to admit, I was especially hard on this review. I am sure many other long term customers may not find my issues nearly as bad. This was straight from a weekly traveler that has had fair share of nose dives in NYC. I think overall, even with a 6, this hotel is great. Why? It's location saves it from complete failure. No, not its location in terms of placement but because its IN NYC and many other hotels are just ten times worse unless you pay big bucks. With that said, the place is still new, and I really think with some corporate changes such as faster Internet, more personnel at the front desk (STOP PUTTING ME ON HOLD!!!), a redesign on the breakfast layout and finally, please, for the love of all will someone at Marriott corporate get rid of the Starbucks coffee?! Have you ever heard of Green Mountain??? Bottom Line: Nice hotel, couple issues that can be resolved by management or corporate. RFID key cards which are super cool. Great beds and clean rooms. Noisy in the front, as expected. Will stay here again and see if they improve with (one) persons honest review. Oh and get better coffee. Safe travels all.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I went off the reviews for this hotel from this site. I was very pleasantly pleased that the majority were spot on. This hotel was great. From the moment I arrived until I left there was excellent customer service. I received a call when I got to my room to check on things and the day before I left as well. I forgot to request a room with a view of the Empire State Building, but I got one (room 1406). I had also made a request with Marriott to have a refrigerator in my room and one was brought up within minutes of checking in. The breakfast was good as well (fruits, eggs, breakfast sandwiches, muffins/bagels, cereals, and drinks). They offer free internet and I didn't have any problems using my iPad with that. Everyone that said the bed was comfortable was right - I slept so well there. The room is average size (I would say for any city pretty much actually - not any smaller because it was NYC). If you want to buy any sodas - they are only $1.50 there in the machines on the lower floor - Duane Reade and Walgreens are both just over $2 each for the same size (Pepsi products - not a huge choice, but still). There are two different subway lines within walking distance (the N/R and the 1). I was coming back to my room anywhere from 10 p.m. to midnight just about every night and I felt relatively safe walking by myself - most nights there were a few others on the street as well - this was after taking the 1 line back on the subway. Just a few blocks away is Penn Station, Macy's, and Times Square. But if you prefer to stay away from Times Square (as I do except for the Broadway plays), this is an excellent place to stay. This hotel is actually in the Flower District and not in Chelsea, but Chelsea is not that far away at all. The sidewalks are crowded during the day because of the flower shops and the pedestrian traffic (just keep moving on the sidewalks so the locals don't get mad at you), but the noise from the deliveries never bothered me as did the traffic (horns, sirens, etc.). I don't know if their windows are triple paned as some of the other hotels I've stayed at are, but I can sleep through most anything. I've already recommended this hotel to a high school friend who is thinking of staying in the city next time instead of Long Island with family. I will definitely try to stay at this hotel again in the future if I can get the same AAA price I had this time (I booked early enough that my rate was only $151/night May 27-June 2 which was an excellent deal). Thank you Fairfield and Marriott!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Location - great, a few blocks from Penn station. Lobby - small, not much area to sit and meet with people. No bar.Breakfast - continental breakfast. Muffins, hard boiled eggs, cereal. COFFEE. Nothing Earth shattering, but very nice considering it was included.Room - Clean. Small - but that is standard in NYC. King bed room was fine for two guests. We did get a room with a view of the Empire State building - beautiful! Stayed in many hotels in this neighborhood, this is nicer than the Four Points and nicer than the Double Tree.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had some Marriott points stored up and was going to be in town for a vacation. I was able to book this hotel for free with my points. The lobby is clean the staff at the front desk was incredibly efficient and friendly. They also knew the area very well. The breakfast buffet in the morning was totally beyond expectations for free.... Hard boiled eggs, pastry, breakfast sandwiches, cereal, yogurt... A good mix of options and not the typical all starch no protein you see. The fitness center is small but I wasn't expecting much. The rooms as everyone says are small. I stayed on the 17 th floor and had a clean modern appointed room. The bathroom was also very small but it was totally adequate for my needs. The highlight was the awesome location- a block from the 1,2,3 line subway which takes you everywhere you are likely to want to go. I traveled with a female friend and we thought the neighborhood was safe enough for girls at night, but its the city... I wouldn't walk 20 blocks home at night in NYC regardless. Hint, there'd is some good sushi across the street inari sushi. Also the gelato place at the corner on 7th and 28th is amazing. I was very pleased

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our first trip to NY...we stayed 7 nights at The Fairfield b&b and had a great time.The breakfast was good and with lots of choice.The rooms were small for NY but spotless and had everything you needed - the shower was more like a wetroom - it was great.We didn't have much of a view from our room - we were on the 9th floor (I think it went up to around 18 floors) but I did request a high room when booking after reading these reviews.But we soon got used to it and after all you don't spend that much time in your room.The staff were all so polite and helpful, nothing was any trouble at all for them.Outside the hotel on the street is awash with flower shops, it's a lovely area.I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone who wanted to stay in NY.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I just returned from a business trip to NYC. I stayed at this Fairfield Inn & Suites and was pleasantly surprised! The hotel was in a great location - close to the Empire State Building and Penn Station, the red line subway was a block away, and like most of NYC, I had a Starbuck's and many good eating establishments within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel and my room were both clean and neat and the staff were extrememly friendly and helpful. The front desk staff assisted me with a city map and subway directions. My room was on the 15th floor with a great city view, WiFi, and with no loud city noise. My room was a little on the smaller side, but much better than most that I've experienced while staying in NYC. I would return to this hotel the next time I'm in the city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: There are few bells and whistles to this hotel and the rooms are small however, Mia and the rest of the front desk staff more than make up for it during your stay. Mia was very helpful, jovial and pleasant to deal with. The location was ideal for our needs and was within walking distance to dining. Also, if you need your nails done or a foot massage after a long day, walk up to 6th Ave. to Serenity Spa! Your feet will thank you.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I booked two rooms for a girls' getaway weekend. The rooms were on different floors and both had a decent view of the city. We did not have buildings within spitting distance of our rooms as others have mentioned. Yes, the rooms are smaller than what you'd get elsewhere, but this is NYC and that is to be expected. The hotel lobby and rooms are very modern, clean, and tastefully decorated. The staff at this property is outstanding - very friendly and helpful, no attitude. We felt very safe walking at night in that area. It was wonderful to see and smell all the flowers and flowering shrubs set out on the sidewalks as we approached the hotel. There is a subway station about a block away. We never heard any noise inside our room from the city, traffic, or elevators - I don't understand why others have griped about the elevator chiming. I suppose if your room was right next to the elevator, you could probably hear that but that's the case in every hotel. Breakfast was a nice surprise - I had expected it to be absolutely mobbed with people on a Sunday morning and it was quite the opposite. There were only a handful of people in the dining area, the food was plentiful and fresh, and the whole experience was actually very relaxing. You can even sit in the adjoining sunroom to enjoy breakfast. I would not hesistate to stay at this property again and would highly recommend it to others. The only improvement suggestion I would offer is to put more seating on the rooftop patio. There were only two or three plastic seats/tables up there, so we had to sit on the concrete patio to socialize. Thank you for a fabulous stay!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our first stay at this hotel and hope to have an excuse to come back. We had a room on the 17th Fl with a great view of the Empire State Bldg. Staff was extremely pleasant, welcoming and very competent at what they do. Our room was very nice, comfortable King, very clean. When booking the hotel I had mentioned that we were staying in the City to celebrate my husband's birthday. After arriving at the hotel, the front desk called our room to wish my husband a happy birthday and to see if he had gotten the little surprise that they had left. (balloons, Lindor truffles and complimentary water bottles). We were so impressed that the person who handled the reservation had conveyed to the hotel that we were coming to the City to celebrate my husband's birthday and that the staff took it upon themselves to make our stay extra special. Sometimes it's those little efforts that make such an impact. It certainly made our day and we look forward to coming back. Also, my husband is never thrilled with continental breakfasts as coffee and a muffin is not his idea of breakfast. He couldn't believe the selection (ready to heat egg mcmuffin sandwiches, hard boiled eggs, cereal, muffins, fresh fruit, bagels, yogurt, a selection of juices, etc) He said it was the best "continental breakfast" he has experienced.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this property. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 12th floor had a view of the Empire State Building. The room was larger than we expected and the shower was quite large and the water pressure was excellent. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed we've ever slept on in a hotel.The air conditioner was pretty noisy, but we didn't need to use it much. Breakfast was the usual fare and was fine. The room and hotel were both very clean and the location was great. We walked or took the subway or a bus with ease. We tried a few of the restaurants that the hotel recommends and had good experiences at all-Mustang Sallys and a pizza place-Ciao Bella Napoli. We also went to Uncle Nick's Greek restaurant and had a nice meal. It is only a few blocks away too.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We have returned to the Fairfield in the Flower District now for the third time in 6 months and enjoyed it even more this time. The staff is FANTASTIC and address your every need. We were in Room 1506 and had a perfect view of the Empire State Building which was awesome at night with all the lights. The breakfast is always well presented and adequate, just ask for something you may need and the attendant will find it for you. We use the computers/printer available in the dining area and of course there are the morning papers to read. We left our luggage for the day as we had a late bus home and they stored it willingly in a closet.We have already booked a night stay in June and would HIGHLY recommend this hotel not only because of the location but the staff.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed for a quick overnight trip into NYC and choose this property for its proximity to our Event. Everything was excellent...the check in was easy and professional...was upgraded to a higher floor room with a great view; I am assuming because of our Marriott Reward status. The room was extremely clean and comfortable and of an average size for Manhattan. The only problem was that when we picked up the car from the garage...the voucher given to us by the Hotel for the discounted rate was not accepted and we were forced to pay full price. It turns out that when we called the Hotel enroute into the City, we were directed to the wrong Garage. We contacted the General Manager via e-mail the next day and the situation was quickly resolved without any issue. I would defintely recommend this Hotel and will more than likely choose it again for my next overnight trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed in this hotel with my friend in summer. This location is pretty convenient as subway is near by, Lots of restaurant, shopping area and attractions arewithin walking distance. Simple breakfast is included also.They have nice patio area by the entrance and we werechilling at night chatting with cup cake from Magnolia bakery.But if you open the window in the room, the next building is just right in front of your eyes and you could almost jointheir yoga class...what can I say, this is New York!Overall, I don't mind coming back to this hotel again!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was our first time travelling to New York. I spent hours on Tripadvisor researching hotels. I am so happy we chose this one. Yes, the rooms are small, we travelled with our two teenage children and found it a little tight, but it was extremely clean and I always prefer a newer hotel. The location was perfect for us. You could easily walk north toTimes Square, Rockefeller Plaza and Central Park. We also walked south to Soho, Tribeca, Little Italy and Chinatown. If walking isn't your thing, the subway is about a 2 minute walk on the corner of 28th and 7th Ave. It was easy to take the subway north to Central Park and then down to Greenwich Village or further south to South Ferry.There are only 7 rooms on each floor, ours was at the back of the building which didn't have much of a view, however we didn't hear the chimes from the elevator which I believe the rooms on the front with the view of the Empire State building would listen to all night long. I am not sure why in a hotel this size with two elevators they need the chimes.This street is all flower shops so walking to and from the hotel every morning and evening was wonderful. The sidewalks are covered in beautiful flowers and shrubs and the scent was lovely.The breakfast was typical for a Fairfield Inn and there was no trouble finding something to please everyone. The staff was fantastic, especially Mia. She was extremely helpful and always had a cheerful hello. Each evening we would head up to the rooftop patio and enjoy the incredible view of the Empire State building. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: NYC is known for its tiny hotel rooms, and we have stayedin our share of them, but this was one of the smallest ever (Room 207). A very modern and pleasant hotel in a great location (28th St. in Chelsea close to a subway station), we found the staff to be mist helpful and the breakfast to have adequate choices. One aggravation, I admit from an easily distracted sleeper, was the elevator's chimes that were very loud and could be heard from our room att all hours.The beds are great, the bath was noce, but the closet is very small, and the room generally needed more lighting (like more sconces on the walls and near the bed), especially with everyone using these new bulbs that use no power but produce no light! . Too much room is consumed by a standard sized desk and swivel chair and there was no other furniture for seating- only the bed. I realize folks like king sized beds in hotels, but the most popular mattress size now is a queen and that would have allowed some much needed wiggle room in what was otherwise a very tight and poorly lit room. So, nice modern place, free breakfast, great staff, good location, and the smallness o fthe room will keep you out of there, whcih you will want to do in NYC anyway!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in a great location within walking distance to a lot of sights (and shopping.!). Stayed on the 15th floor in an executive king room which had plenty of room for 2 people and a nice view of the Empire State building. Some reviews stated there was no dresser for clothes but we had a large dresser and good size closet. Free breakfast and internet with Starbucks coffee available 24 hours a day. The rooms were really clean and the staff friendly.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Very helpful staff. Nice room. Only drawback is that parking is a block and a half up the street so you have to haul your luggage. Also, when traveling by car, be aware that there is a timed no turn on 6th which makes it a little difficult to circle back around to the hotel. However, once you get there it's a nice place in the middle of the district where they sell plants. Was neat to be around all those orchids! Near train, Madison Square Garden and other points of interest. Recommend staying there.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great staff and very nice property. The rooms are small, but not unexpectedly so. Right near Penn Station and Madison Square garden. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great hotel with very good service.Beds are just amazing,very clean and fresh rooms!Nice bathroom with big shower!Great storage for clothes and shoes etc!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Great location...clean rooms and good breakfast. Typical New York size rooms but overall great stay.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We took our 3 sons(14,12,8) to see the sights in NYC. After doing a little reseach we decided to stay in a 1 bedroom suite here at the Fairfield in NY in the flower district. The hotel was centrally located and walking distance to several sites- including the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden, and Macy's. We stayed on the 17th floor so there was no street noise and the room was just the right size for a family of 5 visiting the city. Our view was out the back of the hotel, but being on the 17th floor we were able to see downtown to the Freedom Tower. The front desk was very helpful and held our bags when we arrived before check in and arranged a SUV to take us back to the airport on our day out. The breakfast each morning was nice with a great sunroom with plenty of space for the family. There was also a viewing deck on the top floor with a great view of the Empire State building at night. The room was modern with nice furniture. We were not dissapointed and would recommend the suite for families that want to have a nice place to stay after long days in the city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is close to the Empire State Building, also walking distance to 5th ave.Whilst the room was not large, it was adequate.The room was very clean and the bathroom had a great shower.There is a continental breakfast bar on the lobby level where you can get juice,coffee,cerial muffins all very nicely presented with a nice room to sit and eat.Staff were very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Just a quick question about the hotel that hopefully someone should be able to answer for me. I have read in some of the reviews for this hotel that there is no safe provided in the rooms. Does this mean there is nowhere at all to store things safely? I like the look of the hotel and am looking to book but I don't feel very comfortable about leaving passports and cash in the room. Is there any safety deposit boxes located in the hotel?

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The Fairfield Inn is on a nice stretch of 28th Street between 6th & 7th, filled with flower shops. Every staff member we met was very nice and helpful. Our king size room wasn't huge, but not bad by NY standards. The nice surprise was our view of the Empire State Building. Doesn't matter how many times you see it, it's still pretty cool. The bed was extremely comfortable...I slept like a rock. The bathroom was spotless and the shower was a very comfortable size with good water pressure. I don't know when the hotel was renovated, but it couldn't have been that long ago. There's free Starbucks coffee 24/7 in the breakfast room. We were slow getting up on Sunday morning, so we missed out on the free continental breakfast which was a bummer. On 6th Ave there a McDonald's on the corner and a couple of deli's. On the west side of the Ave is a brick-oven pizza place called Waldy's which was excellent. This was a great hotel. I'm giving it a 5-star for value because we stayed under a special winter promotion that offered rooms for $119. I think the normally run about $250 and up, which still isn't bad for NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: we stayed one week in this hotel, and we don't regret this at all! The servise was incredible, we also receive cookies for the tea time... you have always the chance of drinking tea or Starbucks' coffee for free!! and the personal of the hotel is amazing, you feel like home!!
user_name:
Alina P
Heredia, Heredia, Costa Rica

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed 6 nights and loved it; quiet, friendly, clean with an elaborate breakfast continenentalwith staff going out of their way to ask if you need anything more before they close the buffet!The room was small with a very comfortable bed.The location is perfect with easy access to downtown and uptown.I will definitely return to this little gem with their wonderful service!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in a great location near the subway, near delis, near to Macy's, and walking out into the flower shops every morning is a delight in manhattan! The staff were super friendly and very helpful. The room was small but clean, comfortable bed and well appointed with a Starbucks coffee maker in the room. Oh and it was quiet except for one night where the neighboring room got locked out by his partner and he knocked and called the room for over an hour... He should have just rented another room! Anyway, they were gone the next day so it was all ok again. Very happy and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have just returned from a 5nt stay in the Fairfield Inn & Suites Manhattan Chelsea and cant rate it highly enough!The hotel is very small and friendly in comparison to other large hotels in the City! The hotel is very clean, modern and quiet. It is classed as part of the flower district and upon arrival you can see why!We had a slight problem upon check in with the room type booked-it was my sisters 30th birthday, however the manager sorted this out for us quickly, efficiently and without a problem. The room was fairly small but was clean and we were more than happy with it! Breakfast was complimentary and was plentiful with a selection of bagels, muffins, cereals, eggs, yoghurts, fresh fruit etc. Starbucks coffee and an array of teas and hot chocolate was available all day every day!The hotel was 5/6 blocks up from Macys (they say 1 block is approx 1 min walk so not far at all) and was also very close to the Empire State Building and Times Square. The hotels location was so good in fact you could pretty much walk anywhere! We even walked from the American History Museum down by Central Park back to the hotel one day-it took a few stops on the way but was certainly do-able!The staff were amazing, extremely helpful and knowledgable! In fact the only negative I could rate from my whole stay was the fact that there were no safety deposit boxes available-they were all being used so could prob benefit from a few more of these for guests ease of mind!Overall a perfect stay, Id definitely recommend it to anyone and I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again-thank you!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Our room was small, like most NYC rooms under $200, but apart from that, I couldn't find fault with anything at all. Very nice, professional staff, and a exceedingly well appointed room for the price point, like a Mini Copper...small but nice inside. The breakfast is simple, but has a good enough mix, and free internet. And since the most important thing in NYC is location, this hotel is smack in the middle of it all, subways and buses all around you.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Fairfield Inn. The location was great as there was a subway station at the end of the block and another 2.5 blocks in the other direction. Our room was not large but was clean & modern. More importantly it was quiet and the bed was comfortable. Our room was in the back and faced a yoga studio. However we were only there to shower, sleep & change so it was not a big deal as we just kept the shade drawn.The breakfast was adequate with fruit, coffee, muffins, cereal, & yogurt. My only complaint with our stay is that when we came back to the hotel in the late afternoon (3-3:30) our room had not been made up yet. The maid came while we were there but did agree to come back after we'd left. It was not a super big deal but I did find it a minor annoyance. Other than that I would given it 5 stars for my stay and I would still stay here again (though I would discuss the maid deal first). FYI the lamb gyro from the cart by the red subway entrance was really good.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Having searched the net for a small hotel in a good location I was not disapointed with my choice. This hotel is clean, modern and most importantly is in a fabulous location to see the sights. Having taken my husband to NY for his 40th birthday I had found it hard to choose from the hundreds of hotels advertised. This hotel is situated a short walk from Macy's, The Empire State Building and Time Square. Ground Zero is a longer walk to the south.The hotel provides a continental breakfast and complimentary tea & coffee all day.The room was clean and modern. We had a back room on 15th floor, despite looking onto an adjoining building and having no view it provided peaceful nights sleep. The staff were polite, friendly & helpful. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to friends in the UK.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Only good things to say about this 19-story hotel located on a street surrounded by florists. The floral scents coming from the stores are a refreshing "welcome home" after a long day in the city.This chain feels more like a boutique hotel. Friendly, helpful front desk. Our King Size bed room was clean, comfortable and had a fabulous view of Empire State.The Chelsea location is perfect for an easy 10-15 minute walk uptown to Times Sq. or downtown to the Village. Or west to Highline, an old, elevated railway that has been turned into a delightful walk through the city, above the hustle and bustle.Throw in free WiFi and breakfast, and this place is a keeper.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Me and my wife spent three nights here in February of 2012. The location is fantastic - three 28th Street subway stations are close. Penn station is not even a 10 minute walk. The area is pleasant to explore - and all of NYC is accessible from here.We were greeted by extremely friendly staff, check-in was super-fast. We got a complementary travel adapter. There is free Wi-Fi in the entire hotel.The room was really, really good. It was comfortably sized by any standards, and what I would consider more than large by NYC standards. Bed super-comfortable, sufficient storage space, nice bathroom, good shower, large TV. The only thing we missed was an in-room safe.Breakfast is fine - especially since it is complimentary. I would definitely come again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean and friendly hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Well, our initial impression was seen through the 'red-eye' lenses and we were exhausted. We arrived at around 9 am to find our room had been sold (the night before), so there was nothing ready for us (and our sleeping 4 year old). The front desk receptionist, Danny, invited us to enjoy their breakfast and kick back in the solarium - which we did. They had a room cleaned and ready to go about an hour later - and it was magnificent! Certainly worth waiting for - with amazing views of the Empire State Building (I had no idea it changed light colors regularly, (to the delight of our daughter) - so far its been blue and green, and tonight it is purple and yellow). The caliber of service is beyond expectations - more on the lines of the Ritz Carlton sort of experience, if they were to do a mid range property. "Yes Sir, No Ma'am and it's MY pleasure" are common starters. They really DO care if you are enjoying your experience with them - which suggests they have a good management team allowing them to focus on the client/customer and not their bottom line, (which increases due to their amazing service - and it gets better!).Back to our room. First thing that comes to mind is 'CLEAN'. We had a king size bedroom for myself, husband and our daughter - that was so comfortable even our 4 year old had a hard time pushing the ceiling off her to get going in the morning! The walk in shower has excellent pressure and HOT water! The entire space is well appointed, and modern in the amenity department. But the bed. Seriously nice. Linens and mattress. Flat screen tele with a variety of stations (not sure what is 'in' these days as we do not have cable at home) and a good size closet. Starbucks coffee is served in room (blech), but it is better than whatever cheapy stuff is the norm at this rate. There's a desk with a comfortable chair for working (my husband agreed) and plenty of light. The continental breakfast is just right, (if you were only here for a day or two), hard boiled eggs, refrigerator pancakes, Jimmy Dean biscuits with meat of some sort for the microwave, juice from the tap, bagels or English muffins, Starbucks coffee or a variety of hot teas, milk, yoghurt and bananas and a variety of cereals. Loads of things for all palettes. We like it here and we have particular tastes and the Fairfield Inn and Suites lives up to and beyond the expectation in this price point. Perfect for kids too!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My husband and I live in long island but like to take weekend visits to NYC. We have stayed at a bunch of hotels giving us a good perspective of what works and what doesn't. Overall we would recommend this hotel.Pros:1. Located at 28th and 6th. Easy access to subways, walking distance to Chelsea and west village area and restaurants. Being on the west side is easy to get around. 2. Clean. Room is clean, good views, not loud, has the amenities we needed. Asked for a fridge and even though the actual person who brought it up was grumpy it wasn't a big deal.3. Breakfast. Even though it's NYC and food is abundant it's nice to start out with some fruit, coffee, cereal before heading out. Plus you can get free Starbucks coffee, tea, or hot cocoa any time of day. 4. Parking. There is a lot rate during the week of $25 per day which is good for NYC and you can easily find free street parking in this area for the weekend.5. Staff. Friendly, helpful and gave us free bottled water as needed. Cons:1. Room size. Having stayed at Bryant park hotel and millennium Hilton those rooms and bathrooms are bigger. This time the rate here was cheaper and that's why we switched. For two people it's fine although the bathroom is super small and nowhere to really put your stuff. We had a small baby so with the crib, stroller, etc it was cramped. We even upgraded to larger room and it wasn't much bigger than standard and I'm not sure worth the $30 extra per night. Finally the hair dryer was terrible, just as a side note.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for business the week of February 6th and I will stay here again. It is a small hotel (narrow - only some 3 room widths wide and maybe 90 rooms total)but new - built in 2010. The rooms are small but the furniture, decor and fixtures are all very clean and modern in style. Tiny lobby with a light breakfast included in the price, this is an excellent way to stay in NYC at a resonable price - $190/night. Located in the flower section of the Chelsea district, the sidewalks were covered daily (at least weekdays) with a wide assortment of plants, shrubs and flowers - very pretty and really neat to walk through. I usually ask for a high floor but received a room on the second floor. I had concerns about street noise with delivery trucks early but did not have any noise issues. Location to many attractions is excellent as well. Times Square, Central Park, Empire State Building, 5th ave shopping are all an easy walk from here. If you stay, try Shake Shack Burgers (killer burgers!)in Madison Square Park (3 blocks) or Eataly on 24th street for indoor Italian deli and dining experience!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Wow - I don't understand why NYC holds the title of rudest city, because our group did not experience that, especially in our haven the Fairfield Inn. From the rooms, breakfast, roof top patio to the entire staff, we could not have been treated better. The warm greeting's every time you passed through the lobby and engaging conversation, great recommendations, handling of reasonable/reliable transportation the staff over a 4 day period was the cream of crop. The staff always had a smile and they made you feel good, they bent over backwards to handle the smallest requests. I will definitely share this treasure with all who travel to NYC. Thank you Fairfield Inn you made my 50th even better

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I've been to NYC several times and stayed in many different areas. This hotel was EXCELLENT!!! The staff was fabulous....attentive, helpful and friendly. I would like to make special mention of Andre (Mgr.) and Michael who were outstanding!!! These folks could not have been more accomodating! I want to spread the word, but don't want to many people to find out about this gem of a hotel. I can't say enough good things about this property....from location, cleanliness, staff, breakfast, etc...everything was top-notch! I'll be back!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed there in Dec, before Christmas. We felt shocked when entering to the room, it's just soooo small. We would not pay more than $150 for this small room in the future even though it's in NY, would rather pay more to stay in other hotels. It's not far from Time Squares and is close to Empire State Building, thus it's a plus. The staffs are friendly enough however not so honest. They asked us if we needed car to the airport in the early morning and we said yes. In the morning, a nice and clean Lincoln car was waiting for us. Asking for the price, it was $70 compared to FLAT $45 if using yellow taxi cab. It would be nice if the staffs let us know ahead of time. We felt like the staffs and the taxi driver were robbing us. Have been using only Marriott hotels for more than 10 years, we were dissapointed that Marriott employees in this hotel did not reach the standards set by Marriott corporation.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here last weekend and had an enjoyable stay. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was lovely, clean, modern and nicely decorated. Both the room and bathroom are smallish , but not really a problem, everything fit well. Our bed was very comfortable . Breakfast( which was included in the price) had many choices from cold to hot cerals, fruits, breads ,yogurts, hard boiled eggs etc. and coffee , teas, milk etc. the location of the hotel was great and for the price was a value. we will be returning here next month.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Good hotel that is in a great location. Both room (very comfy bed) and breakfast were good. Free wifi and tea/coffee were an added bonus. Reception staff very helpful. Times Square is a 15 min walk away.If anything could be improved it would be housekeeping as they always seemed to never quite get it right eg 3 separate issues from a 5 night stay.....1) Service your room but then forget to empty your bin/trash2) Service your rooom but then leave a bag of all the other rooms dirty laundry in your room3) Regularly service your room late afternoon at around 4 pm (or not at all) which is not what you want when you return to your room for a brief rest after 6 or 7 hours of sightseeing!!!Re New York.....1) For a fast food burger avoid those well known chain fast food restaurants and visit Shack Shack for a burger and shake2) Visit the various Crumbs Bake shops scattered around the city for a cookie or cupcake....delicious3) Personally, don't bother going up the Empire State building, instead go up the Rockefeller centre then your photos of the skyline can include the empire state building!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed three nights at this hotel in early January. The room was typical of New York (on the small side), but was clean and well appointed. There was a good breakfast included every morning with plenty of choices to start your day, and internet was free also. There's a small exercise room on the bottom floor with a few pieces of cardio equipment and a selection of hand weights. My only complaint is that my room (5th floor, on the back side), looked directly into the windows of a yoga studio in the opposite building, so quite often during the day when I put up the window shade there would be a dozen or so sweaty yoga students looking back at me. But the room was clean, quiet, and very close to subway stations and a good selection of inexpensive restaurants, so I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a lovely hotel. Remodelled suites are not huge, but very clean and contemporary. Walk in shower and bathroom are very nice. The staff are friendly and accommodating. It is right in the middle of the flower district which makes for a nice walk to one of the may restaurants and facilities that are close. We will definitely stay here again when visiting the city.
user_name:
Ruth Ann L
Casa Grande, Arizona

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My boyfriend came to visit me for a weekend in January and wanted to catch a Broadway show in New York before returning back to school. In looking for the right hotel, our top concerns were location, cleanliness and price-to-value. We chose Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriot in Chelsea because of all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and the reputation of the Marriot brand. As a native New Yorker, I knew when booking the hotel that $200/night was inexpensive by Manhattan standards and was looking forward to our stay. On January 15th, we arrived a couple hours before the afternoon check-in time. Although we had informed the hotel of an early check-in during reservation, we didn’t expect to get a room until the afternoon and was looking to drop off our luggage before exploring NYC. However, unlike the warm and friendly welcome other customers raved about online, the lady working the front desk was a bit rude and condescending.
