She did not acknowledge I was standing there until after a 5-minute conversation with another employee about her night and when she finally did address me, I was told to wait since no rooms were available. I asked to store our luggage in the meantime and she told the concierge to bring our suitcases to the backroom, which we found out later was an outdoor breakfast area where guests can go in and out. For a hotel that can demand rates up to $400/night, which is roughly in the same price range as some of the nicer boutique hotels, there should be a delegated storage area to ensure belongings are secure. The hotel itself is new, modern and nicely decorated. In terms of the room, it was decently sized and very clean. Sheets were crisp and the king size bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom, however, was not designed for ease-of-use as you will find yourself struggling to close the door without hitting against the toilet. My boyfriend and I have been to several Marriot locations both in the United States and in Europe and this bathroom was definitely the smallest one. Also, when we booked several months ago, we requested a high floor since we heard lower floors experience loud traffic noise and a less beautiful view of the city. I was disappointed to have been given a low floor room but we were still able to see the Empire State Building from our window. The central location of the hotel was a definite plus as we were able to walk four blocks to the nearest N/R metro station and some tourist attractions, such as the largest Macy’s and Koreatown. The complimentary breakfast and WiFi were also great additions to the hotel package. I think if the hotel focuses more on customer service from the moment you walk into the hotel and have a better/safer process of storing luggage for guests, it has the potential to be a great bang for your buck.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My friend and I recently returned from a stay here and it was very good. We had a king room which was small (we called it "cubicle, sweet cubicle") but very clean and SUPER comfy bed. The bathroom was spacious and well equipped with shampoo, conditioner, soap, plenty of good quality towels and even extra lotion when we asked for it. Even though we were close to the elevator, we heard no hall or elevator noise at all. The staff were pleasant and helpful, and the complimentary breakfast was delicious and complete. We got complimentary hot tea and coffee all day long, which was nice, since it was super cold outside. The location was in the flower district, and a short walk from the N and R trains. I would definitely recommend this place, and would plan to stay there again next trip.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have now stayed at this hotel twice over the past 6 months. It does what it says on the tin: good business hotel, new-ish, very clean rooms, anmazing view of the Empire State Building if you ask nicely, free wifi and free basic breakast. Good customer service, great location.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Got a great deal on Travelzoo for $150 including tax, and just $25 to park. Having gotten a similar deal last month at the Four Points Sheraton in the same area I was expecting basically a clean place to sleep for an overnight getaway. We were pleasantly surprised at the difference on multiple levels. A friendly greeting from the front desk staff (genuine), and being greeted as we came and went. A very spacious room for NYC, bright and airy, with a newer sleek design. Maximum use of space in this "pencil style" building! The shower was large, water pressure excellent. I would definitely stay here again, and would stay mutliple nights (generally when I get the 'deal', it I sacrifice a bit in the room to visit the city), but I would definitely stay mutliple nights at the Fairfield. We didn't eat breakfast so can't comment on that. Our room faced the street on the 4th floor, view of the ESB, but we didn't hear any street noise that others have commented on. Stayed on a Saturday so perhaps there were no flower deliveries Sunday AM. Very quiet all around and comfortable. Well done.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I spent a week at this hotel with my wife while on business/pleasure trip. The staff at this hotel was wonderful. They were friendly and always available and helpful. The rooms were clean and the price was right. This hotel is located in a great part of the city as it is in the center of Manhattan with a view of the Empire State Building from our room. We plan to go back in the spring!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: A very nice hotel in a great location, pretty big rooms by NYC standards, free (though sort of weak) wifi, free breakfast and all-day coffee and tea in lobby (as well as in rooms). Staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, so this is a pretty good deal in a great location--the breakfast was really convenient and while not full-service had good variety and was fairly substantial--better than just continental, and in a nice glass-enclosed room. The hotel room itself was also decent sized, very clean, and an incredibly comfortable bed. Recommended.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a very good property on 28th between 6th and 7th in the Floral District. A dark little street but also home to a Hilton across the street. Easy to access the subway on the corners and walk up to 34th to get the crosstown bus to the Javits.The rooms were small as expected but the bed was great with the flat screen on the wall. The breakfast was free and was a perfect start to an active day. Good coffee and a great selection of healthy items. Free wifi in the rooms and two computers downstairs.The only downside was the noisy air conditioner under the window, but this was January and we only turned it on to cool down the room a little bit for the mild days we were there.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here from Janurary 4th-7th. We requested early check in and were able to get in our room early! Had a great view of the Empire State Building from the 5th floor which was a nice surprise. This hotel has great staff. Check in was pleasant and we even got a message on the phone in the middle of our stay from the staff asking if our stay was going well which was a nice touch. Breakfast was good for a complimentary and was always being restocked. The woman working there would also come around and make sure you had everything before the breakfast stuff was cleaned up for the day which I thought was kind. Having Starbucks coffee in the breakfast room was pretty much the best thing ever. Rooms were also great; clean, comfy beds and seemed to be a decent size for NYC. The only thing not so great about the room was the heating unit which could be a bit loud at time, although not for long. Hotel location was pretty good too. You could walk to Penn Station in about 10 minutes or catch the subway just down the block.Overall a great choice!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: From start to finish, a great stay. The front desk staffers were friendly and helpful, the room was spotless, large, new, and quiet, and the breakfast was plentiful and excellent.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Reasonable price if you're lucky. Our rates dropped a lot for one of the nights, though there are lots of taxes, tourist fees etc. in NYC.As has been said, tall skinny hotel in a decent location, in the flower district. That does mean it's noisy early in the morning when all the deliveries arrive; back of hotel might be quieter, but view from the front is quite nice. Lots of very good restaurants nearby and while a little out of the very busy area, walkable to many places. If you don't like to walk, there are two subway stops close by.Friendly staff, very helpful at the front desk. We were a group and the staff person at check-in made sure we had rooms all next to each other. Nice rooms, decent sized for such a big city. Bathroom a little small, but no big deal. Breakfast was very handy, especially when you're a group. Nice coffee, Starbucks. A little disappointed that everything was disposable - plastic everything, and everything like yogurt and fruit in it's own containers. Breakfast food ok, nothing great (everything in containers), but better than some places with stale muffins etc. The staff were attentive at clearing tables quickly and refilling the coffee.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My friend and I recently went to explore NY. I decided on this hotel because it had good reviews. I was not disappointed. Our room had a wonderful view facing the Empire State building. It was also very clean in the room and throughout the hotel. What made the stay exceptional was the staff. My friend and I arrived at the hotel around 8 am and the friendly woman at the counter quickly checked to see if any rooms were available for us, even though check in wasn't until much later. With a smile and enthusiasm she informed us they had a room available for us and she even called us after we got settled in to make sure we were happy with it. The staff also was very accommodating wen we asked if we could leave our luggage with them for the day after we checked out and they kindly allowed us to hang out in the "rec" area before we caught our bus back home. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Seven women including four aged 16 to 22 staying in 2 very small NYC hotel rooms could have been a recipe for disaster but what a wonderful stay we had thanks to Danny, Andre and the staff of this hidden gem. We were unable to reserve two double bed rooms but upon check-in we were upgraded to a two room, two bath suite that saved us probably hours getting ready for full days of touring the city. The girls had plenty of room to spread out and stay up very late while the three mothers were able to get peace and quiet on a lower floor. The rooms were on the backside of the building so we did not have the view but it was well worth it to have the extra space that we needed. The rooms were super clean. The breakfast was simple but was kept well stocked and had plenty of variety for everyone. Starbuck's coffee at the breakfast and in the rooms was a plus. Even though our first night there we all got rain-drenched while touring uptown, we were able to order pizza and wine from a local pizza shop who delivered right to our suite at a very reasonable price. The location of the hotel was perfect as we were able to divide our tour into uptown one day and downtown the next. After shopping downtown we were able to drop our purchases at the hotel before going back out for a nighttime times square experience which was only a few blocks away. Having never driven into the city, we were surprised that we found both the hotel and a nearby parking garage ($25 per day with hotel stamp) very easily after exiting the Lincoln Tunnel. Even the garage attendants were very nice. In fact almost everyone we encountered in the city was more than willing to talk or help us out if we needed directions. Great girl trip.
user_name:
Kim W
Clarence Center, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I have never had such a trouble free experience. The service was incredible, everyone was super nice and extremely hospitable. The concierge went out of his way on several occasions to ensure we were well taken care of, and all of our needs were met. The room was immaculate and the complimentary breakfast was ample and delicious. The location was also very convenient.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Marriott property is in the Flower District and if you don't need to stay in mid-town it's perfect. It's a Marriott so you know what to expect, the rooms are small but to be expected in NY. The hotel is new, the lobby and rooms are very clean I have never had an issue getting a taxi any time of the day at this location which is nice and convienient. The free breakfast is on par with what you would expect. At times this property can be over priced, one week it was $429 a night and another $129 varies based on what is happening in the city. My only recommendation is ask for a high floor. They start delivering flowers at 4 AM and it gets very loud and you hear all of it on the lower floors.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is much more like a boutique hotel. Small and intimate. Staff like you find at the finest hotels. The only oddity, for as lovely a room, plastic cups. We asked for glass and they did provide us with some. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Fairfield carries on the Marriott tradition of excellent service and a delightful location. We arrived by bus early in the morning and walked down 28th street to the hotel only to find store after store of fresh flowers, plants and Christmas pines. It smelled wonderful and a great introduction to our pre Christmas get away. We were at the hotel by 9:20 a.m.and were able to get our room and were invited to have complimentary breakfast. The lady that checked us in was most accommodating, recognized our Marriott status, and handed us our keys within minutes. We relaxed in the room for a few minutes then headed up 6th Avenue - Avenue of the Americas. The first few blocks had many handbag stores ladies and I was able to buy several nice bags for $20. On up to the bigger shops with our destination of Radio City Music Hall Christmas Spectacular, DON"T miss this if you have the opportunity.Our room was on the sixth floor and happened to be the handicapped room, although we are not disabled. We were told it was this type room which we did not mind. The only difference was the "roll in shower". We had a king bed which definitely filled the room but was very comfortable and we slept well. Not much traffic noise for NYC.The breakfast buffet was well presented and the assistant working the area was exceptional, everything was kept clean and replenished. There were two computers, a printer and newspapers available for all. There was a nice open "greenhouse" type room to eat which was all glass to see the sky (and a few building backs).We did not have to check out until noon and had a wonderful experience in NYC.There was a subway stop at the end of the street by 7th but we did not use it.We already have reservations to return in February.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First time at a fairfield inn.What a great hotel. I have stayed in 5 star world class luxury hotels all over the world and the service at this fairfield inn was equal to or superior to those! Perfect location in the flower district close to union square and the village area. The rooms are small but then again so are most NYC rooms. Rooms are very clean front staff could not have been more accommodating. My only "complaint" would be a softer bed. I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We were in NY for our 20th Wedding Anniversary and stayed in this brilliant hotel for 4 nights in November 2011. We were upgraded to a city view room, which was bigger, and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Erica, at reception, helped my hubby organise flowers, which, Carl delivered to the room as a surprise. Breakfast was more than adequate with a good choice of cereals, fruit, breads and pancakes. There was also a selection of hot foods..and cakes! All were delicious. Coffee and a selection of teas and hot chocolate were available all day. The hotel provided free internet access and printing facilities, and there is free WiFi available. The hotel is perfectly situated with subways at either end of the street, usually we walked as it is only about 15mins to Time's Square! We thought the area was very safe, even at night, and had no problem walking back to the hotel in the dark! The staff were amazing, very helpful, very courteous..always welcoming you back and taking the time to talk. The manager's evening, was lovely..wine and nibbles and a chance for a chat. Many thanks to the team that we met, Erica, Carl, Danny and Andre, for making our Anniversary a very special time. And big hug to Carl! Danny and Lynda M from Derry, Ireland.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is ideally situated in midtown NYC so commuting to the various places of interest is very convenient. There's a subway station up the road at the corner of 7th St. 34th street, where the main Macy's store is located, is a short walk away. Being in NY's flower district adds to the charm of this hotel since it's flanked by flower shops on both sides.My husband and I arrived before 12 noon and our room was ready. We stayed in room 1702 and were delighted that it had an excellent view of the Empire State Building. I would think that the other even-numbered rooms would also have a similar view. The bed is king sized and very comfortable. There are 2 flavors of Starbucks coffee grounds for the room's coffee maker. I also like that they provide Pantene shampoo and conditioner as part of the amenities. My only complaint is that the space between the bathroom door and the shower is too small such that the bath mat snags under the door.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I first stayed here for 4 or 5 nights in Jan, 2010 (right after the hotel first opened), and then again for 3 nights in November, 2011, and both stays were fabulous. At the end of my first visit, I mentioned to the manager that the room was a bit dark due to the energy efficient lighting. I was very pleased to see that the lights have been changed and the new lightning was perfect. The rooms are very modern with free (and very fast) internet and very nice shower. The rooms are very small - but that is the way things are in New York and its only an issue if you spend all day in your room - which you should not be doing in NYC! The Location can't be beat. I walked to Broadway, and Times Square, and subway is very conveniently located. The staff is great and very helpful. The gym has modern treadmills and ellipticals and each have their own TV. My only complaints are that the hotel does not have a pool (though it seems most hotels in New York don't have pools) and that there is no guest laundry facilities. I will be staying here again!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a lovely little hotel on 28th street in amongst the flower shops of New York City. We had a very nice king bedroom with a view of the street, stall shower, no tub which is nice. There is not a lot of extra space in the room but it was comfortable and the bed comfy. The hotel is an easy walk from Penn Station. The hotel staff were very helpful and patient with people -- there were lots of questions being asked of the staff. If you want to be in the hub bub of New York then this hotel is not for you, but if you want to steps away from it then this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Our family stayed at the Fairfield based on Rewards membership and its close location to Penn station. We found it also convieniently close to subway line and many family-friendly restaurants. Although the rooms are smallish (welcome to NYC) the main difference was the staff. Without asking the staff went out of their way to help us and accomodate our "tweens" who were just beginning to behave as adults. A view of Empire State building from the room and terrace was really nice. Hotel was very clean and well stocked. Breakfast / lounge area is bright and cheerful. Coffee / tea / hot chocolate was always available as were other munchies from time to time. Staff was will to provide advice for dinners, shopping and sights. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The location of the hotel is great, but it's the smallest room I've ever paid money for. Horrible size, you have no space for luggage, you cannot move around at all in the room and I am a small person. There is no counter space in the bathroom to place toiletries. The breakfast in the morning was nice, but I spent more time out of my room due to the lack of space in the room. Also, the view was horrible. I love Marriott Hotels, but I won't stay at a Fairfield Inn again. I prefer to pay a little more, for more space. The room isn't functional at all.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was a 3 star and should have been a 2 star. It was $499 a night....but I thought I could spend the extra money since I would earn Marriott Points. Don't do it! There are so many four star hotels in the same area ....closer to Madison Avenue and 5th Avenue...that are not as expensive. The rooms and bathroom are smaller than a typical "small NYC hotel room" and the air conditioning unit blew cold, dusty air on my face throughout the evening. Needless to say, I had a cold the next week and oh yes, the new scarf I left in the room "was not found by housekeeping."

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel was average/below average. I would never stay here for vacation purposes and probably not again for business purposes. There is no restaurant in this hotel so I recommend staying at the hilton or indigo hotel directly across the street. The rooms are very small, but neat/clean/modern. The staff are average if not below average. When calling the front desk for assistance with the internet connection, I received very rude attempt to answer my question from one of the ladies working at the front desk. I would not recommend unless you literally need a place to sleep while on business travel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First time in New York and one word fantastic This hotel as everyting for a great stay staff fantastic and so helpful bed the most comfortable hotel bed and we have stayed in hundreds of hotels breakfast good and tea and coffee 24hrs is another perk ideal position to walk to a lot of sites we traveled on all public transport walked at night never so any trouble and felt safe ,We will certainly use this hotel when we go back to ny we had 8 days there but still had things we needed to do , Just a big thank you to everyone at the fairfieldJeff and Dot Wood

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stop by NYC last summer for a 2 nights family escapade. My 2 girls, 5 & 7 years old loves exploring Manhattan every summer. Walking in midtown, 5th avenue, Rockefeller Plaza, St Patrick Cathedral, Lego Store, American Girl store, and Pokemon Center. So many things to do in this modern and busy city. We stayed in Fairfield Inn Marriot Chelsea area. Our family loves staying in Marriot Hotel because of it's reputation, and cleanliness. The room is small but modern. There's a parking garage just 3-4 doors away and much cheaper and convenient compared to midtown area. Lots of authentic restaurants nearby and lots of wholesalers where you can shop for purses, eyeshades, etc. You can walk to Macy's and there's a Lotte Korean Rest in 32nd or 34th St w/ lots of Korean and other Asian restaurants. You have to come early if you plan to eat dinner because it gets busy at dinner time. Lots of waiting in line. This hotel has free breakfast so you don't have to worry what and where to get your hot and yummy breakfast. There's also McDonald at the corner.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Amazing room in the flower district. Streets lined with flower vendors. 14th floor with view of a very stubby empire state building. Visited 350 art galleries nearby in one day. We didn't meet a person we did not like. Andrew at the desk was helpful with things to do in the neighborhood. We walked everywhere and felt safer than I do in Dayton, Ohio. I admire the concept of a "pencil hotel". Uncrowded and a trip on the elevator was speedy.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here because of it's location. We were attending a race that was close by. We frequent NYC. (a little tricky parking to check in) We arrived early and our room was not ready. They offered a different room at no extra cost. The room was perfect! The breakfast was included and offered healthy choices. Parking is always an issue in NYC...expensive. This hotel has an arrangement with a garage down the street $25! Quite the bargain for NYC. This is not a luxury hotel but being in NY I would rather save the money and enjoy a gourmet dinner and a show! We were able to walk to the Home a restaurant which we have been wanting to try. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was on business trip and stayed 2 nights. Location is average since noisy at night as well as early morning because it is in wholesale flower district. Polite !! New York City delivery truck drivers make noise to keep away from sleeping late at night. In morning tons of flower/plant buyers. Staff was courteous and trying to be helpful. Average sized rooms, smaller newly remodelled bathrooms. but nosiy and rattling AC, thin glass to isolate street sounds. Price was very high just because it is in NYC.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel, although not the most inexpensive, still gives you value. It is in Chelsea and 1 block from 2 different subway lines. If you have a car they have a special rate with the garage on the next block: $25 for 25 hours. That rate is hard to beat in NYC. Everyone here is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included in the rate. They have a nice assortment of items including bagels, english muffins, pancakes, yogurt, cereals, etc. Also some delicious pastries. Juice and coffee of course. The breakfast bar is well supervised so it is stocked and clean. The rooms are NYC small but very adequate in size. Very clean with nice bathrooms. Also, the bathrooms are NYC small. The shower is large, however. The beds are very, very comfortable. In the lobby is a nice touch. There is a water cooler with orange flavored water. Great for when returning after a warm NY day. As a bonus the hotel is located in the middle of a fresh flower market. Highly recommend this Marriott hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed here over labor day weekend. The room (1 king size bed) was a good size for NYC and everything was clean and modern-looking. The only knock about the room was that the air conditioner was loud and rattled at times (woke us up a few times when it turned on). The elevator was fast, uncrowded. Breakfast was free and pretty good (microwavable jimmy dean breakfast sandwiches were delish). Concierge and security people were nice. The neighborhood around the hotel seemed safe.It was a long walk to Times Square, probably about 25 min. Short walk (about 5 min) to subway station. I would stay here again if they fix that air conditioning noise.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: First, I'd like to start by saying this hotel did more than just meet my expectations, it actually exceeded them. I stay at Marriott brand hotels many times a year but rarely have had opportunities to stay at a Fairfield. This one, in my opinion, was very impressive for such an affordable hotel. It is located on 28th, between 6th & 7th, in the Flower District (NOT in Chelsea but it is a quick train ride!). I arrived hours before check in and they already had a room ready which was unexpected so I was immediately pleased. The room was very clean and comfortable. I have been going to NYC a couple of times a year for many years so I have stayed in several other hotels in town. In my opinion, this room is a pretty decent size for rooms in this city. This area is very quiet at night so I had no problems with a lot of noise when I was trying to sleep. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've slept in. The bathroom is very nice and has a huge, walk-in shower, with great water pressure. The AC works GREAT. There is no fridge in the room and no safe. The lack of safe is actually a bit disappointing. I've become accustomed to having a safe in all NYC hotel rooms that I've stayed in. Also, there is only one ice-maker in the building and it's located on the lower level which is a bit of an inconvenience but luckily the elevators are quick so you don't have to wait too long to get down there and back.  I loved the location. It's really convenient to so many of the city's attractions. It's just blocks from the Empire State Building/Harold Square, which is probably the best shopping located in this area. It's equally close to the Flatiron District, Madison Square Park, Madison Square Gardens, Penn Station, etc. If you make it to the Flatiron District, be sure to check out Eataly, Mario Batali's Italian mega-store. It's amazing. There is also a Whole Foods a few blocks away along with several other little markets if you're looking for the basics. There is a Starbucks and Bank of America, both located at the corner of 28th & 6th. This hotel is located a block from the red line (i.e 1-2-3 train) subway. This train will take you to or close to, just about anywhere in the city you'd like to go. By far, the best kept secret of this hotel is the roof deck. It has an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Be sure to check it out at night. It is open 24 hours a day and there was rarely anyone up there so I usually had it to myself. It's nothing fancy but definitely a nice spot to chill out and enjoy a great view of the city. They also provide a complimentary breakfast, every morning, and it has pretty good offerings. Muffins, bagels, cereals, breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, etc. They also serve Starbucks brand coffee. I would also like to mention that the customer service was outstanding. One night, I needed three things; scissors, super glue and a map. I went to the front desk and asked Andrew if he had these items and within seconds, he provided all three. I thought for sure super glue wouldn't be something on hand but turns out, it was. On my last day, Mika arranged my transportation to the airport and also had my luggage held between check out time and the time I actually left. Not to mention the countless others who were very accommodating, as well. Everyone was just very friendly and it was very much appreciated. I look forward to staying at this hotel again in the future and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet, clean, comfortable and affordable place to stay in the city.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I chose this hotel due to price & location. Hotel rates were high during the U.S. Open, and I wanted to be away from the crowds at Times Square. Room was tiny but comfortable. Good shower. The standout was the service by Andrew, Erika, the lady who manned breakfast, and the security men. Very friendly, helpful, and polite. I travel a lot and was very impressed. Also nice was an enormous orange cat who greeted everyone at the entrance. Apparently, he lives next door. Had a nice lunch at Uncle Nick's Greek Diner at the hotel desk's suggestion. Wish there was a safe in the room. I walked to Central Park in the am vs. using the workout room, so I can't comment on it.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel is located on 28th Street, 7th Avenue and we found that it was a fantastic location. We were walking distance from the Empire State Building and in the night, we got some fantastic pictures of the building when we were walking back from dinner. The area is the flower district and though it was quite deserted when we returned at night, it was very safe and we had no problems at all. It is very close to Penn Station and found it convenient when we arrived by train from Washington DC. We sometimes walked to Times Square and found it quite close to Macy's too (when we did most of our shopping). There was free internet (always great) and free breakfast. The breakfast was ok but since it was complimentary, I would recommend it. On two mornings, we did not really make an attempt to get up in time for breakfast as we wanted some variety. The room was very nice and comfortable (huge shower). I must comment about one of the front desk staff, Andrew Alvarez, he was extremely polite and friendly and he welcomed us to the hotel. He was very cheerful and ever ready to help. He definitely deserves praise for his always bright and great attitude. On the whole, if the price was right, I would definitely consider returning.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I live in Manhattan. This stay was a "business retreat" for me to get out of my home office. The place is cozy, just like a small studio in Chelsea. The staff is extremely friendly. Make you feel like your in your own apartment building. Breakfast sun deck is amazing!
user_name:
HiDefLowCost
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We recently returned from NYC and had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. We arrived early on our first day (9 am) and although the room was not ready we were welcomed to enjoy their breakfast buffet. We later returned in the afternoon and we were very happy with the hotel room. It was bright, had a very nice NYC view and was very clean. We would have liked a fridge in our room but there were not enough for all the patrons of the hotel. We found the hotel very quiet but there was some street noise early the next morning. The complimentary breakfast is great. There was an assortment of cereals, bagels, fruit, English muffins, eggs, etc. and Starbucks coffees and tea. The woman who worked in that area was very pleasant and always welcomed us with a nice "Good Morning". Fresh coffee and tea as well as freshly baked cookies were available throughout the day. Heading out of the hotel you were surrounded by flowers and plants as this hotel is located in the flower wholesale district. Overall, I found the stay very pleasant and the hotel staff were always welcoming and polite. I would not hesitate to stay here again...I loved it!!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is located in the flower district which is actually kind of fun- in a New York way. the rooms are bigger than many, AC works well. Clean and comfortable. Breakfast up to par for a "free: breakfast . I do not hesitate to recommend it.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is in the Chelsea section of New York, and we were able to walk here from Penn Station. The street was less busy than the rest of New York, more like being in Brooklyn or Hoboken. There are several smaller hotels like this one on that same block, and even a florist down the street. Inside, the lobby was nice but small, the elevators in the center of the building, and in the back, a cafe where they served a pretty good breakfast and sometimes snacks. We checked into our room, and headed for the elevator. Rooms in New York are small, but this one didn't seem too bad. There was just enough room around the king size bed to walk, there was a small desk, a bureau, flat screen TV (lots of channels) and a fairly large bathroom. The best features of this hotel, it's new, inexpensive, and it's away from all of the craziness of New York -- but walking distance to just about everything. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Our room was on the 10th floor, across from the elevators. I thought the elevator noise would be a problem but it was not. Rooms are typical NYC small but comfortable and nicely arranged. Bathroom was a reasonable size. Good linens and very clean. Rooms were quiet.Location is on a busy street lined with wholesale florists, we drove by the entry the first time. There is a hotel parking zone in front for checking in, space for 2 cars only. The hotel offers $25 parking in a garage one block up on the left, remember to ask the hotel to stamp the garage receipt to get the discount rate. The breakfast buffet is very nice, toaster items, fruit, cereals and yogurt. Good coffee! The buffet area is around the corner from the lobby and you can sit in a nice green house area and enjoy your coffee.You can walk to the High Line from here and there is plenty of fun shopping along the way. Nice little hotel in a nice area.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Our room was nice & clean, very quiet, and recently updated. The breakfast area on the main floor was well-stocked and offered a variety of items. Having breakfast included was a nice perk! The staff was very friendly & courteous, too.Since the hotel is in the middle of the Chelsea wholesale flower market there are green & growing things along the sidewalks during the day, everything from bedding plants to large potted palms!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I had several issues with the hotel which led to the Poor rating.It is a New York City hotel without a room safe. Though I was on the 12th floor, there was plenty of noise. A lot of noise came from the a/c blower, too.Multiple billing issues concerning the room rate took a week to get squared away. Management pretends to be concerned (see all the feedback here on TripAdvisor) but they are less than sincere. Don't fall for it. The free breakfast is a roll and coffee. Don't expect much more than that. My room chair was broken and I couldn't get them to fix it. It was unsafe to sit on. It's a hard street to get a taxi on. Front staff was very unhelpful.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife & I were on a real tourist vacation this hotel was for us the ideal spot. right in the middle of any direction you want to go. subway is near by (one block). Everyday was an experience since you are in the flower district & the scent of flowers all over was amazing. The hotel not a big one but this is great. The desk clerks are well informed on were to go how to get there and in the easiest way for a tourist to do so BRAVO!!!! great breakfast by the way to. The Manager was nice enough to change our room from a no view to a nice upgrade with a view in the front of the hotel. we could see the empire state building from our room. at night the view was WOW!!!Rooms r clean, room service is good, all and all nothing bad to say about our stay there.We will go back for sure

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This hotel is located in the "flower district" of Chelsea. It's a great area. We stayed there in July, so each morning, as we walked to the subway (two blocks away )the street was full of flowers for sale. The hotel itself is very well run. The room is small -- like most rooms in Manhattan -- but the bed was large and comfortable, and the shower was enormous! They serve a nice breakfast -- included in the price; and there are computer avaiilable 24-hours, along with coffee, in the breakfast room.There is also a rooftop where you can go if you want to look at the stars over Manhattan.Excellent value for the price.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife and our two teenagers stayed here for 4 nights. I picked this hotel for the good rate and the breakfast included. It's a new place, so everything is in very good condition. The room was very small but had everything we needed. I insist, the room was very small, so that's what you should expect, a very small and a very nice and clean room. The staff was GREAT, they do have what the right service attitude. Breakfast was also good, nothing fancy but very good. The southamerican lady in charge of the kitchen and breakfast area made us feel at home. I didn't like the neighborhood but I did know where I was gooing, so no complaint about that. Close to subway stations. Our room had no view and I would guess most of the rooms in this buildng don't have it.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: What a shame that this new building was so poorly designed. The staff are warm, friendly, and helpful; the breakfast, while nothing special, was fresh and free and served with a smile; the place is clean and location is good. But the rooms are so tiny that I won't return. To give you an idea: the ice bucket and coffee maker are stored in the closet because there is no other place to put them--no countertop or end table or anything. Something as simple as substituting a queen instead of king bed in the room would have helped. Oh, and the window air cond unit rattled endlessly. Another bad (money saving?) design fault.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed here for one night on business, 7/13/11. Smallish room, but right for the price during tourist season. Stylish - flat screen TV actually had a high def feed for channels with that content. Good water pressure and very clean. High speed internet very functional. Quiet quiet quiet - a plus in the city. Front desk friendly and responsive upon check in and coming back and forth. Appears to be new construction from what surrounds it. Cool new feature - just wave your key card at the reader; you need not insert the card. Comfortable bed. I'd stay here again, for sure.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: One can never go wrong with any property in the Marriott family of brands. Predictably clean, well maintained and competent staff.This was inexpensive by Manhattan standards but in a convenient location on the west side of Manhattan. Felt safe walking around at night. Close to subway. Decent and clean room. All that, plus I got Marriott points.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Easy walk from New York's Penn Station with NJ Transit, LIRR, and Amtrak located there. NJ Transit offers an inexpensive connection from Newark Liberty Airport to Penn Station. Subway is at end of block from hotel. Super friendly and helpful staff from warm cookies and bottled water to help with restaurants and transportation. Breakfast is included and is more than adequate. WiFi is free. Bathroom is very small but modern with a walk-in shower and plenty of storage. Bedroom is more than roomy enough, especially by NYC standards. We had a very comfortable king-size bed with desk, large dresser, end tables, and desk chair. No extra seating except the desk chair. The closet was small but had plenty of hangers. We were on the front side and had a view of the Empire State Building. The street is very quiet. It is the 'Flower District' and by day all the sidewalks are bordered by trees, plants, and flowers.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I am very pleased with this hotel and that is saying a LOT. I would be happy to stay here again. The hotel appears to be either fairly new or recently renovated, and the rooms are laid out very well with modern furniture, modern bathroom fixtures, and excellent bedding. It has a modern urban feel to it which is my personal taste. There is a free breakfast that is quite healthy, with careful selection (juice, fruit, cereals, milk, Starbucks coffee, bagels, hard boiled eggs, etc. The staff are attentive and very helpful. The location is extremely convenient for me personally, but of course you need to make that decision for yourself. There is free wifi everyplace in the building. This is a BIG DEAL nowadays, where not just your computer but your smart phone and your tablet computer all function better on wifi than 3G. I am tempted to offer 5 stars but for several considerations:1. The rooms are small. This is OK with me, but maybe not for everyone.2. They had an accident and misplaced my laundry for a day, which put a serious dent in my weekend attire. They were apologetic and this appeared to be an unusual situation.3. While convenient to me, the location is on a block that is industrial during the day and dark after working hours. It is close to some VERY active nightlife areas but not directly in one.I want to underscore that this is not a fancy business hotel. Overall, highly recommended.
user_name:
Yalel
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Highly recommended! The reception was very nice, helpful and very pleasant. They were nice enough to let us did an early check-in when we arrived 9ish asking for a parking spot. I like how they were able to provide a portable crib for my 1 year old! The complimentary breakfast actually had variety option, and there were staffs standing by to refill the drinks and foods. They even notify you when they are closing up, what a nice gesture.The complimentary coffee, tea, and chocolate are just there for you to fill in any time you want, since we went there to visit a friend, we were able to use their breakfast area to chat with a nice cup of tea on our hands (after dinner, and my husband was upstairs in the room with our baby)The room is clean and we feel comfortable enough to let our little one to claw on the floor, this is one of the reason we were willing to pay a little bit more for the hotel. Subway station is in walking distance. Whole Food Market is also within walking distance, MacDonald is right beside if you don't like the breakfast provided by the hotel.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Used our points at this hotel. Front desk staff was super friendly and informative (needed help shopping). Everyday I went downstairs, they recognized me and said hello. Rooms are NY size small but clean and modern. Right in between the subway lines= awesome location!

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The Manager of this hotel and the staff are trained pros. I had a problem with my reservation, and the young woman at the front desk took it upon herself to address my issue. She dealt expertly with my problem, and she was so kind, patient, calm and lovely. The Manager also acted swiftly to solved my problem. All of the staff I encountered were excellent. The room was clean and smelled good. The sheets were crisp. I would go back here in a second. Thank you, wonderful staff at Chelsea Fairfield Inn & Suites.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was my third stay at this hotel this year, and I will be back twice more this summer. It's now the first property I check when planning a trip to New York. It is far superior to brands with undeservedly better reputations.The rooms are compact but well-designed to maximize space. The furnishings are top quality, worthy of a much pricier hotel. In particular, the bed and linens are very comfortable.The central location makes it easy to catch the subway or grab a taxi. The flower shops on 28th display their plants and flowers on the sidewalk nearby, making the exterior ambience very lush and garden-like. Plus, there are a few cafe tables and chairs in front of the hotel to relax with a cup of coffee.There is a small exercise room but that's it as amenities go but that's to be expected at a Fairfield Inn. I don't visit Manhattan to stay in the hotel.Finally, the front desk staff is very professional. In particular, Andrew is very warm and charming, quick with a welcoming smile. Though it had been several weeks, he remembered my name and the show I saw on my last visit. He was also knowledgeable about the hottest exhibits at the museums (on this visit, Alexander McQueen at the Met).If you're driving, validated parking is only $25 for 24 hours, quite a bargain in NYC. It's only 1/2 block away. The staff always ask to validate your parking at check-in to make sure that it's not overlooked at check-out (and to allow express check-out if that's your preference).

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chelsea operates with the attention to detail and personal service consistent with many of the more expensive boutique hotels in the city. The central location, clean and updated rooms, and courteous staff make it a tremendous value whether traveling for business or pleasure. My fiance and I were traveling to New York to look for an apartment and arrived early on a Tuesday morning (at 8:00 a.m. - well before the afternoon check-in time). We had expected to just drop off our luggage, but were warmly greeted by the staff and invited in to the dining area for a hot breakfast (a welcome invitation after starting our day at 3:00 a.m. that morning). When we returned that evening after an exhausting day of touring apartment buildings and New York neighborhoods, we were again greeted with complementary wine and cookies. The staff all gathered around to hear about our day as though we were old friends and poured us a second glass as we shared the details of our day. They seemed as genuinely excited as we were. These were small touches that made an incredible difference for our trip. The rooms were very comfortable and appeared to be recently updated. They were a decent size by New York standards and very clean with all the amenities you'd expect in the best managed Marriott hotels. The general manager was a fixture in the lobby throughout the day and likely deserves much of the credit for leading such an apparently well run hotel.
user_name:
cweppes
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: My wife & I stayed for a Saturday in NYC and were able to checkin early and store bags for our later departure. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous! The location is excellent---walking distance to Penn Station. Rooms though are very small....basically "a bed & a shower." But appropriate for NYC. Breakfast is a nice setting and warm cookies were available in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Have just stayed twice over a 2 week period in this hotel. Very central, Buffet breakfast suited us although didnt try the microwabeable food not too keen on that. First visit our room was a little small, but we were upgraded after 1st night. Staff were extremely helpful, everytime we returned from our day out they would ask us how it was and where we had been, they were interested rather than the normal polite feeling olbiged to ask. Andre the manager was brilliant also Andrew and the other guy who I think was Dan and also the girls, will definitely stay there again. My husband does alot of business in the US and always stays in Marriots but even he said the staff were brilliant.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The rooms here are very nice (updated, clean and not a bad size for NYC) and the location is great. The lack of customer service my entire trip was very disappointing though (no rooms ready at check in, multiple times there was no staff at the desk, no valet or doorman to help with bags, etc.). During the check in process the woman behind the desk even stopped several times to text on her cell phone. Other reviews of the hotel are very positive so maybe I just got the staff on an off week but I definitely won't be staying there again to see if the service improves.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I just wanted to echo what a lot of the people have said recently about this property. The hotel is fairly new and even though the rooms are small, they are very well designed to maximize the use of the limited space. Staff was extremely cheery and helpful which highlighted the trip. The location can't be beat and the smell of all the flowers and plants from the shops around the hotel is really nice first thing in the morning. One minor issue was that the alarm clock in the vacant next room went off at 6:00 AM one morning and totally disrupted any hopes of slightly sleeping in; but that's not really the hotel's fault but it does show that the walls aren't too thick. Having siad that, I would have no hesitation staying here again given the right price. One final thing...the $25 a night rate for parking is a relative steal for the area.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: Stayed 6 nights as a treat for daughter's 18th birthday. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. Rooms are quite small but very well set out and equipped. Bathrooms good with large walk-in shower, vanity unity, plenty of towels. Beds very comfortable. Only a few rooms on each floor so very little disturbance from other guests etc. We found the included breakfast to be a real bonus - saved a lot of time each morning looking for places to eat. Juices, fresh fruit, yoghurts, pastries, toast, eggs, etc. Tea and coffee available all day. Cookies at reception too! Great location in the Chelsea flower market area, near two subway stations so easy journeys uptown and downtown. Plenty of local shops, delis etc. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely like to return.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We came into town to watch a Yankees game and eat a wonderful steak house. Were able to do both and this hotel was perfect. Central location to other friends who lived in the city and we'd go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Andrew at the front counter was terrific. Understands hospitality and was extremely professional.
user_name:
TwiddyandCompany
Outer Banks of North Carolina

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We visited NYC on April 16, 2011 to see a couple of Broadway shows (The Addams Family and Billy Elliott. Both were very good, but I liked the former better, but that's for another review.) For 30,000 Marriott points, my out of pocket cost at this hotel was zero. Because we checked into the hotel early, our upper floor room was not ready, so we agreed to stay in Room 207 on the second floor. Room 207 was absolutely the smallest hotel room I had ever seen. It was smaller than my office. My estimate of the room size, not counting the bathroom, is 8 feet by 12 feet. (Maybe Andre can provide the exact dimensions when he sees this review.) From what I can tell, all of the rooms are situated around the two elevators. I can only assume that this is the smallest room size in the hotel and that my reserved room would have been larger. Perhaps Andre can arrange for a partial credit of some Marriott points back into my account.I must say that I was able to sleep later than I had over the past year or so. This room was very quiet since it is situated on the backside of 28th street as opposed to being on the front side. My wife said that she heard the elevators every time they stopped on our floor, but I did not hear a thing. The mattress was very comfortable too.Because the hotel has been in operation since December 2010, according to what I was told by one of the hotel staff, everything was in fine working order and the room was very clean. The room had a nice high def TV, probably about 42 inches or so.This room is fine for a one night stand, or if you're in NYC for business, this room will do. The breakfast that comes with the room is one of the best of seen for this type of arrangement. The breakfast room is very nicely laid out and a good place to hang out at the end of the night before retiring to the room. There's a nice large flat screen TV and two computers available to use at no charge. The location is not bad either. Its an easy walk up to Times Square and the Theatre District. Or, if you're lazy you can take the subway which is only a block away. Make sure to pick up some flowers or plants right outside the front door of the hotel as there are plenty to choose from.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had to spend the night in NY as we were taking a cruise the next day. As luck would have it, our Amtrak train from BWI was delayed as all rail traffic was between Washington DC and New York. We had no choice but to drive into the city.We paid for this hotel using our Marriott points. The location was on a relatively quiet street, but since it was a Fairfield, there was no designated space to temporarily park your car to unload the luggage. So a deluge of honks erupted as we tried to get our bags out of the trunk. No valet, no doorman, no nothin. To be expected since this Marriott property falls into the value category, but when you are in NY things like this matter. Had we paid for the night it would have been close to $300 which is highway robbery.After finding a cart and unloading the luggage, I wheeled it into the tiny lobby and my husband drove down the street to park the car (several blocks). The rates were not bad for NY. It wasn't their garage, but with a stamp from the front desk, you ended up paying $30/night. Since the hotel was new, it was very clean and modern. The room was small but very nicely decorated. There was no tub, but not being a bath person, I appreciated the larger walk in shower. The breakfast room was great and they had a nice selection for a continental even having some pre-wrapped egg sandwiches to nuke for your enjoyment. I had woken up early and headed to the McDonald's at the corner for coffee so we only enjoyed some fruit from the small buffet.All in all, this was a very decent property, but for the rates????? We have enjoyed so many nice hotels on our visits to NY that had so many more amenities for the price. I guess the economy must be bouncing back, at least in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed 3 nights. This Chelsea location is short 5 block walk to Bolt Bus drop-off spot (DC, Phily, Boston) at 33 St & 7th Ave (Penn Station area). Lovely wholesale flower markets adorn 28th St by hotel. Quiet street & quiet rooms. New hotel. High style. Breakfast included in price. Starbucks coffee/tee/hot chocolate available anytime, Easy walk to Times Square, Grand Central, NYC Library.Highly recommend walk to High Line (10th Ave & 21 St.). Enchanting. New section will open June, 2011. Brilliant design.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: As others have said, this is a good, modern hotel with excellent service. Major problem I encountered, however, was with the bathroom door. To get to the sink in my room XX02 one must squeeze against the toilet, close the large door and then approach the sink! The reverse is true to exit the bathroom. Problem is the door is hinged on the right whereas it should have been hinged on the left (or open outwards). Not sure why this hasn't been fixed. Also not sure why the arm on the desk chair is falling off for lack of tightening a screw. The only other area that could be improved in the room (not bathroom) lighting which was very poor even with all lamps on.  But for NYC this is a good hotel choice. It's convenient although don't be fooled by the "Chelsea" in the name. Despite two similar hotels on the block, the neighborhood is far from genteel, at least not yet. The plant stores are closed at night and the streets are quite desolate. But you can walk to Herald Square, Penn Sta, etc. so it's OK

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I got this room for a pretty good rate and have nothing but good things to say. I arrived on my check in day at 9am and asked for an early check-in as I had a conference call I needed to take with my boss. They couldn't get us in a room but gave us an office to use and have our call - now that's service!!The front desk is very friendly, the rooms are clean and spacious, the view is supurb, the location is AWESOME!!!, the free breakfast is great. I have only two ridiculous negatives - 1. The hair dryer doesn't get very hot and 2. the front doors are glass and the elevators show what floor you go to, which can be seen through the street. I had to push a lot of elevator and make some unnecessary stops so no one would know what floor I was on...I'm probably paranoid, but do not want a stranger to know where I am sleeping.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: The hotel itself was great - it's still quite new, so the rooms were spotless. The room was pretty small, even by NYC standards, but the bed was comfortable, there was a flat-screen TV, and the bathroom was great. Plenty of hot water! We could see the Empire State Building from the window, which was great, although you could also see right into a bunch of apartments across the street. There was free breakfast, which is always a plus. Everyone who worked there was pleasant and helpful, and we didn't hear any street noise on the 10+ floor.My only complaints refer to the neighborhood - we took a taxi home around 12am, and had to wait in traffic on 28th St (coming from 9th Ave) because cops had blocked the street outside some nightclub, and it looked pretty scary. In the morning, there were a ton of homeless people wandering around 28th St. This is not the neighborhood to stay in with small children or for a first visit to the city. However, for the business traveler, or someone who won't be hanging around the neighborhood, it's fine. Also, I have come to NYC a lot for many years, so this isn't a tourist's naive opinion. In summary, great, new, clean hotel, small but comfortable. Hotel A-, neighborhood C-.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: WONDERFUL hotel located near Empire State Building. Room are new (SHOWERS are unbelievably fantastic) but rooms are usual small New York City size. Staff is truly amazing and helpful. Breakfast typical Fairfield style. NOISY in morning for some reason with horns blaring in streets BUT that's typical New York also. Neighborhood is filled with flower shops and a McDonalds on corner of 28th and 6th is convenient for snacks. Easy walk to Times Square via 6th Ave & Broadway. If you want to be near Empire State Building area, this is a true gem.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We had a double/double with 3 people - 2 adults and 1 teenager. The Fairfield Inn Chelsea was very clean, the staff is very professional every time I made a request (on Friday night 1/28-1/29, Daniel, i believe was his name at the front desk, was very helpful, cordial and persistent to ensure we were properly accomodated with parking as we arrived extremely late). The room was small, as I expect in New York, but it was very clean, insulated from noise, and the hotel was centally located for us to get to Times Square and Soho/Tribeca with minimal cab fares. It's nice to wake up to have the option of eating breakfast, albeit continental. This is the second Fairfield in that I've stayed in (the other was in Manhattan/Times Square) and neither of them disappointed. Also thanks for the NO PET policy! I for one am appreciative.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This was really a great hotel. We went for 2 nights and could not have asked for anything better. This is a great place to stay, close to the N, R, 1, 2, & 3 trains, rooms are clean, very friendly staff and a pretty decent breakfast in the morning. One bad thing....there is only one ice machine in the hotel and it is in LL level (we stayed on the 16th floor) so it is a bit of an elevator ride just to get some ice. The roof terrace is nice...great view of the city and the Empire State Building. As I said, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful...it was really the best part of the stay. Always willing to give directions or recommendations. We even got a phone call 5 mins after checking in just to make sure the room was up to par. The Marriott is doing a great job with these employees!Overall, no real complaints about this place. Perfect for a weekend getaway.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this hotel, especially given that the rate was so competitive and I've learned the hard way over the years that the old adage "you get what you pay for" is so very true in NYC. It was like a little W-Lite in the heart of Chelsea, a clean, comfortable, affordable, stylish hotel that almost feels boutique, but has the standard Marriott-brand touches. The staff was friendly and helpful, the complimentary breakfast more than ample and the free wi-fi is always welcome. One note for any business travelers or travelers who need to work in the room like I did: The room set-up is not that condusive to working, the LED lighting is not that bright (I had to call down to have 2 extra lamps sent into the room) and the desk is that comfortable or conveniently located, at least in my room. Still for the price it's an incredible value in NY.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: We stayed at the Fairfield Chelsea for 3 nights over Christmas. This place was fantastic. It is very conveniently located on the corner of 28th and 6th. This made for a very short trip to Madison Square Garden and was also convenient to Times Square. The hotel is brand new. The rooms are very well appointed. They are fairly small but not as small as other places we have stayed in NYC. We stayed in a room with a king bed. There was also a nice unit on the opposite wall that was a desk, a dresser (with 8 drawers!) and it held the flat screen TV. The bathroom was beautiful with gorgeous fixtures. We had a great view of the Empire State building from our room. We were on the 11th floor and had no issue with noise.The folks at the front desk were always helpful and always cheerful. The breakfast was fine and the breakfast room was bright and cheery.I would definitely stay here again. (PS. Don't miss going to the Ginger House Chinese restaurant 1 block away on 7th Avenue. Delicious!)

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: I stayed for one night at the Fairfield Inn and Suites in Chelsea. This was an amazing value for Manhattan. the hotel is located 3 blocks from a PATH train entrance and just a few additional blocks to Manhattan Mall, Penn Station and Macys, making it an ideal location for shoppers. The lobby is small and basic, so I can imagine it could get crowded during a check-in rush, but it was not when we got there. The front desk staff was very friendly and our multiple calls for additional blankets and were handled quickly and professionally. We stayed in the king suite (the other option was a suite with 2 double beds). The suite was huge, especially by NYC standards with 2 bathrooms and a small pull out coach in the sitting area. Plenty of room for the 3 adukts and 1 child we traveled with. A continental breakfast is served in the am with cereals, muffins, coffee and the like. Very happy with this stay and would stay again if we need a suite.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a good value hotel for Manhattan. The hotel is new, clean and the staff were able to accommodate me by holding my luggage prior to check-in (I arrived early.) The room had a king sized bed. NY standards for hotel rooms are smaller but other hotel provide a dresser and a place to put your suitcase. This one does not. The room needs to be more cleverly designed so that there is a place to put your stuff. So this was downside. Not a huge one though. On the upside, everything in the hotel worked well. Free WiFi is great. The breakfast area is quite nice with a decent spread. I liked very much that the breakfast area is used informally I think as a place to have a cup of coffee in the afternoon. Overall, a good enough place.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Chelsea
review_body: This is a new hotel that just opened on December 6, 2010. I checked in yesterday and wanted to share my review of the hotel.The hotel is located on the same block of W. 28th Street as the Hotel Indigo and Hilton Garden Inn amidst many wholesale florists. The lobby is fairly small with just a few chairs. I was greeted warmly by the front desk clerk. As a Gold, I inquired about an upgrade and snagged an Executive King on the 16th Floor. The hotel has 18 floors plus a penthouse.The room is better than average size for NYC. The decor is quite attractive with light brown (sand) wallpaper and carpeting and black furniture.It also has a large sliding glass "balcony" door which spans from the floor to within a foot of the ceiling. Unfortunately, you can only open this door about a foot. Their is no actual balcony, only a metal railing to protect you from falling. Nevertheless, the door allows in plenty of light to make the room seem bigger plus a great view of the Empire State Building.The closet and bathroom are small, but the glass shower stall is large enough for two people. The shower stall is fully enclosed, unlike some other new hotels with a half a door. The vanity is made of black stone with copper flecks (as is the work desk). There is plenty of room for toiletries on the vanity and on both sides of the cabinet below.The bed was very comfortable. I noticed some street noise but not any noise from the hall or nearby rooms.The TV is a 37-inch Philips flat screen with 39 channels, none of which were available in HD. I would expect a lot more channels and HDTV in a new hotel! The work desk is large and free wired and wireless internet is available. You do need to get a password from the front desk to connect.There is a fitness center and vending machines on the lower level. Breakfast is served from 7 AM to 10 AM on the lobby level. Typical Fairfield Inn continental breakfast items. But please avoid the ham and cheese quiche. It was dreadful - the ham was gray, not pink!Right now, the hotel is a great value with rates under $200 for low demand periods.All in all, the new hotel is quite nice with only a few disappointments. My letter grade rating: B+.
